7fOcMWmJiakcEtauusKYIw.text: This place has great guacamole, salsa and amazing Mexican food to. The view feels like your in Italy watching the gondolas. Food and service is 5 star

wJqydhm7ldHseWPVOii5Og.text: Service was good, the food was ok but over priced. The fish tacos were boring. Wouldn't gi back again. Definitely not  $70 lunch.

ZQi4gaVDYcuBNwD6rg3wlw.text: Hungry and craving Mexican food in the Venetian? This is a pretty good place to go. The portions are big and the restaurant itself is nice. It is right next to the canal so you can wave at the gondolas going by.   I agree with the other guy. The food was solid.  We ordered the carne asada tacos which came with 3 tacos and a side of rice and beans. It was good, but we weren't raving over it. THE POSOLE THOUGH. It was my first time having Posole (I was surprised it was green) and it was really tasty. My friend knows her food and she loved it as well. We kept wanting to go back for more Posole, but didn't have the chance to.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Tacos  &amp; Pozole/posole

7gqCOZIEBcU2bd2IM7wRKA.text: Initially, was relatively prompt. Drinks were the only good part of the meal.  Went downhill fast. Food arrived... eventually. Crab salad I'm told was good, but the other 2 dishes were very bland and the meat was incredibly tough. Considered reordering but frankly  don't have tone for that noise.  I just stopped eating in favor of getting something elsewhere.  Seriously.  $23 for fajitas? Better be some good damn fajitas. Get it right the first time. Oh and check arrived before everyone was done eating. Second star is for the drinks and salad, and the server wasn't quite as apathetic as the others I saw there. Will not be back or recommend at all.

yi0e-34Ta4hulAfh6Sl1yg.text: Ishmael was great at offering suggestions but the meal arrived in record SLOW time.  He did check on us right after it was served, but did not ensure that the food arrived on time.  Instead he sold me One shot 1942 Don Julio for $20.  It was great but inflated the bill. Debbie had the Quesadilla and I had the Caesar salad.  We split each one and still could not finish the meal.  But the ambience with the gondolas driving by, was worth the price.  Wouldn't trade a minute of it looking into her eyes throughout the meal. Well recommended for food quality but not the service.

fPO9UjtsVdMm9ZsazS4UkQ.text: Worst service EVER!  They bartenders would rather talk to each other all day then serve a single drink!  I guess it's off to the next bar to quench the thirst. Uugggh!

355NRzZ5OBIoU7REn7nWKw.text: looking at all the reviews, either we were in vegas on the wrong weekend or this place is just not that good. we went with our wedding party to eat here, it was about 9 of us. The place is sooo pretty. Drinks were sooooo good. But the food was terrible. i had the Pollo con Mole Poblano, i sent it back, it was waaay over cooked, it was soooo dry, the rice was ok but i couldnt eat the chicken at all. zero flavor, i didnt even bother ordering anything else, my fiance had the Shrimp Burrito, it was soooo good, we just shared his meal. My best friend had the Fajitas Tejanas, the chicken was dried, the meat was tough and over cooked and she had waaay more veggies then anything else. The bride and her mother had the Shrimp & Mussels Moqueca, they did not like it, i was told it was not good but we were all hungry so we ate. Oh i did have the Manchego Spinach Salad - Baby spinach, sliced Spanish Manchego cheese, smoked bacon, shredded green apples, chipotle-bacon vinaigrette. that salad was amazing. only thing that was good for me was the salad.

gv4V1wGGICoKT5eUXT9WeA.text: Starting off a little bad I went for breakfast and was five minutes and couldn't order it at all because I couldn't get sat quick enough. Instead of breakfast I started with a Calamari & Shrimp Cocktail that was extremely good and very spicy! And I usually prefer the kick so I was surprised. The fajitas were extremely juicy and tender. The rice was okay, a little bland but overall very great meal!

k7_QnQTeV_IQeQ9FhcFSBg.text: 5 STARS: BEST FLAUTAS IN THE WORLD!  If you have ever ate flautas, you know that they are fried which makes them crunchy on the outside with different filings on the inside-almost like a taquito. Anyway, the faults here are perfectly fried with not too much crunch-it doesn't hurt the rook of you mouth when you bite into it AND the filling inside with the different dipping sauces are amazing.  The food is very reasonably priced for Vegas and being in the Canal Shops.  Our server was very nice and attentive.  Lastly, the BEST part about this restaurant is the location. Should you decide to try this yummy establishment, be sure to request a table alongside the actual canal where they are performing the gondola rides. Huge plus is you get to hear the gondola singers while you enjoy your mexican food.   Great experience and so fun!

9ifwZhlnEGlyq12FgJj8Og.text: Really good service as well as dishes and drinks at Happy HOur. The staff was extremely nice and helpful; moreover, very patient with us.  Dish: Chile Relleno -- Yes, 6/10 for a good solid dish Drink: Bloody Mary -- 4/10, its alright... I'll pass Fast and decent food. I would come here if I was hungry in the area.  Pros: Quality and staff Cons: Price for dishes are a little on the high side.  STARS: 3.75

LjxtJP-OM5_w0F2u4VUj0g.text: Great place and great food! Located in the Grand Canal Shops of The Venetian, overlooking the gondola rides. My boyfriend and I ordered chips with salsa and guacamole (sooo good). He got something with fish and spinach, which he liked. I got the chorizo gorditas that were really filling and delicious. We'll be back for Happy Hour next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yumm!

A2pOV2NRz2Nm9GZ1LTcr1Q.text: Unexpected - very good!  Usually Vegas Strip restaurants are over priced, over hyped with mediocre food - but - Canonita is one I'll return to.  Good Mexican food, good service.

s3h9sy4BWV77vr9h8de-7g.text: Stopped by the other day for happy hour. Enjoyed some great carne asada and tres leches. Our waitress Brooke was super awesome! I'll be requesting her again! Really enjoyed her recommendation!!

e9snzQhAJM_ACZfDSvnUdA.text: Deeelish! I was unsure at first becuse it was a sort of fusion mixed Mexican food but it was so tasty! We have a group of small kids and adults. Everyone was satisfied. The it was light and filling. Enchiladas were excellent and they had vegetarian portion which are hard to find is Vegas. As a sort of picky eater myself, it's top notch,grade A. Good selection of foods.

zhJaY4gNTzov3YRFT_jhAQ.text: I stopped by this restaurant to grab a few drinks after a long day at work. This restaurant is conveniently located close to the entrance of the Grand Canal Shoppes in The Venetian Resort. The restaurant is unique with it being one of only a few restaurants that offer seating along and prime views of the Grand Canal inside the resort. We decided to sit at the bar. I was addressed by the bartender in a way that I did not appreciate and was not politically correct for lack of better words. The comment was based on my appearance. Even after standard business practices like checking a guest's ID to verify qualifications about someone like age, the bartender continued to address me in a way that was obviously not accurate. I was very embarrassed by this as I was put in a very awkward and uncomfortable position of deciding whether or not to address it or ignore it. I was embarrassed as the company I was with definitely noticed and heard the comments. I felt that the intention to incorrectly address me was not malicious but it was definitely ignorant and pretty much ruined my experience here. It's unfortunate because the cocktails were decent. Rare and impactful guest issues like this unfortunately leave little opportunity for guest recovery and needless to say I will not be returning nor recommending this restaurant to anyone in the future.

bf_W1mPD-9KjJVFKvDxoIw.text: Jerry was the best server!!! He was so nice. Food was excellent. The margarita flight was awesome.

CaJNCv49ZeDycFNnHz1-Rw.text: What a gem! We came across Canonita while shopping at the Grand Canal Shops at the Palazo.   The management, staff and chefs were amazing! We weren't sure if we wanted to sit and eat so they brought us menus to look over while we watched the chef make corn tortillas by hand. The manager saw us staring at the chef and brought us two fresh hot tortillas to have. That sold us! They were so delicious and the people were so nice we decided to sit down.   They have a great happy hour! $5 drinks! We got two each of the RumChata and the PassionFuit Margarita. Both delicious drinks!! You have to like Horchata to like the Rumchata.   The food was delicious!!    The Barbacoa was melt in your mouth amazing with the sauces and the tender pork! Oh I dream about that dish! It also came with the house made tortillas, which we were in love with! Which was paired perfectly with the Spinach and Manchengo salad. Loved every bite!   It is located right on the end of the canal towards one end of the shops. You are away from the public but get a great serenade by the gondoliers every time one of them float by.  The space is large and has patio-esque seating. (Where you think you are outside but aren't really.)   I would love to go back here! Kudos to the staff and the servers! All amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blurry photo of the Santa Rosa Pork Barbacoa. Can&#39;t tell you how amazing this dish was! Order it!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade corn tortillas!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and manchengo cheese salad! Lovely!

QxJ2GVYBmZwq8Mu4hT5iQQ.text: Nice place to eat. Seated us quickly, even without a reservation.  Our waiter, Pablo, took good care of us.

BTOBweA7G1mF0g4Mz-_H_w.text: Birthday Dinner was held here a few days ago and it was a beautiful evening well spent!   Drinks and chips and salsa were already waiting for my arrival (True friends there)  and the view was absolutely amazing facing the grand canal shops and gondolas.   We ordered from the food menu:  Shrimp tacos (super flavorful)  Mushroom Enchiladas (awesome sauce - even for the non vegetarian)  Steak Skirt (juicy and very well marinated)   Dranks!:  Pineapple express  Strawberry Lemondrop  And the Mojito frito ( i thought it was a watermelon/raspberry mojito instead it is a taster of 3 .. Regular / Raspberry / Watermelon ) Hey this works too! So yum!  Red beer and a pitcher since it was still happy hour   Service was great & I wish I had remembered the young ladies name, because she def deserves some creds. She was amazing with her food suggestions and was always around at the right moments to refill our drinks and just be present for our needs.   Would definitely come back especially for those mojitos and enchiladas!

EDX970SNTU8C_YlikdzMlA.text: Coming from Texas I'm skeptical of the Mexican food I get elsewhere. This place hits the spot w a solid Barbacoa dish and ask for a side of grilled pineapple salsa!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork shoulder cooked in a banana leaf

TTU6WYSWZo2ZZXd1Ro0SmA.text: My Uncle and Cousin were in town for a trade-show, and I met up with them to give a quick tour and grab some late lunch before their flight back to California.  I was going to take them to Bouchon, but only the Oyster Bar was opened at that time of the day.  Anyway, I enjoyed the appetizer we ordered: Queso Fundido - their exclusive blend of cheeses, manchego, asadero, monterrey jack & cilantro, melted in a cazuela (cast iron dish) & served w/ fresh hand made flour tortillas.  The cheese blend was alright (not great and not terrible) but the homemade flour tortillas were really good (which was almost like a fresh out of the oven pita bread-ish thin puck of yumminess).  I also ordered their "Santa Rosa Barbacoa de Puerco" - Marinated pork slowly roasted in a banana leaf, served with cilantro rice, black beans & a chipotle barbecue sauce.   The pork was definitely very tender and went well with the chipotle sauce. The combination of the beans, pork, sauce and cilantro rice in one bite was superb.   Only thing that can make this better is the plate presentation, because it looks like the presentation style of your average Mexican fare (from taco trucks to mom & pop diners).  Would I order this again? Yes.  What didn't impressed me was the dessert that my cousin ordered, which was the "Corn Creme Brulee" - sweet corn custard with seasonal fruits. It was your average creme brulee that pretty much any pastry arts student can prepare after taking a Baking class in any of the local culinary programs.  And the "seasonal fruits" is one single solitary raspberry covered up by a sprig of mint. (A+ for driving down your food cost on this item)  In summary, the food we ordered for the most part were tasty (of course I didn't tried their tacos, which seems to have a few negative reviews), the service we received was good, plate presentation is definitely not going to win any medals or awards, perceived value for the meal and experience is average.  Would I come back for more?  Yes. But I will for sure skip their dessert offerings and head over to Bouchon Bakery.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn Crème Brûlée - sweet corn custard with seasonal fruits.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Santa Rosa Barbacoa de Puerco - Marinated pork slowly roasted in a banana leaf, served with cilantro rice, black beans &amp; a chipo

yax_3_T-hH1NtL_Xg1li1Q.text: Probably one of the worst experiences I've had at a restaurant at the venetian. Firstly, the tall hostess with short brown hair was obviously in a pissy mood. When we asked for a specific table with a good view she made it seems like it was such an issue. Not what I want to be greeted with. Then our food was slow to come out even though we just ordered the fish tacos and a shrimp cocktail. The tortillas were flavorless and basically fell apart in my hands. The fish was Talapia which I should have known not to order since it's the cheapest fish a resturant could buy. Lastly, this place claims it's "Mexican soul food" which makes no sense. By definition soul food is traditional African American cuisine so what the heck? I really would only recommend for drinks with a good view of the canal.

yODLqWjWMTrAwvT_vM-M3A.text: Pleasantly surprised. Although not on the menu, I managed to order a spicy margarita. This is one of the best margaritas I've every had. For this spice loving girl, it came across powerfully spicy while still maintaining a margarita taste.  The pork barbacoa was a hearty well seasoned portion that properly pulled apart with ease. The salsa was a perfect slightly spicy thin consistency. Only the gauc and lack of tinga style chicken knocked this review down.

vi8avz2t4cJ8hGOjMsnZ5w.text: Food was just ok here, the best part was the chips, salsa and guacamole. We ordered pineapple margaritas that would've been better if the sour mix was toned down a bit. You really miss the pineapple taste because the citrus from the sour mix overwhelmed it. We ordered the carne asada, chile relleno and cheese enchiladas. They were all just ok. The service was very good, the food just needs improvement.

xQIbwTQtr9PECy3yX-tvuw.text: This is a decent Mexican restaurant with great staff and a relaxed environment. We had some wonderful beef enchiladas and a nice dining exerience.

x2DY2GSrt9FU5fggE1-Ddg.text: I work at the Venetian canal shoppes and have lunch here occasionally always at the bar they have an amazing staff all very helpful and warm right when you come in to the very end food is always done fast their bartenders are amazing! Always great conversations. Their appetizer flautas are to die for that's what I always have and by the end of my meal I'm always stuffed great fast lunch and I usually go under peak hours and even then it's quick! Definitely a great place to have lunch or dinner and a fun time either alone or with friends. They have happy hour from 3-6 and 9pm-close very convenient!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Couldn&#39;t wait to dig in lol! Chicken flautas and chips and salsa. Their salsa is to die for cilantro infused! YUMMM!

lJeBWL30SLaYOv1ydxtA8w.text: What an anniversary dinner! Drinks were good and food was perfect! We ordered the chips and spicy salsa for appetizers.  Salsa had an amazing flavor and a kick to it. Tacos were seasoned well and Tres Leches...cake was heavenly. The view of gondolas along with service makes it a 5 star restaurant.

5ah5fyCgpkQ-a2HnVGGicA.text: Let me start by saying that I don't really care for the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes.  When I'm in Las Vegas I don't care to spend time wandering around a mall, especially one so big that I've gotten lost more than once (sad but True).  There's only one thing that keeps me visiting the Grand Canal Shoppes, and that's Taqueria Canonita.  This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas, so I seek them out whenever I can.  I've never had a bad dish on the menu, though my favorite is the Tres Tacos.   Served with black beans and cilantro rice, you just cannot go wrong with any of their taco varieties.  I can't even pick a favorite, they are all good.    Taqueria Canonita also makes some tasty, tasty margaritas.   For Cinco de Mayo they had a special margarita that involved Serrano peppers that was amazing.  If there isn't a good special going on, The Canonita Margarita, made with Patron, is also a favorite.  You just cannot go wrong with Patron!  Just watch out because those suckers will sneak up on you!  Whether you sit on the "patio" along the canal or in the bar, this place is always fun.  The one and only reason they don't get 5 stars is because the restroom is located outside the restaurant in the Grand Canal Shoppes food court, which after a few shots of Patron is not exactly ideal.  Still, I'll let it slide and I look forward to visiting them again next time I'm in Las Vegas!

204DIne-hUpNrzjIGa6-5w.text: Amazing food and flavor, service/staff are fun and helpful, excellent tequila selection, food came out fast with excellent presentation. I couldn't find something to complain about if I wanted to. Highly recommend the Duck Relleno! Wow!

1EaSzLpa1BHXgop28fz97w.text: A delicious Mexican restaurant overlooking a river in an Italian setting, what more could you want. Or as my eleven year old put it: #inside #outside #Vegas #Italy  Nortena dish was great!

Z8lotDxSRKwtHc4mExhSJA.text: Delicious mexican. Although I'm not an expert on mexican food I enjoyed this experience. Service was great also. Try the beef roast thingy. Yummy.

DYMgNeH0BRvFmThXs0XEqQ.text: Come hungry, or don't fill up on the chips and salsa! Generous portions rule the day here. The Wild Mushroom Enchilada was perfection. And the Chile Relleno looked good enough to marry. The service was friendly and efficient as well. And a "canal" view, too!

5FD5y6cZFkVsc6xp91Ezpg.text: Delicious food and phenomenal service (sit in Nathan's area, he'll take care of you) Easy to make reservations. Try the flautas and sangria, so good.

gxalNhWkccsq-On3k2Q0cA.text: The Chips and guacamole were good.  My wife had a vegetarian enchilada that was really tasty.  I had the steak fajitas and they were fairly bland. The service was good.   The dinner wasn't bad it just isn't what we expect out of a nicer place in vegas.  Every place we eat at the Venetian is excellent but Canonita was just ok.

Tjon_pNzt07xSqr8xqwbbA.text: Dessert is perfect ! Service is great. The best dinner so far in Las Vegas .

uh24HBNMgKlPrLlHLbdN4A.text: If i'm in Vegas again, I would like this give this place another try. I was here for a dinner with a set menu and wasn't a fan of the options we had.

e2bd9nS4nqM7MnOL-25USw.text: Absolutely fantastic!  Been here twice, two years apart, and both were THE BEST Mexican food I've ever had EVER.  Seriously, I can't say enough good things about Canonita, from the quality of the food, to the service, to the atmosphere.  Get a table near the grand canal, sip a margarita with some chips and salsa, relax and enjoy.  The flautas were perfectly executed, tasty, crispy outside, flavorful chicken inside.  The Sonora Filet Mignon was melt-in-your mouth tender, with a divine sauce, and the tamale was excellent (and I don't usually even like tamales.)  Just writing this review and remembering how good it was, I'm drooling.  The prices are on the high side, but worth it, in my opinion.  If I had money to burn, I'd fly from NY to Vegas just to go here for dinner.  Sorry if this sounds over the top, but I'm serious, Canonita is Mexican soul food at its best!

1zs8X9ypm1WR20Dyy7QbAQ.text: Ate there today and the food was really good! I had the wild mushroom enchilada which was super tasty! Chips and salsa was also really good! Waitress was super nice and always made sure we had drinks refilled! I would just stay away from the margaritas since they are way overpriced for the size you get! Besides the tiny margarita we got, everything else was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushroom enchilada! 3-28-14

UmuY3pJhJOp7Z_Hm-_oUTA.text: Nothing worth noting about the restaurant or food ,other than being located inside the great Venetian Hotel&Casino with a view to kill for(Gondala ride). The food was bland. Not authentic Mexican at all. The waiter doesn't mention the fact that the chips/salsa with guacamole is not complementary and you end up paying $13 for it. Not going there again.

1SLKpXy4d1hv_9OrPkO24Q.text: At the end of 2009's "SBC Goes to Vegas" epic comedy/tragedy, JMC, Cobber, and I spent one last day in Vegas, the start of which JMC led us to this spot overlooking the Venetian Canal. We imbibed carafe after carafe of a delicious sangria. I took note.  This year, at the end of a traditional/annual BFF/coworker trip, Sarah E, Sarah M, KarKar, and I spent an extra day in Vegas, the start of which led us to this same spot for lunch, touting it's sangria. It did not disappoint my hazy recollection.  We were quickly seated by the hostess, the restaurant/"patio" on the waterfront being sparsely occupied on a Tuesday afternoon. Julio, our server - an elder but spirited gentleman - came over with menus, introduced himself, and immediately prompted us for drinks to start... "A pitcher of sangria, please?" "Excellente. Four glasses? "Yes, please. Thank you."  With drinks on their way and requisite chips & salsa on the table, lunch/sustenance was in order. Both Sarahs ordered the Tres Tacos plates while KarKar went with lighter fare, having a bowl of the Corn & Green Chile Soup. I ordered the smoked chicken quesadilla, thinking it would be like... um, one big quesadilla, but they (3) were [pleasantly] more akin to grill flattened/pressed tacos.  The Corn & Green Chile soup was flavorful! A bit of sweet from the corn, heat from the green chile, a hearty fullness of potato, and depth/salt from smoked bacon.  The taco combination platters and the smoked chicken quesadilla plate satisfying and freshly flavored. Each taco was dressed with toppings complimentary to their filling - shredded chicken salpicon, mushrooms with queso blanco/fresco, and [grilled] fish with a pineapple salsa. The three palm-sized smoked chicken quesadillas are heavy with chicken and cheese. Both platters come garnished with a sharp and tangy serano slaw, black beans, and fresh flavorful cilantro rice.  Back to what brought us here... the Sangria.  Now its hard to tell (especially in Vegas) just how good/effective a sangria can be. It's *meant* to creep, right? (JM, Cobes, and I went 2-3 carafes not realizing the fade!) But I must say, the sangria here is good. Not too tart, not too sweet. Retains the silken feel of red wine and the warm flush of brandy is subtle. It's a slow ride into troubled waters. What a perfect way to ease into the crazy. Gimme more!  Safe to say, for casual dining, good people watching, and a creeper of a drink, I'd gladly add Canonita to the yearly tradition. _________________________________________________ No, really. I have a note to myself on my phone from last year...  "Must do Sangria again!" I don't remember writing it.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadillas lunch plate.

2azkH6gsh99B9gJpGh2lkw.text: The atmosphere is very nice.   We were able to enjoy the gondolas and singing.  The chips, salsa, and guac were really good.  I ordered the Chile relleno and my husband got the carne asada.  Both dishes were really good.  Service is excellent.

05yQMzejRznZ_UTu25mqvw.text: Food was great and location on canals is fun for people watching. Especially grateful to our server Juan Carlos who gave us a shortcut tip that got us to our show on time. Can't wait to return!

ReTa12l4sczSfgv-5yj3Pw.text: Nice view of the canal and gondolas going by, delicious Mexican food, and good service. We walked in and were seated right away in the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DjjrF8--arARtJDF_KR79A.text: We celebrated a friends birthday here.  The service was stellar!  The food amazing!  I wish I lived in Las Vegas as I am already craving the chips and guacamole!  Lisa and her staff were so attentive!  I highly recommend this restaurant!

do-E5XmGZmjrfb088g_DlA.text: This is a hidden gem in the Venetian. The restaurant was located right along the canal with the singing gondoliers passing by. There is a patio area (not really outside since it is in the Venetian) and an area inside the restaurant. The decor is of course Mexican style and very casual.  The service was quite fast. The margaritas were a little small for what you pay for. The server recommended the salmon and I didn't think a Mexican restaurant could do a great job of creating the best salmon entree but I was wrong. The salmon was delicious and it wasn't dry or overcooked!! Everything on the plate was tasty including the rice. The portion was so large I could not even eat 1/3 of the meal. I packed it up and ate the rest the next day.  I highly recommend this restaurant and the salmon entree!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken taco
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Entree with corn and rice

qOtNnX0bty7PGy3-YGUQzw.text: I was really looking forward to eating here but was pretty disappointed with what we had. I think this is just not my flavor style.  The salsa is good (tastes a lot like my homemade salsa).  Their chicken tortilla soup has wayyyyy too much cumin for me - I think it's cumin, at any rate, it is too overpowering. Takes away from the other flavors.  The chile relleno had very strong conflicting flavors which made it unenjoyable to consume. That is all I could try there, won't be back.

7lwD_dZu_T9lgWlN-Z5vIg.text: We waited over 45 minutes for a stupid table.  We should of left then.  With a 3 year old, service was slow.  And food is garbage.  They nickel and dime you for extra hot sauce or what type of tortilla you want.  I guess after waiting 45 minutes, I was expecting more but man, just go to chipotle and save money.  Its right behind you in the food court. The chicken fajitas were all onions and pepper with dry chicken bites.  The soup tasted like tomato enchilada sauce, we couldn't eat it and the server asked why?  "um because it tastes like sauce"  "oh um ok".  Then I say 'I will share my onions, can I have more tortilias? After I got them, we got a box because my little guy was passed out in the stroller.  Box and check please!

BpSkJ6khIlOQCF0eK9GYlg.text: It was alright. I wanted the soup for dinner but figured I'd need a little something extra so got the empanadas. Maybe it was just me but the soup portion was incredibly small for the price and the empanadas sauce was super sweet. The group that I was with enjoyed their meals but mine was mediocre. They had great drink specials so definitely worth going during happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas- has a sweet sauce.

ARemCwue2Syu2B0AtSwD0w.text: Thought this place was pretty good. Really enjoyed the jalapeno margarita. Friend had pineapple margarita and it wasn't so good. Chips and salsa cost extra. Salsa was good. Guacamole was excellent. We had the chicken and pork street tacos which were tasty. The beans and rice that came with street tacos were pretty bland. Probably better to just order the 5 street tacos (doesn't come with rice and beans) and split them with someone, instead of two plates of 3 tacos each with rice and beans. Atmosphere is great b/c when sitting "outside" the gondolas are going by and drivers are singing, so that's fun.

Pqj2v6eaP89Uvw-79RbH5A.text: My family and I had a great experience dining here. Our server Hector was amazing! He was extremely patient and kind to our group. The food was delicious the drinks are even better. The view from the patio is stunning. I highly recommend trying the place out.

KhD5NP_fqGh3egOB89AR9w.text: Nicely located along the Venetian canal. Fun to watch and listen to the singing gondoliers while you dine.  Started with drinks and queso fundido which was gooey and delicious with their homemade tortillas.  Santa Rosa Barbacoa for main course was large piece of juicy roasted pork with cilantro rice and black beans. Great meal and very filling. Too full to attempt dessert. Only negative, chairs are uncomfortable. Lots of Instagram worthy spots and surprises around every turn make for a fun walk after dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Canal view patio

gcWMvU9PygZVEnk8Zh1dIQ.text: This is my favorite place in Las Vegas, its located inside of Venetian hotel, when you sit outside you can fill that you are in Italy, 2 months ago i have been in Venice and i can tell you that you can smell that you are in Italy. Food is good price good too only the need to work with servers , maybe they need some training , besides that everything was good.

xfIM-rgEI_8nq39i5gOWJA.text: Absolutely LOVED dining here for my PRE-bday dinner. The service was excellent, the food was very fresh and piping hot. The margaritas were on point as well. We ordered a pineapple margarita as well as a jalapeno margarita. Then to top the night off, our server, Jonathan, remembered my bday was this weekend and totally surprised me with a celebratory tres leches cake!! I will definitely dine here again the next time I'm in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZrQijJhPaauidgkt7muE7g.text: I'm usually not a big fan of Mexican but THIS PLACE WAS AMAZING!! I've been to Vegas many many times and have dined at many restaurants in Vegas, but hands down this was the best place I've been to. I'm definitely coming back here every chance I get!

VhIXoVeRADWPiFmGDfrrVw.text: Fantastic!  Best meal we've had in Las Vegas!  We are New Mexico food snobs and this place was incredible!  The hatch green Chile was authentic on the quesadilla/empanada appetizer. I had the ahi and my wife had the roasted pork served in banana leaf. OMG!  Soooo good. Our server, Brian, was attentive and knowledgeable. And, we had a great table to enjoy the voices of the gondoliers as they serenaded in Italian opera.  EAT HERE!

oiULg_cCb9JETMCvptXQtQ.text: Service is really fast and I love the outdoor seating, but I'm all about the food.... not bad, I do wish my dish had a little more kick to it. Sides are bland and didn't really compliment the pork, but still it wasn't too bad. So 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time here, the pork was soooooo tender!

gi_ho5uj_NVwk3XykUEFug.text: This is a nice place to eat good authentic Mexican food feeling like you're in Venice. Our amazing server, Nathan was so nice and helpful. He recommended me the honey crusted salmon on a quinoa bed topped with mango salsa and my goly was it superb. Definitely a good place to check out

qfgE_aT0eJoJ2mvYTWpmfg.text: Been here twice already and I think I have found the best Mexican place to eat in Vegas. The tacos and horchata are so good and tres leches is also so tasty. So recommend this restaurant if your in the hunt for some yummy Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XrZBPCtdLiseT1uT4uBXww.text: This place was absolutely perfect for a midday lunch. Located inside the Venetian next to the gondola rides. You can opt for seating inside the restaurant, or by the water. First glance at the menu, I was taken aback at how the prices were not your average over priced costs as is usual per Las Vegas. The array of drinks to choose from was also quite a treat. My friends and I ordered margaritas and a few appetizers. The chicken flautas were just amazing. Had all the right toppings and the guacamole was so flavorful. Next up, the queso fundido with the fresh tortillas was melt in your mouth good. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at this fine establishment. Next time I'm in Las Vegas, I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flight of margaritas only $15

RLCsZWAipLTdkpwLywchgw.text: I came here twice and I loved there breakfast ! It's has a unique twist to it, and the view is beautiful next to the canal, I would def recommend the breakfast burrito, there potato's are truly to die for ! Def my go to when I want breakfast and I'm around

jgNgfdLnLSVqGV7zycxoXQ.text: Phenomenal food!!! The customer service was also top notch. Our waiter, Jesus was super friendly and accommodating to our dietary needs! Definitely one of the best mexican restaurants I've been to in a while. The Mexican enchiladas are a must have along with the queso fundido.

yKxGRNgI7qVv10eXESwCpw.text: Food is great but the service is awful!  We waited a long time to order and it took forever to get something to drink.  We come here every time we are in town just because of the food.  They charge for chips and salsa.  Wtf!?!? It's rude! I writing this review as I am waiting for the check.  Yes it's taken forever!

y6zu3oPVLYLXQ8aIykkPAQ.text: I'm sure the price went up from the last year that we were there in August. The portion is pretty reasonable I could finish everything bring that I never finish anything. I feel there is much flavor in the pork  as well as the shrimp broth with mussels.  For those who fear cheese there really isn't a lot of cheese in this type of food. The flan dessert was a disappointment as it was not very smooth but it was the  coffee n vanilla bean specks  within the flan that was wonderful. Unfortunately, talking about coffee, we just purchased a cup of coffee and were requested to toss it or drink it up before entering the restaurant. I felt that was quite a waste of money but being in Vegas nothing is about money right.   The service was good the lady was pretty new so we got a pretty attentive but very nervous waitress. The annoying thing to me was watching and hearing the gondola rides (the singing) through my meal although I could be biased since I go to Vegas so often that is the food that will ultimately  impressed me and not the tourist attractions.   Price for two which included the tuna ceviche, flan,  and two entrees was close to $100.  Better than playing slots. At least u get to taste some goodness.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp mussel mosqueqa
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-W1UiuJKh_4TK4SwigzHPA.text: Enchiladas verdes OMG the best ones I've ever tried in the states   Very good service as well!!! Very cozy place for a nice and romantic dinner!

Z4FkiXHUXOneftdGrG23gg.text: This is by far the worst restaurant I have ever been to in Vegas and by far the worst Mexican I've been too in America (and I travel often).  My fajitas was just awful. The chicken was burnt to a crisp, to the point that you literally could not even bite into the meat. And the chefs know as the burnt side was put down. The meat you could eat (had to surgically get to it), was dry and flavorless.  On top of that, the veggies had no flavor and the chicken portion was just tiny. If this weren't a business dinner on a compressed timeline, I would have sent it back.   Besides the awful fajitas, service was spotty with drinks forgotten, the waitress never came to check how everything was going and other service mistakes that should not happen at a restaurant with these pricepoints.   Beyond disappointed. Don't make the same mistake my party did, go somewhere else. Trust me, you will thank me later.

mUXy_ZWg3gIw9BOKCTwvVg.text: Enjoyed the chicken tacos on flour tortillas. They had a good flavor. The guacamole was good but i wasn't a huge fan of the salsa. Had a Bloody Mary that was spicy like i had asked. Only downfall was that they only served breakfast until 11am. We had to wait until that time to order the tacos.

JujhPwOOLar_ATvqbPfiKg.text: I love this restaurant they have the best Mexican food here and the service it's excellent Specially Rafael he treated us like family !

Rw35bZxubkQPY1OftMe0JQ.text: Every time I visit Vegas,  I have to stop by for my favorite dish. The taste is the same but look has changed.  Great place to have lunch or dinner.  I will stop again if I visit Vegas again

JEqrkx6t-x2OYipKBv4YMg.text: I got the chilaquiles and let me just say the eggs were perfect but the machaca was over seasoned. They are wayyyyy too soggy. Kids got pancakes that were

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pZP0IBAIT55Cj6iVq89yjg.text: Okay just because it's in Vegas you have to pay for Salsa and chips? Don't get me wrong I paid for it and the salsa was bland. I ordered the carne Asada, which came out very salty, the cilantro rice had no flavor at all. Oh and did I mention overpriced?? For some enchiladas my husband had they were at least $17+. The servers don't bother coming around I had to look for our waiter to refill our drinks. Will not be returning next time.

MDqul2pMMEty4i8cVWoMtA.text: Great place if you're staying in the Venetian or close by and want breakfast early in the morning and are not feeling up to a buffet. They open from 8 - 11:30 am daily. The location of the restaurant is also very nice as it's next to the canal so you could pretend that you're in Venice. Some tables even have umbrellas shading the customers from the fake blue sky to give it that extra appeal.   I felt like the menu contained a good variety for breakfast. There were pancakes, steak and eggs, and the traditional eggs, bacon, and potatoes. But there were also traditional Mexican staples as well. I got an order of the Huevos Rancheros ($13). The rest of the party got the Canonita BLT ($10), which came with eggs, poblano peppers, bacon, black beans, lettuce, tomato, guacamole, chiptole aoili, and Texas toast; the Steak and Eggs ($20); and the Canonita Omelette ($12), which came with Monterey Jack, peppers, poblano chiles, and red onions.   The huevos rancheros were alright but nothing special. My food did not seem to be hot when it came to me. It made the tortilla a bit more difficult to eat because it hardened more. Perhaps it was sitting at the window for a little bit longer, as the waiter for all the entrees to come out? Also, the waiter did not ask for preference when it came to the steak and eggs. The steak was a little more well done than liked.  Overall, service was slow. We were one of four other parties there for breakfast and we got there at 9, a good hour after they have opened. Our waiter was not very attentive and seemed to be out of sight most of the time. Took us a while to get the check as well. The food was decent but nothing super spectacular. I've had better. This place is worth it for the view and it's convenient location though! Perhaps, their lunch and dinner menu is better.

4YRuJn8J30GY7zMVQD-L6g.text: I'm sure the restaurant is good, but try the little blue taco truck right outside. Trust me, great tacos!

NScIsqYcKigi1_ukQ_QikA.text: Honestly, really enjoy the food here. Haven't had a bad meal. Also very decent portion sizes. For something lighter I would get the fish tacos. I liked the short rib dish but is much heavier. Just had a rude waitress and super long wait time for food last time (even thought we came after the lunch rush) we were there so that dampened our experience. Maybe we will just order to go next time if we want Mexican food in vegas.

tJrZscOs21nrpL9yEsPzXw.text: Canonita is located at the Venetian Hotel and Casino, second level in the shopping area...past the food court. (depending on which direction you're coming from.) Try to get a table by the canals so you can see the gondolas with gondoliers serenading guests as they go by the restaurant. Very beautiful ambiance. Service was quick and friendly.  The chips and salsa and guacamole (guac is an additional extra cost) is a must try as a sharable appetizer! Very flavorful and chips tasted fresh and not stale.  I came here for a weekday lunch. Ordered the chicken enchiladas combination plate. It came with 3 enchiladas (choice of green or red sauce) and cilantro lime rice and black beans. I opted for all rice. BIG PORTIONS!!!! If you're not that hungry or got a small appetite, it's best to share dishes with your party. My co-worker got her usual favorite chicken mole entree with beans and rice.   I think this is a great option from your other many wonderful restaurant choices the Venetian/Palazzo has to offer. I'm glad they have a Mexican restaurant here since there's so many steakhouses and Italian places, it's a good alternative if you're not a fan or craving the more common restaurants. Try to make a reservation here as it does get busy...especially on holidays, weekends or when there's a big convention in town.  I've always wanted to try Canonita and I'm glad I did. The food did not disappoint at all.

51oe5Gt2DUdo62ro9rJsRQ.text: I was pretty impressed with this place. I didn't expect much because it is a Mexican restaurant within an Italian themed hotel in Vegas (The Venetian). However, they had a great happy hour with four dollar and five dollar drinks between 4 and 7 PM and the food was excellent. The service was a little bit slow but that does not take away from the fact that when they were around, they were very attentive and nice. So I did not deduct any stars for that. That Miss fear is beautiful and be sure to ask for a table on the canal where the gondolas swing by. The view is breathtakingly amazing. I would definitely recommend and return on my next trip to Vegas.

xftzJNsuL1SAncBYM-vLXA.text: This place is so cozy we ate outside right next to the water. The service was so fast thanks the Jesus and the food was incredible! Highly recommend the Carnitas plate.

COBpnQyDPNeWJi12bgqS1g.text: Food was good at this place. Table next to the gondolas is a good place to sit. Service could have been better,   maybe it was just our server for the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaqueles, breakfast item.

MsyZnBAPpArzpcI0nfL5Fw.text: The food was good at first.  Unfortunately I became violently ill after eating the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas. I was the only one in my group to eat this and I was the only one to get sick. Food Poisoning sick for a solid 3 days. First time in Vegas and spent the whole time in bed and in the bathroom. I will never go back. Be careful of the wild mushroom enchiladas.

03puyXppS_IY3EbKDeuZ6g.text: Exceptional staff and good food. I like the stout tortilla chips excellent gor guac and scooping up the delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MRTR07i1iMPUHyXHPNcD2Q.text: Erm....I didn't like this place at all. My friends had visited for breakfast and loved it, but, it fell short for dinner. The waiter made a mistake with our drinks and fancied an argument about it. The food was spicy and not in a good way. The tortilla's for the fajita's were a very thick breadlike consistency and they were not very nice at all. It felt like you were eating in a food court rather than a restaurant. My husband had a steak and it wasn't great.The prices were expensive as it lacked atmosphere. Back to the waiter...he was rude when we tried to  pay the bill. All in all, there are many more lovely places to eat in Vegas than this place. I wouldn't go again.

TFCMmaIsDxwUn6AKh4QYMg.text: Not bad, I went to a private party here, and the food was good enough to warrant a visit a few days later. The lunch was reasonably priced (for Vegas) and you get to sit on the canal. Overall everything was decent. The Chicken burrito had some kind of odd sweet sauce on it, but my wife liked it :)

U5MmFOpiDB2KRT_H4ltU2A.text: Romantic view, very nice & courteous server, & tasty food! Ordered taco sampler; fish,beef, and chicken were my favorite

dTMYh3xDtFW3FeKbJczQsw.text: I was terribly dissatisfied by the pitcher of margarita that we ordered. It was myself my sister and my husband and we got a pitcher to share. Basically we got margarita mix and a lime wedge. They were too sour to enjoy. I would not come here for margarita unless it's happy hour. The food was like warm even though we waited almost 20 mins. I'd look elsewhere for Mexican in Vegas. The stars are for the chips and guacamole and salsa.

2nh_o_ikulBroN77NR2qbA.text: Wow ! Great food & great service -    I was part of a party of  25  on presidents  day we share  appetizers and bottomless   glasses of  sangria. I ordered  the spinach salad  along with the carne asada dinner and enjoyed the deserts. What a super afternoon all of us had. Unfortunately I can't recall our waiters name I wish I wrote it down, anyways 5 stars to him for all he did.

5gAbrySu48U8xUXg4Q8QBw.text: A little pricey but the food was amazing! I got the pineapple infusion margarita and it was also delicious, you can really taste the vanilla bean which is why I ordered it. I ordered tacos with rice and beans which were very good in quality and my BF ordered the chicken burrito which he loved. Chips and salsa were not complimentary like most places but very fresh, we spent about $70 bux for just the two of us...

4aX2CU0Y1lxRrvrUzmChaA.text: I really love the food here. It's pricey - so expect to spend a good dollar for your meal. I've been to this restaurant a few times to celebrate birthdays, and really enjoy the food and ambiance.   Here are few foods I love:  Queso Fundido Enchiladas Chips and Salsa Guacamole Pork Belly Taco  I'll likely be back next time I come back to Sin City...

gi2sWtFt0TW2MNASBcUgIg.text: Been here twice, just for drinks - this place has the BEST mojitos I've ever had! Try the raspberry or blackberry... Heck, try them both! They are this amazing combination of tart, sweet, and refreshing. I can't think of a better way to beat the Vegas heat than Canonita's mojitos!

BWHYaFY6YzJfcD33qX8zSw.text: As I was recently strolling the strip with my sister (as in literally walked from the Cosmo to the Venetian -- not an easy feat!), we got a little hungry and stopped by this place to get a snack. I'll admit, I'm weary of some restaurants on the strip, particularly Mexican as it has always turned out to be a disappointing experience for me (i.e., Gardunos at the Palms, Isla at TI, Yolos at Planet Hollywood). I was pleasantly surprised to find a nice Happy Hour at this place (venetian.com/uploadedIma...). $3 well drinks and $5 classic and specialty margaritas from 3pm to 6pm and 9pm to closing. We had the $5 prickly pear margaritas, which were actually pretty good as well as chips and guacamole. The guac was nothing to write home about but was decent. However, the drinks -- and HH prices -- were excellent, particularly because it doesn't seem like many strip joints offer decent happy hour options. The restaurant is also along the fake Grand Canal, so the singing gondoliers are fun entertainment.

WtW2pnUTE32Zb1UAuYYRTQ.text: Well, I payed for not listening to my fellow yelpers. Being from Texas, I have very high standards for Mexican food. This did not meet those expectations. Chips and salsa aren't free. No retried beans. No Spanish rice. No sweetnlow. But forget all that, the food is bland. No taste. Even the salsa. Disappointed for sure.

dHzAceLeoOFV4cD3hkTcTA.text: It was the worst experience my husband did a reservation for are anniversary I tried going online to confirm and wouldn't let me so I decide to call when I called some girl name I believe vanesa answer me saying do it online I told her wouldn't let me and she was like uhh hold on I was okay I though maybe she's having a bad morning I was okay it well get better once I show up. I get there and it was two girls my husband sayed we did online and the short Hispanic girl she sayed okay if you follow vanesa and I was hello remember me I was the one that called she was oh okay and she just look so unhappy she sat us behind of the restaurant when there was so many tables it was the worst experience. She then passed again all laughing with a table I called her asking to get my server I sat there seeing my server in the front with the girls. I ordered steak it was bad wasn't cooked all the way, my husband got salmon his was good. I didn't enjoy the service or the food. My husband though because was at the strip we get a good experience for are 10 year anniversary. From the time they sat us to end was bad we didnt even get a have a good day when we left. My husband wanted talk to the manager I just wanted to leave if the server took awhile to bring rhe check I wonder how the managers are.

19fIXf0FqPTzCzg5cfVRmg.text: Food's good, not great but good. Standout dish is the Barbacoa...seriously worth trying. My brother was served his shrimp burrito with shrimp tails still on the little guys, which made for a crunchy(not to mention inconvenient) experience. Cost is reasonable......for Vegas.  The cocktails were very good, the classic margarita and the michelada were ordered several times at our table with no complaints. NOTE: they do a happy hour until 7pm on most nights, but only at the bar!! The happy hour price is nearly 50% off on the margaritas, if your looking to save a buck. If your not eating dinner, they serve drinks in TO-GO cups even at happy hour prices.....very nice!  The best thing about this place is the location inside the Venetian, if you get a table on the "patio"(which means its not the bar area, hence not included in happy hour) you can sit right next to the water for the Gondola rides and listen to them sing(and watch the couples awkwardly stare at each other.... whilst taking their romantic trip in a circle..... through a hotel made to look like Venice, Italy) . It makes for a bit of a romantic dinner if your into that sort of thing, or at the very least some awesome people watching(im a fan).   BOTTOM LINE: have a cocktail before seven, share an entree or the guaco and chips, sit back/relax and have a gander(or a laugh) over the lovely Gondoliers and their customers.

bgbv-mSRBwAVcgT10avTKQ.text: I eat here at least once every time I'm in Vegas. It is great to be able to sit "outside" no matter the weather. The service is always attentive. The food is always great.

jOQg7xXA45_3BY6OWscb6A.text: Don't be deceived anymore. This place just isn't what it used to be. Not by a long shot. I've been coming here for the last 9 years or so. It had been about 2-3 years since I had been to vegas (moved to Macau) I visited last night and I cant explain how disappointed I was in the quality and taste of food now compared to before.   Flying in from Macau, I thought the first place I will stop at seeing how my hotel is in the Venetian will be Canonita, I had been craving the Chili Relleno for years. Our server asked if we had been here before we said yes. We placed our orders, got a taco platter for appetizer, margaritas, chille relleno, and the barbacoa. The barbacoa and margaritas were pretty much the same, but the taco platter was changed for the worse. And the relleno was just plain disgusting now. It went from being their best dish in my opinion to the worst. I'm really not sure what happened to this place, it looks a lot more corporate now and just was lacking these authentic flavors that it possessed in previous years.   The quality has gone down a lot and we dont know if thats because there is some new chefs or if the chefs just stopped trying. The taco platter took off at least one taco from the previous years and replaced it with "carnitas." The carnitas tasted like plastic and had the texture of it as well. I took one bite and its obvious they load it with that salsa on top to give it all the flavor because the meat was lacking taste.   Overall im giving it a 2 star rating now because the margaritas were fine (hard to mess up a margarita) and the barbacoa for keeping the same recipe. But honestly, we wont be dining here again until they bring back the delicious relleno with nuts and fruits inside. I cant be the only one who thinks this new rendition is disgusting. There is way better choices when it comes to Mexican food in Vegas.

hI_IiomzeAmznwpvK9vYrQ.text: This was a perfect end to first day in Vegas last time I visited.   A friend of mine had a conference at the Venetian (she is a teacher) and her principle generously allowed her to bring a friend. This lucky girl got to tag along (be jealous). The principle and his wife took my friend and myself out to dinner here our first night in Vegas.   From the outside it looks like your standard mexican food type of place. However, there is something about sitting by the canal  that really transformed the experience for me. I didn't feel like I was eating at a chain place or even a run of the mill hotel restaurant.   I had the slow cooked pork wrapped in a banana leaf. This was my first time ordering pork ever - and it was delicious. The portions were generous, and the cilantro lime rice was perfect.   A very nice relaxing experience. I was truly able to relax and focus on the company I was with.

xkxlcvdUHtZ1z16LQKoIAQ.text: This place is located in the Venetian and has great tacos, burritos and enchiladas.  The service is always good and I frequently take colleagues here.  My favorite appetizer is the chips, salsa and guacamole and the drinks are delicious as well!  The prices are a bit high but I get a corporate discount which is nice.  Would recommend for a nice Mexican food night out!

yPbJi3rblu9xN2GtdU46kg.text: Bad service with sub par food. My toast for breakfast was on a hamburger bun! Enough said!

mJqrdZsBvalsm2mbW_WAcA.text: First of all, this place is right on the canal (the only place to be so) and therefore that alone earns it several of its stars. I mean, when you have something as special and romantic as a Venice canal with gondolas passing by every 15mnts and gondoliers serenading their guests, why wouldn't you take full advantage of it!!   The place itself was very vegetarian-friendly, albeit relied heavily on mushrooms (which I'm allergic to). The only downside of this place was that they were unwilling to do any substitutions at all, which means for a mushroom-allergic person such as myself, there weren't really that many vegetarian options left. We tried the guac-chips and fondido as well as sides of beans and cilantro rice.

Q0pbk5VLVzMS4eDDTiwxrQ.text: Interesting to watch the gondolas float by while eating, fantastic service from the server, manager, AND the hostess last night, decent prices for the Strip, beef ribs highly recommended, best happy hour prices

58v2YSByLaAJje-nYDcMPw.text: My wife and I visited  Canonita once again and had a great experience. Mussels and shrimp appetizer, beef ribs, pork barbacoa, margaritas. All great.  The waitress was a bit too busy however it was not to the extent that we were not taken care of. a couple times the dirty plates were left on our table too long which is a problem as the tables are very small. Great food and drink.

Qn40vkpu2ZqwtBgKj2ZXgQ.text: Great view of the canal.  Disappointing chips and salsa aren't included but I suppose that will happen at an upscale Mexican restaurant.  Chips and guac were definitely worth the extra charge.  I had had a cuo of soup which was delicious.  Their rice was tasty as well.

TQVMe7PyEBJqRU2tt82twg.text: Had the pancakes. Light orange flavor. Very dry. Had to smother in butter to improve the texture which was crumbly.   Bacon - 2 strips. Done just fine. Way too thin of a cut and no smoke flavor at all. Peeled out of a bag from any supermarket would be the same.  Don't waste your money on breakfast here. Yes, I did try plenty more with the others at my table and the consensus is the same. I just don't feel like wasting any more thought on this place.  Our service was perfect though.

qwfjrwPVTDRGS4B_Dnv1kA.text: We stopped here for a late dinner on Monday & I can still taste the delicious flavors this restaurant had to offer! Their sauces are TO DIE FOR & the frescas are a refreshing treat. I can't wait to go back & try a few more things off the menu. My hubby ordered the wild mushroom enchiladas & loved them (he can be a harsh critic). My aunt and I split the (veggie) burrito with a side of each of their sauces to try, omg each one was better than the next! We also enjoyed the papas bravos as well as the chips & guacamole. Yum yum yummmm. I would highly recommend this restaurant & our wonderful waiter Jon.  We will be back!

NySwcFIU5FhLrEUk3o9Nyw.text: The food was good. We ordered for restaurant week and it was a great deal. We had flights of mojitos and margaritas that were good. However, the service was extremely slow. It took an hour to get our main courses and 20 minutes to get our drinks. Our water was not refilled with a whole table with empty glasses. When we asked for hot sauce, it was not brought. When we went to the waiter to get it, the waiter said "he forgot". They ran out of the dinner we wanted (salmon) and didn't have a dessert that was advertised. Both of those menus items were not told to us until after we ordered.

SLkdOCo7G4A75w5Uef359w.text: Service was sub-par for a Venetian restaurant.  It really was a downer in such a unique venue.   This place is along the canal and appears to be a hot spot.    The food was good but not very imaginative.  The pricing is a bit high for what you get. It was $24 for the beef enchiladas which were just OK.    There are so many stellar choices at Venetian/Palazzo, I would rather spend my money elsewhere.

dcl_i8ckoAlhz63w984nIQ.text: This is woefully overdue. I had thought I'd saved the updated review months ago. I'm embarrassed to discover now that it never posted. My apologies.  ___________________________  Where to begin? How about the service? As mentioned before, it was the service on follow-up that convinced me to come back to Canonita and give them another chance. And it's generally more about the service than anything else when I consider how I feel about my experience at a restaurant.   Rarely if ever have I been so pleased to be turned around on my opinion of a restaurant.  To say that Alejandro and his staff treated my guests and me like treasured friends would be an understatement. Now I know full well that they were looking to make up for a previous poor experience but I was watching the scene throughout the restaurant and, well, it wasn't just us. The staff was attentive and welcoming to everybody, and I could see lots of smiles and hear lots of laughter throughout the restaurant. This was what had been lacking the first time. Yes, the food was a major FAIL then, but it was the service that caused much of the problem. And it was the follow-up by Alejandro that had started to turn me around. This was five star, white glove service. Perfection.  As for the food, it was nothing short of spectacular. I can be a bit of a food snob at times. Okay, maybe more than a bit. But my daughter still talks about her fish from that night. High praise from a picky pescatarian about the fish she essentially HAD to order because there weren't exactly a lot of choices available to her. It made her old man smile from ear to ear. Her attitude went from "do we really have to go back there?" to "when can we go back there again?" I tasted it. It melted like butter in my mouth. My steak was heavenly but her fish was truly incredible. I wanted to steal it from her. All of the dishes were brilliantly prepared and beautifully presented. Everything about our meal was close to perfect - the atmosphere, the service, the food, the drinks. I even enjoyed the desserts - and I'm not really a huge desserts guy.    Alejandro, thank you. You and your staff have restored my faith and we WILL be back.    ______________________  Okay, so that's what has been unwittingly stuck as a draft since the end of November.   And if you want to know if we're still thinking about that meal, well.... My birthday's coming up and my kids asked to go back to Vegas to celebrate. (In the summer. Yeah, I know!) My daughter was quick to insist that we go to Canonita for my birthday dinner. She still talks about that fish seven months later. My son suggested Canonita too, and he wasn't even with us in November. He's been listening to his sister rave about her meal for months. As for me, well, who am I to argue? Canonita it is. I think maybe I'll order the fish....

_NDYMNaxFKabGAUugeVxeA.text: Salsa was very good. Everyone enjoyed their food.  I will say the pork tacos were a bit dry and so were the beef. Fish ones were good. Service was good too.

wKGsWI2KURqLwf-fevDUkg.text: We stopped in here for appetizers. Wow! First let me compliment the employees. They definitely go out of their way to help their patrons. Our server was polite and attentive. The restaurant over looks the canals, which is  a fun experience to watch. The shredded beef flautas were incredible. They are made fresh daily with so much flavor. Pico de gallo and guacamole were tasty. If you want Mexican food at the Venetian, come here with an appetite because you won't be disappointed.

UCaQtkMkQPHoO4l2pDfAxA.text: My party of two came here for breakfast one weekday morning when it wasn't too busy, and we were seated overlooking the canal, which was fun.  I ordered the Garden Egg White Omelette (with spinach, mushroom, and cheese only), Yogurt and Granola (served with Mexican wedding cookies), and Watermelon Agua Fresca.  Personally, I didn't care for my food - it was all bland to me and I've had better elsewhere.  My dining companion liked her food though (Huevos BLT), so maybe I just didn't order the right thing.  I love watermelon so I liked my drink and found it to be pretty refreshing.  Service was decent, and our food was brought out pretty fast.  It was neat sitting by the water and seeing gondolas go by, so I found the ambiance to be nice.  If the food were any tastier, I'd give Canonita a four, but since it wasn't, three stars it is based on my experience.

JT_USE8-_Loje9MP_x32kg.text: We grabbed a couple of chicken street tacos while wandering around the Grand Canal Shops looking for the rest of our friends... they were yummy! And the food truck could not have been any cleaner!!!   So the truck is like a to go type window but it was a "truck" off to the back side and we had them add habanero salsa to the top for flavor and they were great.  Better than food court food and then we found all our friends sitting int the actual restaurant so had some of their chips and salsa and guacamole and more food. Yummy for mall Mexican food. And the jalapenos  margaritas were delicious too! Chips were crispy and the salad was a smoked something flavor and yummy! Good stuff

LQ-R_KARtJbm44ox4UwL2g.text: In the middle of the hotel and Venetian riverwalk. Very tasty and fresh food. We had breakfast and it was cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Venetian &#39;sky&#39;
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried eggs sunny side up with salsa, avocado and potatoes.

_BVZrmNCJkgWAwk8GiJZxg.text: We went here on Cinco de Mayo with a big group for my bachelorette party and the food was delicious but the service wasn't that great. We had to get a group dining package which included all you can drink house margs, beer and sangria so basically everytime the waiter would come back to our table we would just order 5 more sangria so that we wouldn't have to wait for him t o come back.  The chips and salsa, tacos and quesadillas were all delicious though so that made up for the mediocre service. It was cool to be in the Canal Shops though. They have a taco stand right outside the restaurant that is probably cheaper than dining inside.

Iw8EngZjc6rlmypGo0Q0LA.text: What an amazing experience!  I contacted Ashley about hosting my sisters bachelorette party dinner of 12 girls.  I am from NY, so I was nervous about picking a restaurant I've never been to before.  She made the planning process so easy for me and even made a custom menu with my sister's name at the top..She LOVED that..food and drinks were amazing.. LOVED the guacamole.   Our server was extremely attentive and kind.. thank you Nathan L and everyone at Canonita for making my sister's bachelorette dinner one to remember!!

cub-EK8W0NqwmHiTl1dijQ.text: Visit this place once for the experience if not the food. With amazing view of gondoliers singing and sailing their gondolas with couples (or tourists), the place has a festive charm. However the place is pricier than $$ sign displayed next to the restaurant name in yelp- specially when you adds a drink/cocktail to your order. We specially enjoyed Chile Relleno, that not only tasted good but also looked pretty   On the other hand I personally hated myself for ordering queso fundido- could have been  better off with just the chips and salsa.

evveYtHIHMz9Q_bKqDoLSQ.text: Great food inside of the mall in the Venetian hotel, overlooking the mall river.   I started off with chips & salsa as well as queso fundido. I really enjoyed both appetizers, the salsa had a good kick to it. I drank an horchata, which was actually very good compared to what I've had in Mexico.   As a main course I enjoyed chicken flautas. They were decent, I would have wanted them a little bit crisper in the inside. Next time I would probably try another food item.   The staff was great and very accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

36KfB8c-xR0-Kj8UdpwE2w.text: Besides this place being absolutely gorgeous, the food was great! I had the Santa rosa barbacua and it was really good. The meat is cooked to perfection! Our server Hector was amazing as well. He was lovely and very patient. We had quite a bit of people in our party and he did great the entire time we were there so thank you Hector for making our first time at Canontia amazing. And I'm assuming we spoke to a manager...not sure and didn't catch her name but she was super sweet too! We need a Canonita in the Central Coast in California!!

Ion8kISAIXwKddS2l-el3g.text: Had an awesome experience here for lunch. It was a little pricey, but worth every effin penny!  Our server was Kim S.  She was big on pleasantries and all around a kick-ass server.  She kept the drinks flowing and the food moving without being intrusive.  I loved her.  She treated us like royalty!  I tried several jalapeno margaritas--not as spicy as I prefer them, but still legitimately amazing!  The guacamole was so amazing that we ordered another serving. The chips were fantastic. And the Carne asada and fajitas were out of this universe.  Expensive, but good.  I would definitely come back again!

sDrin5khbKo00cQpefA0HA.text: Excellent service! Our waiter Hector was super sweet and nice, delicious food. Highly recommend!

NcGUJ3J34kPhKDTXRzIO7w.text: Excellent service! Richard and Armando assure you are happy and satisfied! Highly recommended!

EwUrGB6xRR72F5ObFX_FEw.text: Please please go back to your old dinner menu that had fajita's and other traditional Mexican food. New options are just ok. We had great service as usual and really like their food, but please stick to what you do well. Chips are warm, YAY!

X7-QD4nDfZLJfUVZKgVGHw.text: Love the jalapeno margaritas here! The five is totally on point. The view is amazing of the gondolas. Javier is AMAZING!!!

Z1UTp5UdWp4ahny3KJppig.text: We had lunch here, and the experience was great. We sat right by the canal, so we saw all of the gondolas go by. The chicken burrito I had was amazing, and the drinks were all tasty. One of my favorite dining places on the strip!

T9_tnShFF1OzcHOLoYLRZQ.text: Really cool place and friendly. The location is awesome, because it's located along the Venetian's "Grand Canal." They also offer bottomless mimosas for breakfast, which is always fun!  During our stay at the Venetian, we came here several times. It's conveniently located near all the shops, singing gondoliers, and close to the casino. The reason I give them three stars, however, is because of the consistently slow service, despite how busy or slow it was, or time of day. At each visit, and with all different servers each time, it always took a long time to be greeted at our table, brought water, food, or drinks.   Otherwise, it's worth a shot. I would come back.

94NS22xoxzHZqE7dkguxow.text: To be honest, this review is completely swayed by the atmosphere!  As long as the food was decent, I'd have been extremely happy.  This restaurant is contained within the Venetian Hotel in Las Vegas, directly aligned with their Grand Canal, with gondolas floating by, gondoliers singing, a ceiling painted with sky and clouds, False building fronts as if you are outside in Venice,.... After flying into Vegas, this was a heavenly place to drop in, get a bite to eat, before driving to a hotel to prepare for a several day conference.  There used to be a different restaurant with an "outdoor patio" near the canal and gondolas, but they seem to have shifted things, so I chose this restaurant based upon it's location.    They had a nice selection on their menu.  I ordered the Ahi tuna medallions with polenta cakes, and a Sangria swirl type of drink.  I did not want to leave.  It looked like they also had a good menu for breakfast, but I was not staying near enough to come back.    Vegas is a hectic place.  If you want a little bit of peace and tranquility, this is an excellent choice to unwind and have a bite to eat or drink!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View looking at the restaurant along the canal at the Venetian.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gondoliers cross paths near the restaurant patio, and are often singing to their passengers, as you sip your drink and eat your meal.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of Canonita&#39;s patio dining along the canal, with lights strung overhead - beautiful setting

2dxrYHJ2W-Nd96oXyINrWw.text: This place was weird, but still tasty. You're eating unauthentic Mexican burritos by a Venetian canal in Vegas for $18??? But hey, it's Vegas. Pros: Food is actually not terrible, location, portion size Cons: price, authenticity.  Food: I had the chicken burrito ($18) and it was surprisingly good if I forgot that I was eating Mexican food. The burrito was smothered in what tasted like bbq sauce (what??) and filled with shredded chicken, beans, fajita veggies, cheese, etc. The cilantro rice and black beans on the side were actually better than the burrito.   Atmosphere: Probably why people come. They have a patio on the Venetian "canal" so you can watch gondoliers go by while you eat.   Value: Vegas is expensive, but $18 for a burrito??? At least this has extra large portions. Would be easy to split in two and save some for later.   Service: Very amenable!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Burrito

ebHwnFGlsiFwiJTXlLZUEQ.text: Before anything, they have bottomless mimosa for breakfast!!!   Ok, this restaurant is right by the canal, so it's a lovely place to have breakfast, lunch, dinner, tea while listening to the amazing gondola performers.  We had a simple breakfast, omelette, churros, empanada, and I forgot the rest. The churros had caramel in the middle and it came with goat milk caramel sauce. It was so awesome!  Their coffee is good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rynHx_4G3pBaJWns5PPq0Q.text: We were originally trying to go to this italian place we like which is just a few stores down and they had a 30 or more minute wait so we walked around looking to see if anything else caught our eye. We decided to try Canonita and were happy with our experience. We got a cheese appetizer that came with tortillas which was really good and decided to split a meal since we were going to go get a milkshake after. we got the enchiladas with green sauce. the enchiladas came with rice and beans. and The enchiladas were good but the RICE was amazing! it was cilantro rice and I could have just eaten a meal filled with that.

Vt25I42PDeTcu8vtyXOzLg.text: Outstanding breakfast!!  We had the Burrito and the Chilaquilles (sp?) and they were some of the best we've had. Outstanding authentic flavors and homemade corn chips were super fresh.   Great option for a sit-down breakfast when you're out walking around this part of the Strip. We will have to come back for lunch or dinner.

xay37r8gos6Tm8jU-0Evow.text: Cherri is THE BEST SERVER! So knowledgeable, personable and attentive. Austin W, how do  Know these employees last names? Why so mean? Suspicious!!!!

uGzPZeyt8jXCLFr7Aa4n-A.text: Located in the Venetian over looking the canals. The service here is very poor and slow.  Slow to get  drinks ordered and then the drinks. Our server seemed unhappy to wait on our large party and generally unhelpful. We sat for hours waiting for drinks and the meal. They charge for chips and salsa as an appetizer.  The salsa was delicious with a nice roasted flavor. I have never been to any Mexican food places that charge for chips and salsa!  Good guacamole  The black beans and cilantro rice are tasty. The cheese enchiladas are OK covered with a spicy mole sauce.  We all felt the food was just average compared to most of our trips dining experiences.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jS5xMRdrZydG2ohvMKtWDQ.text: Honestly I was so disappointed with my very first Vegas meal. Was craving tacos but they were really just not that good. Some kind of sauce on the meat. Definitely not authentic. And the beef had that old cooked beef taste. Just no flavor at all. No toppings either except raw red onion which can be a good addition but the tacos lacked complexity and plain old flavor! The tomatillo sauce served with was very sweet like they added quite a bit of sugar. And no zip, no spice, no lime flavor. Just a very bland meal. The waiter was very nice. And the seating by the canal was cool.

Oh1167KZxrmiCrq67codzg.text: Get a table by the water if possible! The ambience is about as good as it gets. Great place for drinks (especially during happy hour). The Chicken Flautas were only average tasting (chicken lacked flavor). Service was impeccable.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken flauta platter
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from a waterside table

Xpaa_Icv-FvXFT5EWfzNvA.text: Loved the food, we came back for a third time. They have the best appetizers and drinks. Javier the Bartender was very friendly, great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MwnRxLfH0TWDWmXfwNSP_g.text: My wife and I met up with some friends who were in town for a convention. We decided on Canonita because we saw it while riding the gondolas. The food, service, and ambience were all great! We sat almost near the water, with a great view. Our waitress, Brooke was very kind and attentive. She recommended the jalapeno margarita and mussels to start. Glad we went with both, dipping the bread in the chorizo sauce was delicious. I had the barbacoa and my wife had the salmon... great choices once again. We will definitely be back, thanks Brooke!

x0i9ETEpkL3VgzxIfP4Vbg.text: Canonita gets four stars because of the great food, cocktails and the gorgeous view from the tables!  I have been to Canonita each time I've visited Vegas.  It is conveniently located along the Venetian Canal.  I love having my meal at the tables along the water and watching the people on their Gondola rides.  It's an excellent spot to listen to them sing their beautiful Italian songs.  I always order the Queso Fundido as my appetizer.  Their homemade Guacamole is in a league of its own.  My favorite entree is the Pork Barbacoa tacos.  The pork is slow cooked inside a banana leaf.  The rice and beans are excellent.  Canonita also makes excellent margaritas.  They have a $5 margarita special around happy hour.  They don't mind if you just sit and watch the canal after your meal is done.  It's a great place to stop for lunch during a day of shopping!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Barbacoa
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso fundido

nPH75x63289YLm24AczHng.text: We thoroughly enjoyed Canonita for a lovely breakfast. Eating right next to the canal and hearing the gondoliers singing made for a special meal. The service was prompt and the restaurant had a fun look. We loved the food we had--dessert empanadas, two vegetable egg white omelettes, and cheese enchiladas with egg. The coffee was also great. Our only issue was that a glass came out with lipstick on the rim. It was not a huge deal because it was likely adhered onto the glass during the dishwashing process. A server quickly fixed this situation for us. Overall, we enjoyed our breakfast and would love to try the restaurant for lunch or dinner.

HHf8SqGPCb8g-JdrMHHWvA.text: I gotta tell you we found this place by accident. We sat next to the Gondola show, it was so cool. But back to the food! Man it was good. I ordered the Chicken Burrito, it was so good. Cilantro flavored rice, black beans, and a mondo sized burrito stuffed with the most tender shredded chicken breast I have ever eaten. I will be back very soon. Oh, the service and staff were top shelf!

fcpdIChYWTFVi_TBlxIjYA.text: Super delicious food, as well as super great location--great view of the Venetial canal and the boats that come through.  We got the coconut drink, that comes in an actual coconut with alcohol and pineapple juice--super delicious and refreshing.  We also got the tacos and the Santa Rosa pork barbacoa.  The chips that came with the meal were fresh and warm and handmade.  The taco corn tortillas were also homemade, and oh so good.  Each of our meals came with black beans and cilantro rice--a nice twist on the typical Mexican rice.  Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!
