-bIMcVQpfmem-dR-MUKMEA.text: Late review but if you go, you must try the house-made guacamole. The bartender also recommended the pineapple margarita - yum! We sat at the bar to catch a basketball game on a Friday night. Awesome service and food!

0mzee80gWP6ohqtU3Y0LQw.text: Good meal at a reasonable price for Las Vegas.  My wife and I stopped in, without a reservation, and were promptly seated.  Our server, Jerry, was very helpful and the food and drinks were very good.  The margaritas were very good and the jalapeno margarita my wife was outstanding.

KeZg4E8wWi-b_2tRaLzdVw.text: Awesome food, atmosphere and food porn experience. The blood Mary was exceptional. But my dish, Toluca Portobello  Mushrooms has became  one of my all time favorite meals. The presentation, taste and the healthiness was awesome.  It deserves 5 stars.   The service from Danny and Kelli was friendly, knowledgeable and added to the experience.  They were helpful in selecting our meals with our dietary concerns. Obviously a good place to work considering they were happy to be there.

6AQf_oN7ftFJy2JY384d-g.text: My husband would scoff at a 4-star rating for this restaurant, because he thought his steak fajitas were way too chewy and cheap tasting. However, I thought for $22 per person, the prix fixe was an excellent value. Chips, guac and salsa? Delicious. My chopped salad was also great, although his tortilla soup wasn't as appetizing (it's not the broth-based soup you're using to seeing at restaurants). I thought the steak fajitas were fine for the price. Three leisurely courses seated on the canal, watching tourists pretend they're glad they spent $60 to float in a fake boat in two feet of water. That's Vegas!

J7fy57PHRiTddQtOVM_rTw.text: The tortilla soup was more like a mole dip.  I sent back my chicken Ceasar salad because something just didn't taste right about it.  Cutting my losses.

oxw9wS0jjle_Batw76GdUg.text: Had a great lunch today!! Nathan an awesome tentative server! Will be back! Us Texas gals love guacamole!

qX1FXd5Zv6GNevr0J5MPNg.text: I'm surprised this place doesn't have a stronger rating. I've dined at Canonita several times now, and every experience has been great. The food and service have been consistently good.  Highlight 1: Their guacamole. It's the best I've ever had. Granted, I don't have an especially extensive knowledge/experience with guac, but I found it to be extremely tasty. Definitely worth it to spend the small added cost to have it with your chips & salsa.  Highlight 2: Cheese fundido. I'd never had this before dining at Canonita so I have no basis of comparison, but it is definitely delicious. You can add a meat to the cheese (we did chicken once), but I thought it tasted just as good plain, with no meat added.  Highlight 3: Service. This is a casual dining restaurant at the Venetian, but the service is still top notch. Every server I've had has been very polite, friendly, and helpful.  I've never had any of the alcoholic beverages here, so I can't vouch for Canonita in that department, but I've liked everything I've ordered here. This place has become one of my go-to restaurants for Mexican food in Las Vegas.

0Nk3Twxkdz_yCuSMIZ8zcQ.text: Terrible coffee. Like real bad. My friend's tres leches looked solid. And it offered a good view of the cheesy gondoliers at the Venetian.

ygCi7ybehFO8ySIdHAZPpA.text: Nah, not great food, but at least it's cheap. Food gets 2 stars, but price gets 3 stars.  3 tacos for $5.25 - tasted like it was from taco bell.  2 chicken tostadas for $6 something - tasted like mush, but cheap  salsa & chips for under $2 and they gave a lot of salsa.  Is this place great? No.  Would I go back again? No. Is it cheap? Yes.

qThOvrs1BYAmCkGYhnxEiA.text: Food: Excellent. If you have a tamale with lobster and goat cheese on the menu, I'm intrigued. But the fact that it tasted amazing.... that's another story!   Drinks: I indulged in a Corona, can't mess that up. My friends enjoyed the pomegrante margarita. They ordered a 2nd pitcher, so they must have been good!!   Salsa/Chips: Great!! This is often an indicator for me if the rest of the meal is going to be enjoyable. Taqueria Canonita passed this test!   And of course it's set alongside the Grand Canal in Venice.... okay, the faux Grand Canal in the Venetian Hotel. Still-- great view, great experience, excellent service too. I will definitely be back!!

puZVuUdnbtPfAt8esq0wcw.text: Hour 21 of a 24 hour trip to Vegas was spent in the bar at Taqueria Canonita, where I had ok tacos with a crazy good margarita.  Now, my opinion of the tacos may be colored by knowing in a mere 4 hours I'd be stepping off the plane in Los Angeles, soon to fill my mouth and belly with all sorts of delightful Mexican goodies (thinking of it now, I'm not sure why we chose a taqueria in Vegas anyway), so let me tell you about this margarita.   First, it was 5 bucks--now, 5 bucks is a decent happy hour price in D.C., but in Vegas? Insane. This was called a "Blackberry Fresca Margarita." I'm normally a blended margarita girl, but this delight on ice may have changed my mind. It was fresh blackberries with triple sec and silver tequila, a perfectly refreshing blend of sweet and the 1-2 punch of tequila. Most interestingly, but still wholly enjoyable, was that the glass was rimmed with both salt and sugar, which I've never had.   I genuinely hope this margarita wasn't a special, because everyone who can should try it! I'm planning an attempt at my own as part of a red-white-and-blue drink spread for July 4 this summer.   I would sit through the "ok" food in a heartbeat for more of these margaritas.

xBHX9SuxhZq3-TZgBPzsgQ.text: I love sitting at this restaurant and enjoying the sounds of the gondola singers as they float by the table!

RtW3KlpMCmgjzsNirgiAwQ.text: The food was great but the day after not so great. Bad stomach pain. And constantly throwing up.

7YzUrqys4u3pKE8veRqQbg.text: For a place that brands itself as Mexican soul food, the food was a little soulless.  My party all ordered individual dishes and not a single one was embued with the life of a rich, ancient, and beautiful culture.  While it did not have that oft desired taste of human sacrifice boy was it scrumptious!  The haunting melodies of low wage gondoliers reverberate through the patio for the entire duration of your stay.  As you can guess, it lacks soul too.  But there is heart.  Lots of heart.  If I am not mistaken it is the opening song from the lion king.  The chips are also great.  Tasting not unlike the kind your great grandmother anne felaroe crafted in her tiny tiny kitchen all those years ago.  Everything was going fine until santana featuring rob thomas started playing.  I went through a bad breakup in high school while this song was popular and it left a bad taste in my mouth.  A bad taste the perfectly cooked pork quickly replaced.  If the hotel paid the dj as much as they obviously pay this bomb ass chef, the music would be better.

LQzdgCuI2NTbFctjl5OpQA.text: Cute little Mexican eatery right along the canal. We asked to be seated at the table right by the water. Very quiet and it was fun to watch the gondolas float by. Not your traditional Mexican food but very tasty nonetheless. The waiter was really nice and had a very down to earth attitude. He even brought us a sample of their guacamole, which was delicious. I ordered the Tres Tacos and my husband ordered the chicken mole. The mole was exquisite and did not look like any of the mole dishes we've seen. It looked like a more "fine dining" version. Decent prices for being in the Venetian. We would definitely go back here.

cPjuIIbsFMN_jPX2CjkrCQ.text: Nice place to eat and relax.  The chips and salsa are very good.  Good every time I go, and I eat here every time I stay at the Venetian.

U6kc3jkB-t1hkJywFia8vQ.text: Two best things about this place:  1- Location.  We had a table right on the Grand Canal and could watch the gondolas and listen to them sing. 2- Gauc.  Not sure why this guac is good, but it really is.  Since they charge for chip refills anyways, just get the guac.  It has a strong good taste of cilantro - my fav.  We both had the chicken enchiladas- they were good, but nothing too memorable.  Good service- worth a try for the location, and reasonable prices.

yxGm6iB9j1cJ_nhdv-F3kA.text: Aside from the fact that our server totally forgot about us, I sort of loved this place. The happy hour specials are pretty good. I highly suggest the taco sampler and margaritas. YUM!  The ceviche was so fresh and clean tasting.

UN2xuFJgMTx81kLnJfP1xw.text: 2.0 Stars  Canonita Express is located in the mall-like eatery in the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes. Apparently it's the little sister restaurant of Taqueria Canonita, also located in the vicinity. Despite Taqueria Canonita having better reviews, I don't see Canonita Express living up to the standards of its elder sibling.  Like with most mall-like eateries, the food won't exactly be stellar, but it's quick, convenient, and relatively cheap. I decided to try the steak taco platter for $7.50 and it came with 2 crispy tacos, rice, and beans . The chicken version went for $0.50 cheaper.  The tacos had a nice crisp and the Pico de Gallo on the side was fresh. The steak itself didn't have much flavor, but the hot sauce packets did help. The beans and rice were mediocre at best.  My food came out relatively fast and our server was friendly enough to provide refills on my water. Aside from these factors, I feel there are better options in the food court to try like "Awesome Panda".

qOEHWGEcdJa_F72WQyyPBw.text: Typical Vegas resturant... big price little food... ordered the three taco plate, it was good, rice and beans were good... BF started with the 11$ spinach salad... it was really tasty and almost worth that high price. I ordered the $5 happy hour wine and it was awful.. Id stick with beer in the future. Was decent but had better mexican in vegas.. the atmosphere was nice sitting on their 'patio' by the water where the gondolas passed.

S0cZxM9CmQorsiYZgeOBuw.text: I'm somewhat shocked that this place averaged 3 1/2 stars.  Coming from Los Angeles, I've had my fair share of Mexican food.  From the hole in the one senora style to even the finer dining version of Mexican restaurants, this place was not too shabby.  First of all, the location is a hit. Right by the canal for viewers to watch gandolas go by, it's a perfect setting.  Then, munch on some nachos with their salsa and guacamole while sipping on some fruity margarita, dinner seemingly sounds better. We feel the buzz from our delicioso margaritas so we go the high route and order the most expensive dish on the menu - the AZTEC BONE IN NY STEAK.  It came with the the crab cornbread with truffle butter.  Lets just say that the crab cornbread with the truffle bread saved this order because this side dish was worth going home to write about.  As for the steak, if you love overdosing on sodium or you just came out of a sweaty and exhausting basketball game, then this over salty steak is just for you!  For folks who don't crave that saltiness (that's me), I would not recommend this dish.  We had to ask for it to be redone and the waitress was extremely nice about it.  I can tell the chef or cook was snooty about this because the 2nd steak we got back had absolutely no flavor, just the meat itself.  You can tell easily what the chef was thinking when he was told that the customer didn't like his steak. I was a big fan of the cornbread.  If you think the cornbread is worth $37 and you have money to dispose, I would give this order a shot. And so what the steak came out overly salty and then the second one came out tame.  We had the salt from our margarita glasses that we used to pick and press onto our flavorless steak and made the most out of it.  All in all, the cornbread, the margarita, chips and salsa and the setting was good.  Just not the salty and unsalty steaks.  If you're looking for a good Mexican restaurant in Vegas, try Border Grill at The Mirage.

ZamL5l-aFweTc07sB8URUw.text: Classic margarita was 100% agave with housemade mix.  Too sweet, but adjusted to my taste on request.  It lost some flavor in the process.  Certainly not the worst margarita i've had, and it was only $5.  Wild mushroom enchiladas were nutritious and delicious, if not scrumptious.  Pinto beans were a tad undercooked, but in a positive way that added nice texture.  Lots of interesting pork options for next time.

c12L6cHva5EVYWiYuYFCZQ.text: I never thought a little cafe would turn me off from ever going to the venetian ever again but this place did the job. From the 21 year old rude as hell hostess to the little boy man who told us we had to move to another table to the Nazi waitress, my days here are over.

LFwFKg_sGG0rCbvRDTfsEQ.text: We went there with a party of 13 for lunch.  Food was good.  Menu had a lot of choices.  A free appetizer - warm chips w/ fresh salsa and guacamole - was also served.  This was DELICIOUS!  I think we got a few "refills" before our orders arrived.  We found out afterwards that the restaurant made their own chips on the premise.  The service was excellent.  When our waiter found out that it was my Mom's birthday, he promptly gave her a tequila when drinks were served.  At the end of lunch, he gave her a surprise dessert with happy birthday written on the plate.  Last but not least, he gave us more chips as take-out free of charge.  The restaurant was right on the Grand Canal level.  So even though we were inside, it felt that we were "outside" when we were seated at the "patio."  All in all, very excellent eating experience and highly recommended.

i8n2Ugp7MBpd7_cpaNkl9Q.text: Service was terrible. Our server was completely inept, requiring constant reminders for the simplest of requests (e.g., a glass). The food was borderline at best - bland and unremarkable. Overall, the experience will not be bringing us back.

vevG4R5Ww7AvG5s8Q2ZvCQ.text: Pork Belly Tacos; Cheat Day! Great Margaritas.

aCjgB7yhxf9vvV6K_tAikQ.text: This was my first time to Las Vegas. I was here on business and was a little overwhelmed by the crowds and craziness. I walked around a lot looking for a place I could have a drink and feel comfortable by myself. I finally found myself in the Venetian. As I walked through I noticed a Mexican restaurant. Not in the mood for wine (as it was unbearably hot out) I opted for a margarita. Javier, the server/bartender was very gracious and friendly. The couple next to me ordered Guacamole and some sort of tomato based shrimp and mussels. It looked great. I had already eaten so just stuck with a drink. Javier was helpful in selecting a top shelf tequila, there was a vast selection. I ended up getting their Jalapeno Margarita, which is made by steeping tequila, sugar and oranges in a large glass container. They also offer a sweeter pineapple based option, which Javier offered to me in a taster sized glass. Very delicious, kind of like a dessert. Thanks for making me feel welcome and giving me a place to rest my feet and cool down.

A56-TlD66SXEK79dJz-Fvw.text: Food was boring and service was worse, expensive too..never got chips I ordered, no water, never offered another drink..frustrating...

0TxfvExSPDkXLGZKsbHArw.text: I've never met a chile relleno I didn't like, and the one at Taqueria Canonita was especially creative and interesting.  The vegetarian entrees at most Mexican restaurants can be dull, but not here.    My boyfriend and I ordered the chile relleno, served with roasted vegetables and jicama salad, and the wild mushroom enchiladas served with borracho beans and rice.  The chile relleno was stuffed with a mixture of dried fruit, almonds, and cheese, and the contrast between sweet and savory was a party in my mouth.  The salad was light and the orange dressing was a refreshing surprise.  The enchiladas were drenched with a velvety poblano sauce, and combined with the mushrooms, the enchiladas just slid down my throat.  The borracho beans were a smoky kidney beans with a hint of chili powder.  Oh, and don't skip the chips and fire roasted salsa; it's so good that you'll want to drink it straight from the bowl.  For dessert, we shared the Ancho Brownie, garnished with pepita ice cream.  This ancho infused brownie was ooey, gooey, and very fudgy.   The ambiance is nice for people watching, and the restaurant's location next to the canal gives the illusion that you are dining outside.  It can be a bit noisy, but all in all, I'd eat here again.

yzis3JmXV5x8YdL0Xw-aaA.text: The food was fantastic!  The only reason it got a four instead of five star is because it said there was outdoor seating.  The seating, although along a balcony overlooking the venetian boats, was INDOORS. There was fake sky and fake buildings and fake facades, but it was inside.  But, the food was delicious!!

xVr_yzlqtMM5egtO1IcJzQ.text: This place is terrible! Service is extremely slow, waitress is inexperienced and easily frazzled, food is just mediocre.   We had a reservation for lunch at 3pm on the patio to enjoy the ambiance, people watching and gondola rides. We were told it was happy hour. We tried to place an order for a drink that was on the happy hour menu, but were told it was only available in the main dining area, not on the patio. We asked if we could order our drinks in the bar and bring it to our table and our waitress highly discouraged it. We asked if there was something she could do and she said she didn't know. Ok, whatever. We ended up just ordering our drinks through our waitress. We got chips and salsa for the table, but they charge for that. It's not complimentary, like most standard mexican restaurants.   When placing an order, our waitress kept leaving to go ask questions to the manager. She obviously had no knowledge of the menu. We asked her for a cheese quesadilla with beans on the side and she said they couldn't do that. Huh? Seriously?!?   We ordered the mushroom enchiladas. 10 minutes later our waitress comes back and says they're out of mushroom enchiladas. So we order a bean burrito with beans and veggies inside. 10 minutes later, a different waitress comes by to tell us they can't do a bean burrito with beans inside because the flour tortilla would become soggy. Ok. So, we asked her what else she had to offer that was vegetarian? She replied mushroom enchiladas. We told her that our previous waitress just told us your kitchen was out of mushroom enchiladas. She simply replied, no, we have it. Ummm....ok. Communication issues much?   We finally get our food almost an hour and a half after initially being seated. The mushroom enchiladas were good, but nothing to write home about. Guacamole was also tasty, but after dealing with all of the headaches of our waitress and slow service, I can't recommend this restaurant to anyone. Go to Dos Caminos inside The Palazzo instead. You won't get the ambiance, but at least you'll get delicious Mexican food with good service and capable waiters/waitresses.

a6V0x-ffCFXb9L83ijZg3w.text: Awesome place... Nice ambience.. Perfect food

qW7HXz7XyHAt79Bc-RBtvQ.text: Terrible. Worse than el torito. Ordered 4 dishes and margarita - possibly the worst I have had.

sc1Jxu2CDup_PxyAg2L3FQ.text: We've discovered this restaurant several years ago and keep coming back every time we are in Vegas. Their mussels are to die for... Love the location, patio overseeing the canal and of course, food! Awesome place.

y4XuPQzI4Ey2F2eUKDjJOA.text: Queso fundito was excellent and jalapeno infused margarita- great! Service was very good as well.

LsOzCTjqQEpvyzfCAS5q5A.text: SBC VEGAS SERIES:14 of many reviews Slowing down with the boys!  So a night to ourselves and we really don't know what to do with ourselves.  Hmmmmmmmmm why don't we walk around to see what we can find.   Low and behold we find this spot that I know i've been to in years past.  And if my memory serves me well, there should be some sangria here. Bear in mind this place closes relatively early on a Sunday... well what do you expect on a Sunday?? It is still nice as I recall overlooking the canals and a great spot to people watch if there were still people walking around.   Let me tell you this... your favored three SBC bros. did not let you down. We drank our asses off on sangria in the last hour that place was open. Everything, from discussions of where to go next, to inside politics, to the cute girl that walked on by took on a very alcoholic slant that induced laughter till the wee hours of the morning. I love sangria.   And that is basically how our night started on our last night on the strip.... the beginning of the end of SBC in Las Vegas trip.  ;D

fdrdi8H7lmk-m35W62hPBA.text: After not being able to get a reservation at any of the restaurants at the Belaggio and fighting the crowds, I went on Yelp to find nearby restaurants.  We found this lovely place inside the Venetian Hotel and made an online reservation.  They sat us near the canal, which was lovely.  It was nice and quiet compared with the crowds in other parts of the hotels.  The food was tasty and my dish delicious.  My wife and daughter truly enjoyed as well!

gxFhStGbhmlmHCl1K6MqRQ.text: It was 2 in the afternoon and neither of us had anything to eat yet..  So we were beyond famished...we were becoming irritable.  We decided to quickly scan the Grand Canal for a place to eat...we didn't want a super fancy restaurant at the hotel to have lunch.  We passed the food court...and thought nah!  Saw Canonita and said, let's try Mexican in Vegas.    The decor at Taqueria Canonita is characterized by high-ceilings, bright bold colors, Mexican tiles and Mexican art. Taqueria Canonita offers outside patio dining beside the Grand Canal which offers views of the Venetian streetscape and passing gondolas.  We started with guacomole and chips.  The guac was fantastic...I could have just eaten that with a spoon.  Great texture, very chunky and flavorful.  My entree was thePescado Vera Cruz - fresh catch of the day (happened to be Mahi Mahi that day) sauteed w/ sweet chiles, red onions, green olives, and lemon all simmered with a hearty marisco broth and white rice.  It was yummy.  I'd get that again if I wanted to eat on the light said.    He ordered the Colima Pollo con Limon - grilled chicken breast marinated w/ lime and roasted garlic topped w/ chayote and red cabbage salad, seasonal grilled vegetable and borracho beans.  I wish I had ordered that instead.  Not only did it look yummy, it was great!  The chicken was tender and juicy.  Total bill with tip:  $58

jaFThNSK1Q_6y4K97OlYQg.text: Ok. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing here. I dunno. But I was NOT pleased. Not at all.   I am from LA and I know Mexican. And this place is not Mexican. It's something like what Midwesterners want Mexican to be. I knew I was in trouble when I saw that the the Fish tacos were served with a Chipotle Mayo type thing. Yuck. That is not authentic.   So I ordered the Sopa de Tortilla. A dish I love to order in Mexican restaurants. Not terrible, but not balanced and it really tasted only like a bowl of chili. Eh.  Then my friend ordered the 6 taco platter and I tried the Rajas and Mushroom tacos. Blech. No flavor. Plus (and I hate when restaurants do this) although the menu stated the Rajas Tacos came with Queso Fresco (versus just queso), when it came it was melted Jack Cheese.   That is not Queso Fresco. I guess they don't expect people to know the difference!  The only reason I am giving the 2 stars and not 1 is because their house  made salsa was pretty good. Thank god for that, because it was the only way to flavor the tacos!

QHBQFyPwX7kgZ2wVQfjw5w.text: Janice says:  I'm giving this place 5 stars bc it's been 2 years, and at times, i still think of the pork chops i ordered with the apricot/peach sauce....oh how I miss you.  It's the best i've ever had, and my favorite dish of ALL time!  YUM.  Derek says:  I tried bring Janice to a nicer restaurant while we were in Vegas.  But it was much more on the casual side in the Venetian.  At first we were a little dissappointed but then we stuck with it and the food was really well made.  i ordered some kind of fish dish and didnt like it as much as Janice's apricot/peach glazed pork chops.  They are the best porkchops ever.  Cooked perfectly, still juicy inside and a great sauce.  And the place is by the water so thats a plus.

ZbuG3KHVfyPC4JkyVC337A.text: FAQ  Q: Mexican food inside the Venetian. Doesn't that strike you as odd? A: A city built in the middle of the desert that thrives on gambling and entertainment (adult and otherwise)? A fake Champs Elysees on Las Vegas Blvd.? A city where public intoxication on the main street is okay as long as you're not stumbling and puking? Doesn't that strike you as odd?  No. Of course not. It's Vegas (obligatory: baby)!  Q: How is the sangria here? A: Oh! I'm glad you asked. It is absolutely delicious. Chilled to perfection. Nice large chunks of fruit in there. Get a pitcher. Get two! Thank me later! I don't have sangria often but this is the benchmark on which all other sangria pitchers will be judged.  Q: Woah, this looks like it's right next to the canal, right? A: Totally! It's good times. Be bold, heckle the tourists and the gondola operator.  FYI ... Good times, good people, good location, good food, good booze. No hassles? 5-stars!

EcD9bHybRyBVDhbmSW-A7g.text: I had been to this restaurant before, a couple of years ago, and we went again because of the ambiance and good food.  This time food wasn't great, it was okay, and service was bad.  We made a reservation for 6 at 8:15.  I was really hungry, so I suggested to the group that we go a little early to see if we could get in.  I know that on some occasions ( i.e. when restaurants are busy) that just doesn't work, which would have been fine.  However, there were a total of 3 tables occupied in the restaurant and when we walked up to say we were a little early, they looked at us like, "how dare you!"  It then took about ten minutes for one man to set up 6 sets of utensils, while three other servers stood around. Also, the hosts didn't smile at all.   Our server was nice and helpful about the menu, but the food and drinks still came out slower than we would have hoped.  Finally, the reason I only give this place one star is because when I checked my checking account balance, my debit card was charged $16 more than it should have been! I don't know who's editing the tips on credit card receipts, whether it be the server, manager, whatever, but that's just really sheisty. I'm a server, and I have never tried to basically, steal money from someone on the 'tips' line.

1PoYb3uhqCdq-r6p_3C3yA.text: The Barbacoa was so-so, but the fire roasted salsa is excellent and the red sopa( not the Posole- the one that comes with the Prix Fixe) was the best thing we had here.  The restaurant was canalside, so the ambiance is festive and noisy.  The Tres Leches and Brownie are overrated, but the Peach Empanadas are very good.

kQKcLliVMhAuH4ehQUX46Q.text: My wife and I loved this place. The service was great. It was nice sitting on the patio next to the canal. All of the food we tried was excellent. The mussels and shrimp were my favorite.

VoQw3qxTyFRXq2-J-ZE5uA.text: Good services! Decent Mexican food~ beautiful river view watching boats come and go...great experience!!!

zrk_St_ww7vMaF7BCUw_wQ.text: We had the most enjoyable lunch at Canonita. You simply can't beat the view - right where they start to sing on the canal ride at the Venetian. The food was delicious, the service was excellent, and they sell pitchers of margaritas -- what more can you ask for! Patty, our server, was excellent. The prices are in line for an upscale Mexican restaurant so expect to pay a little more but keep in mind, the ambiance you get because the setting will make it a memorable experience.

kZKvr6yihIutpDn6QYDoDw.text: We have been dining here for years. The food is delicious and the service is great!   Hector P. had excellent recommendations tonight to help us out of ordering our "usuals". Highly recommend the filet as well as the mushroom enchiladas.

kCIn7qVytI5EnbvoapzH7g.text: Canonita calls itself the mexican soul food cafe and they didn't disappoint. Had the chicken quesadilla with mushrooms. So much flavor and the chips and salsa were on point. Service was excellent as well. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a dinner or lunch spot at the Venetian.

wnSzFYvt3vlw5V3nmTHNDA.text: This is the best restaurant in the Venetian! They have the best bartenders , Alex and Javier are so welcoming .. the food and drinks are amazing .. everytime I come to Vegas I always have to come here !

D7i96g9RSJAXh_SxHKpN-A.text: We went here for a quick bite and surprisingly got a table. They have so many tables that's probably why. We were seated beside the canal. Amazing view and location I'll say.  We ordered the shrimp and mussels moqueca to share. The curry taste wasn't overpowering and the coconut milk wasn't undermining the curry. It was the perfect blend of flavors. The shrimp and mussels were beautifully cooked with veggies in the most delicious broth.  We also ordered the chicken quesadillas. Much to my surprise and pleasure it did not come hidden underneath cheese. It was perfectly cooked in yummy tortillas and came with guacamole and beans and cilantro rice (I can still taste the rice btw).  You should definitely go and order more food here.  The service was prompt and nice. Our waitress came with the check quickly because we were in a hurry and made no qualms about the fact that we took a table at prime time and only ordered two plates. That's how you get loyal customers I guess ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quesadillas
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moqueca

ex9KAHz7zgMcbgYz_gv6XQ.text: Very nice restaurant at the Grand Canal Shops mall, great ambiance by the canal, fantastic service and superb food! We were staying at the Palazzo Hotel and went for breakfast, Jesus, our server, was great, he recommended the enchiladas and they were yummy, my husband had the breakfast burrito and it was also excellent. Highly recommend it for a nice breakfast, lunch or dinner!

j8NPtFhHNxLQM7q1RJyOQw.text: Terrible experience.  Bad service and unorganized.  Waited for cilantro rice for 20 minutes only to be told they ran out.  Never got water, chips or salsa either.

Z7O4zdAI1q2J0eP6oxgwng.text: In a word: WHACK. This place was such a bust. Food was really bad and the service was even worse...Honestly, i dont get it. The only reason i gave 2 stars instead of 1 is the location. Its in the Venetian and its right on the canal. But man , outside of that we were left really underwhelmed. Our server was a phantom . We would have to  flag him down multiple times and ask for something like salsa,  and then he would vanish and totally forget to bring whatever we asked for... ....then when we finished we asked for a to-go cup for my wifes beer (you can do that in Vegas) and hes like: 'sure BRB'.....and then disappeared quietly into the night never to be seen again....... granted this was our only experience at this restaurant so maybe it was a fluke but Considering how many fantastic dining options there are in vegas, we would for sure not be returning here...

hF3yWMGJllK0Dgg6G2WIfA.text: Amazing food. Great environment. Loved sitting next to the grand canal where gondolas strolled past me with their gondoliers serenading the crowd.

dm4aN8Vrklu3hhsNAdgFIA.text: Love this place,  and the bartenders are great as always.  Great recommendation from Javier with the Michoacan Pork Carnitas.

vO2JEUZKayElS4h_U5wMfQ.text: I was looking for a nice casual dinner with my husband. Canonita was an excellent choice. The view from the restaurant was so pretty. They have happy hours from 3 pm to 6 pm everyday. We shared a pitch of Modelo beer, which had a little over 3 beers for $11. Also, the food tasted great, and I'm from Texas, so I know good Mexican food. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0ZXPYIYjUXk04Urz4xKTQg.text: A good alternative to the food court. This indoor food truck's tacos are so good, I've had them twice in as many days! Don't expect Taco Bell food here - they are way better than that. My favorite were the Chicken Tinga tacos, but had a combo and they ALL delicious.

Ii_51EZ4g2SGtJ1hpbqHWw.text: Eh, this place was so unimpressive. The prices were fine since the portions were large.  I had the ahi tuna which was overcooked. *side eye*  We were staying at the Venetian for a bachelorette and sone of the girls decided on this place so I just went along with it....so many other places to eat in Vegas, so bummed we wasted one of our meals here.  The server was very nice and the ambiance was nice, hence the 3 stars. Go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu 9.11.15

37iq6ertN28bRKomAg5AkQ.text: Canonita is a descent Mexican food. A little pricy probably due to its location, near the canal, in Venetian. We dined during the happy hour and the drinks were reasonably priced. Our server was very attentive.

0QmLJudHnQJBcEfZ94ZGlg.text: Ate here with my husband last night and had a great time! Sat right by the water, and got serenaded by the boats floating by our whole meal. Started with happy hour drinks and chips, guac and salsa. Both were delicious.  We got the tacos and fajitas- both with mushroom bc we are vegan. They did all the substitutes to make sure we were happy. Our waiter was awesome. Would go back in a heartbeat!

PyqZhhBpYSBTE9lHavsZLA.text: Cythnia was the best server!!!! We had an excellent experience. Food was amazing! Margaritas were great! Definitely a place to return to!

SLmx4m4hG1FHo97G4g80Qw.text: We came here for dinner on a Thursday night.  The restaurant is right on the canal in the Venetian.  We weren't starving so we ordered the chips and guacamole followed by the empanadas and a taco flight.  The empanadas and tacos were very good as was the guacamole.  The chips were a little thick and heavy - I think they would have been better if they were thin, crispy and warm.  But I digest...

NG6EWC8g9pm4xsL60GZbyg.text: This is for the taco truck.  Stopped by because it looked neat and I saw sangria on the menu. SO GLAD I stopped, this was probably one of the best sangrias that I have ever had.  This will be a stop whenever walking through the shops here.  Next time, when hungry we will grab some tacos too!

tPtdeJjp8hgWxuVDw_8L1A.text: Two of us had lunch here with a menu selected by the chef.  Here's a list of items served the two of us.  Chips with rustic salsa and spicy chile salsa and guacamole Roasted mussels and shrimp skillet. Jalapeno queso fundido with tortillas. Appetizer trio sampler--tuna ceviche tostada, posole verde, and chorizo gordito. Patzcuaro duck relleno. Toluca portobello mushroom. Wild mushroom enchildas. Santa Rosa pork barbacoa. Shrimp and mussels Moqueca. Carne asada. Trio of desserts--coffee flan, tres leches cake, warm chocolate brownie.  My dining mate was brought a trio of margaritas to sample in the beginning and later we each were brought a trio of aqua fresca drinks--horchata, prickly pear cactus with lemonade, and watermelon.  I have rarely had a meal when I left without having some comment about something being able to be done better or spiced more or something along those lines. Everything I tasted yesterday was perfectly executed and beautifully plated. Some standouts were the posole verde. Prepared differently than I've ever seen, there was hominy, diced pork, green chile, tomatillos, Mexican oregano, shredded cabbage, and shredded red radish. What a great take on a classic soup! Another was the shrimp and mussel moquec--a Brazilian dish done here with a Mexican flair. The coconut aji amarillo sauce, looking like a curry but tasting nothing like it, gave the shrimp, rice, and mussels a great flavor. Last, the Patzcuaro duck relleno, a Michoacan dish, was superb! The duck confit was excellent. The dish is normally made with smaller poblano chiles, but Chef Willey made two larger ancho chile versions yesterday.  Service throughout lunch was top notch. The ingredients of every dish were explained and we were alerted when we were being served something that was spicy but there was nothing that would raise any spice alarms for me. The green salsa made with several chiles including habanero was spicy hot and I liked it.  Executive chef Willey came by several times to check on us, answer questions, and explain how some of the dishes came about. The General Manager, Annaliza McKinney, also came by to check up on us.  Two hours after being seated I left, very full and very satisfied. Every dish was really well done and I was pleased to have had the chance to try Canonita--a restaurant that I've walked by many times and always wanted to try but somehow never did.

qYEEOLtB_i9CpAxrYsM0AQ.text: Totally awful experience. I have never witnessed such unprofessional, inattentive service. We tried to order a quesadilla and were told that it's a lunch item. Then, we asked to see the chef and he refused to come to the table. We were also told that all food is pre-prepped so they can't make any substitutions - even for food allergies. This place is just plain bad. Do not come here.

rFGrBu9iVSMVaUYTkoJU5w.text: Very pleased to come to this spot.  All the people are nice here and they even have Gondola rides right next to you so you hear the gentleman singing while you're enjoying your food and family. I wasn't to please with the first waiter, He was busy server food so I went to the bar to order a pitcher of modelo. Eduardo poured our beer and becoming our new waiter. Thanks to him we stayed and enjoyed more beer and an great environment. This place is very nice and has great customer service. I will be back for more great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pitcher of Modelo with fresh salsa and chips made daily at another spot. Eduardo keeped our cups full.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sciener

b7QJKg07maG3DxB2CxFTqw.text: Tasty food, this is our second time around visiting this Mexican place. Given the turnover in restaurants in Vegas, it's notable it is still here after a couple years. Clearly popular and on par for prices in Vegas, the food is plentiful and tasty. (Seems like it could be a chain, but never seen one elsewhere.)  Service was prompt and attentive, and they cater for all ages and group sizes.   We went with Chile relleno and the seafood stew, the latter being the better choice. Margaritas were tasty - classic for me, jalapeno for him (big thumbs up on this one!).  Recommend it for anyone in the mood for standard, good quality Mexican fare in the neighborhood of the Venetian/Palazzo.

wiwAsI1IVC_buKXItlVyrQ.text: From top to bottom, the service, food, and atmosphere at Canonita were unforgettable. Our server, Nathan L., was so accommodating to our one year old son (he brought him a kiddie cup and made sure not to put any of the hot dishes near him). Nathan made great menu recommendations, and was so very attentive. I truly enjoyed everything from the chips and guacamole to the Sangria de Rojo. We ordered the chicken enchiladas and they were light and flavorful! The shrimp and mussels appetizer was MOUTH WATERING! The side of vegetables were perfectly cooked. The churros for dessert were BEYOND. Case and point - Canonita is a must stop if you're at the Venetian; but even if you're not, it's worth the trip!

PaP0SqbnwhX64uWfhagGlg.text: Christina is rude. We simply asked if they had nachos, and she laughed, and snarked that nachos aren't Mexican. We just stared at her.  The menu is overpriced. Chips and salsa aren't free. Be warned.   We were starved, order the flautas which were small but tasty. We not enough to get me back. She ruined it.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flautas under a bed of wet lettuce and guac

lZW69HuJ9DRUR81FoAeYbw.text: Variety of breakfast & lunch dishes is wide enough that both meat eaters and vegetarians will all find something satisfactory to eat.   Prices are reasonable.  My breakfast, the levantate, was plenty of food for $11.95.  Tasty. Hand made fresh tortillas cost $1.50 for 5.   Server was sweet natured, smiling, helpful.   Tables situated alongside the fake gondola canal with the singing boatman gliding by just screams ersatz Las Vegas experience.   Disneyland for barely grown-ups.

fbjcu0xti1Tq2ppPrE9QuA.text: I almost forgot about this until my beautiful blushing bride reminded me of the breakfast we enjoyed here one morning in August of 2017. Better late than never, right?  Located on the canal in the Venetian we sat on the patio, enjoying both a view of the canal and the bar and the kitchen. Lots to see and enjoy!  The place seems to draw a good crowd but we had no problem getting reservations via OpenTable.   I have vivid memories of both the great service and food. We enjoyed Mexican pancakes, breakfast burrito, chilaquiles, and something else. I can only remember so much. I had the chilaquiles and really enjoyed them.   A really good experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hXVakyWY9asAAX3QdKXmwg.text: Reliable place in the Venetian.   The chips and guacamole are nice starters.  The mussels and shrimp are my favorite starters.  The kids serving are quite sizable.     The fajitas are nice.  Prefer the chicken over the steak as the steak can get dry.  The five street tacos add a nice variety.    Overall I like this place as a reliable spot to eat if you don't plan ahead.  We have been coming here for over a decade and the kid doesn't mind it as well.  She likes the singing gondolas that pass by.

OXszMGJftRIpswjZ6XDZlg.text: Nothing but good vibes about this place. Had a seat right beside the canal so we had live music and great food. Absolutely loved this menu and the combination of uniqueness and Mexican food. Would definitely return there the next time we stay at the Venetian.   P.S. they have the coolest looking taco truck/stand in front of the restaurant where you can pick up to go or eat there if you don't want to have a formal seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos and seafood stew
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A random drink with vodka and candy rim so delicious
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso con chorizo and the ceviche

sLK8JgmwcKiUcsxD-9nllA.text: Canonita food truck run by Raul, just outside this restaurant, best tacos ever and awesome price! We tried the pork, steak and chicken. All bursting with flavor. Meat is incredibly tender and served on a soft, warm white corn tortilla! Grab food here and grab a drink at HH at the restaurant!

rdRHW0pZJD9u39dR1Z23lQ.text: Used to be a favorite in Vegas. Hadn't been in a long time but did not disappoint. The Queso Fundido app is still great especially hot with the jalapenos. Some of my favorite dishes have been the chile relleno, the fajitas, and the carne asada. I got a burrito last time out and tweaked it by subbing the mole sauce. it was great.   Details:  Place is found in the Grand Canal Shoppes at Venetian. It's not too expensive and one of the few decent sit down Mexican joints on the strip. Margaritas are awesome and the drinks are not at all watered down.   Service is very good. Never had an issue.   On busy weekends make a reservation through Yelp or Open Table ahead of time.   Enjoy!!!

Iq_VY74qQE-rCug2FbUsxg.text: The green salsa is SO VERY GOOD!! We ordered the Queso Fundito and split the 5 soft tacos. Everything was so fresh and came out insanely fast!!  We asked for chips in lieu of the flour tortillas for the dip - our server was SO nice. Definitely recommend the dip!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KA6Nd_jDSEOq_eypvy1gCQ.text: With all of the steak house's, Italian restaurants and seafood place the Las Vegas strip throws at you, why the hell did I pick a Mexican restaurant to have my one dinner in this town while I'm here on a "Pit Stop" trip?   Simple!  I've been on the road a month and I missed this cuisine terribly. Living in L.A. Mexican food is a staple for me and SoCal (other than Mexico) has the best!  So here I am at Canonita salivating over their comprehensive menu wanting to order everything. I settle for the beef Mexico City style enchiladas with rice and beans. Good call on my part, this combo plate was delicious. Washing it all down with a Pacifico beer, I was a happy camper.  The service and atmosphere at Canonita are terrific.   I finished my dinner, hopped in a taxi, saw Hamiton (the musical) and put this evening down as one of my better ones this year.

AMcvQrQI4_lMkQsdWpPnFg.text: Pretty bummed, we were really craving this place and thought we hit the jack pot because it was empty except for the bar and two tables. The girl asked us for how many and we told her 3 but then she said oh we have reached our maximum capacity we have a lot of reservations. We walked by an hour later and the place didn't have anymore people then they did when we asked so I'm wondering if there is a dress code and maybe they didn't want to offend us , we were dress casual.

SUh4eu4G-t9LxEF-BK_nRw.text: Burrito was said to contain chorizo but was only potatoes wrapped in a tortilla.Waiter never even checked on us. Awful service on an empty day. Only redeeming quality was being near the gondolas

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito which allegedly contains chorizo and not just potatoes

WcS-jpepSK-bfkhA9b6YGg.text: Really nice view and delicious food, amazing service too, no long waits to be seated and served. I had a really nice lunch time with you guys!!

s2zV4rLggvbP1uMXIH5pAw.text: To be honest .... this is not mexican food !!!! Bad service the horchata water is tooooo sweeeet!!! Please.... if u want to be in vegas u need more authentic plates w/ flavor!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XRrNVDmTyuBjTg1ULrSoRw.text: The food & service was mediocre. I came in during Happy Hour, wasn't busy at all but for some reason my waitress seemed to have forgotten about us. It took 30min after be seated, to have our water & chips brought out. After placing our order, (we just got appetizers), it took another 30 minutes?! All we ordered was chips & guacamole with some queso fundido....we were also served these dishes WITHOUT any plates...I was looking forward to trying some good authentic Mexican food, but I wasn't pleased. It felt as if everything needed a little bit of salt...To be honest, there's plenty of other restaurants with higher quality food & service to dine at. I would pass on this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso Fundido with Chorizo
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips, Guacamole, Salsa

Ay9e3Ah3a2f-EqZO04ALfw.text: Came here for a quick bite after walking around the Venetian for 4 hours. There was no wait, despite being at the peak hour. The host was attentive and seated me immediately. Depending on seat availability (and how many people in the party), you can get a seat next to the canal to watch passing-by gondoliers/gondolas.  The waiter came out right away as soon as I was seated. My waiter was hepful in explaining the available drinks and menu. As usual, I often order "whatever the bartender wants to make" drink and had the taco sampler. The drink was so good I had to order a second one. I think it was a spin of "mule" (Moscow mule?) of some type.  The ambiance was great if you want to take a break from all the noise and traffic of Venetian. You still get to observe/watch the crowd but you are sitting down enjoying a great meal.  The tacos were delicious  Price is pretty decent and affordable.

d5EgQw-9VOsxfP0LH_Oq5Q.text: I didn't eat there so this is going to be sweet and short people:  If you find yourself thirsty and craving a beer while around the Venetian, this place is worth checking out: during happy hours (5-7 pm), Dos Equis drafts are $3 and margaritas (loaded with ice, but stil) are $5.  Sit down, unwind and enjoy the fake Italy surrounding you. It's not that bad when your expectations are rightly set. Repeat, and leave to get dinner somewhere else.

XgRt47uKf9qy0YBSiCCgTw.text: This canal-side Mexican restaurant used to be a favorite of ours, but it seems to have gone downscale. The chips are no longer served with a tower of various salsas, and the food is now unremarkable.

ORzzUUoTfR-wdkciez2Oew.text: I went because I read about their homemade corn tortillas. It's not worth going out of your way for. The tortillas were good, but the flour was so fine, my tablemates and I thought it tasted more like white flour than corn. The Santa Rosa Pork Barbacoa was delicious. It fell apart with a fork and was a little on the sweet side. Not sure what was so special about the cilantro rice - it was just rice sprinkled with cilantro. There are much better places for Mexican food on the strip.

88MkNEAsHnVDvfzSM7eEDA.text: We decided to explore the Venetian, soon needed a refreshment and discovered Canonita. We each had a cocktail. C had a margarita and I had a Absolute martini. Both very good; as expected, since these two drinks are really hard to screw up. We were shocked that this "Mexican" bar didn't have any Mescal available. Shame, shame, shame.

U9rrEPj6qRJdlo3Pa2os_w.text: After reading the reviews - we gave it a try.  AWESOME!  Just what you all said.  Super friendly staff.  Nice table by the water.  Great food.  Started with guacamole/salsa chips - very good.  Had an order of the portabella mushroom dish and chicken quesadilla - delish.   Great house margarita.  Casual.  We live in Vegas so we aren't tourists.  Will definitely be back!!!  $$$ tho - it is in the Palazzo.  Not cheap!!  Strip prices, but very good.

Q7Q9CT1hBJM_ze0mFGl7kg.text: Checked this place out for a Michelada (which was on their online menu). The bartender didn't know what a michelada was because he gave me a cerveza preparada instead (beer poured over lime and ice with a salted rim). It was still good and nicely cold. He also gave us a free pitcher of beer from an order mistake so that was cool. We only tried the chips and salsa. The salsa was pretty good and tasted homemade and authentic.

P2rjHSv7C2zHZp2pDj3-IA.text: Expect to pay casino prices for decent Mexican food. Had the fajitas and shrimp burrito.  Lots of shrimp in the burrito is a plus.   I took away a star because one shouldn't have to pay for chips and salsa at a Mexican restaurant.  They also charged for a side of pico de gallo. Don't nickel and dime patrons paying $20 for a burrito.

EcIqnquccCfVtyAmc_T7EQ.text: Overall experience was good. Really enjoyed the atmosphere, we had seats right next to the canal. Service was timely and the food was pretty good. Really enjoyed the pineapple margarita that was recommended by server.

xlop81q67LfzZe8y_L1VWw.text: This is a good Mexican food option on the strip. The food is all good, but nothing that will blow away your taste buds, or your wallet. The main reason we went here was that it took reservations. And on the strip on a busy Friday night, that is valuable. Overall a good experience.

BTLaEpI29sOiaNinq7cBcg.text: 1 star is too much for this place. No flavor, lack of seasoning, & low quality ingredients are the reoccurring theme at this overpriced Resturant .  First off , They charge you for chips n salsa which is free at virtually every Mexican Resturant . The salsa is bland & no flavor.   The ceviche trio was NOT fresh n we had to send back. The Chef try's to get too creative with his ceviche recipes as one is more disgusting n lacking flavor or seasoning as the next.  Way overpriced fajitas , which once again had zero flavor , no seasoning and very low quality meat (steak). They basically give u about 7-8 pieces of very fatty meat and load up on the vegetables and get u for $18. The chicken quesadilla literally smelled like that stuff u find between ur toes. We basically ate almost nothing and they credited us for most of the food. When the waitress agrees that the quality had gone done hill fast , it's never a good sign. Would never go back even if they comped the entire meal . I'm embarrassed for this place and the Mgr. seems so aloof to the problems . There are way better places to eat in Las Vegas for the same $$ , don't waste ur time n money at this place.

WdijaF2P6g8d2mbDvUyqKg.text: It's nothing out of the ordinary. Basic mexican food at a reasonable price. But the drinks are very good and have some unique names. I would not recommend it unless you're starving

CjFxMmnu-F7yHaIoBELsVQ.text: Restaurant was packed so we didn't bother to wait so I can only rate on their margaritas to-go. My friend ordered a watermelon margarita in their 48oz tube. We're not the type to walk around Vegas with a huge tube of alcohol, or lack of in this case, but my friend's been saying he would get one of those one day but we didn't think it would cost us $31! Seriously it would've been a great deal if it had a lot of alcohol in it, but it just tasted like bland watermelon juice.  I'm glad that we didn't wait 30mins for dinner because it doesn't seem like the food would've been good. We headed to Dos Caminos @ the Palazzo which has better ratings. Drinks were great over there.

sNq3b6FczlvH3LgFSym7kA.text: So for starters you must have the Guacamole Chips and Salsa! its so delicious! also the quesadillas are good as well... they have so much to choose from the margaritas are also strong but so so good! i recommend coming here for happy hour!

dmQWvzopzw8ws1flDe8NUg.text: My friend and I had an amazing night at Canonita. Awesome food and great service! Especially Justin who I think was the manager that night. He made our time at Canonita fun and a night full of smiles. Deff. would go back!  Thank You Justin

XvhZ6jLksvD1ybBaBoeJig.text: Chips were very nice and the guacamole was amazing (salsa was good but not my style).  Our waiter was not overly attentive but my Carne Asada was off the hook - which made up for it! My wife loved the Chicken Fajitas.

xpy9x9644er0MNcuT8hCww.text: Best Mexican I've ever had,  amazing how starting with the perfect drink can set the tone for the rest.  Best regular margarita and best jalapeno margarita I've ever had,  without question. The atmosphere is great,  feels like you're outside at Venetians grand canal,  every few minutes you hear a different Italian gondola singer.   Had the taco assortment,  I'm a sucker for cilantro,  ever aspect of the meal was great and compared to a few other high dollar meals we had in Vegas this trip,  Canonita stands out in my mind as the best.

onH6eNSTrsf3Hw6ZXgfLDA.text: Canonita,  on the canal inside The Palazzo, is a wonderful restaurant to sit and relax or have a nice meal.  We spent four days at The Palazzo for a conference and ended up at this restaurant for either drinks or a meal.  Their menu selection is very tasty and has some unique dishes.  They make a jalapeno margarita that is very delicious.  The bartenders, Javier and Mario, are a blast to hangout with.  Their other waitstaff is very friendly too.  The managers, Mike and Marasol, were friendly and enjoyed the laughter going on within their restaurant as we partied into the night.  They offer Happy Hour specials during the day as well as later in the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LOVED their jalapeno margaritas!

nIRGwzG9s54PkB38_Bv7vQ.text: This place was great. The food, service, and view was all very good. It was neat seeing the gondolas boat past you!

D4VzvU674FwxDAkB9yewpA.text: The Barbacoa was awesome! Very tender...cooked in a banana leaf for hours...it was just falling apart and i could eat it with just my fork. The sides were good too...some flavored rice, and black beans. The signature margarita drink was very good, not too sweet. The Mexican flan was OK. I could have skipped that.

eXg_DkmWN6JhhOYJVMRivw.text: The pizza here is fantastic along with the salads. I loved the pizza so much that I ordered it on two different occasions during my last trip to Vegas. This is a great lunch spot because they have both heavy and lighter options. The only downside is the noise if you eat outside, but I guess it's decent people watching.

j5yYuCa7ML5ZxMjRLQjC_g.text: After last night's sad episode elsewhere, this was a refreshing change. Our server was attentive, understood the request and made us feel invited.   Food was good. Jalapeno margarita was just perfect. Chicken enchiladas with mixed sauce hit the mark. Tres le Che's cake was bit of a disappointment since it was kind of dry.

ZrKMKVhAFDun4IdZMrFIfA.text: I'm typically not a fan of Mexican fare on the Strip because the outrageous prices tend to lead to disappointment and regret. But, Canonita proved to be a pleasant surprise with it's quality ingredients and above average execution. Located  in the Grand Canal area of the Venetian with much of the narrow restaurant overlooking the man made waterways and sitting under the faux sky, the ambiance can be surprisingly relaxing.  Their drink list is full of custom cocktails and margaritas. The pineapple infusion margarita ($11) was excellent with tropical flavors and hints of vanilla. For those that can't decide, they've got a margarita flight ($15) with a classic,  jalapeno, and pineapple version.  Plenty of popular dishes can be found on the menu like flautas ($12), three per order, all crispy and tightly rolled with ample amount of ground beef inside topped with an avocado-tomatillo sauce, lettuce and quest fresco. The entrees were quite good. The wild mushroom enchiladas ($21), covered in a poblano cream sauce, were an excellent vegetarian option. The Santa Rosa pork barbacoa ($21) was a hefty portion of for-tender meat topped with a slightly acidic sauce, surrounded by fluffy and buttery cilantro rice and accompanied by tortillas to make your own tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres tacos ($16)
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Santa Rosa pork barbacoa ($22)
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushroom enchiladas ($21)

u-1JS6IHsk2FAbdaH5eBPQ.text: My friends picked this place for a casual Mexican place. They liked it more than me so take the review with a rim of salt.   Margarita was fine if a bit pricey. The guacamole was pretty good with warm chips.   But the maindish of enchiladas were just lack luster. Add green rice and beans and for $22 you just felt like the markup was about $18.   Friend got the salmon which was probably a better call but overall the menu doesn't have a ton of choices and there just are so many other better places.   Plus side: good view of canal.

qJ4FhuPxAV0TOVH1FP_MQg.text: Great place with an amazing atmosphere overlooking the canals. Jesus waited our table for my girlfriend and I beautifully. He honestly deserves 10 stars, but this'll do. The food was delicious as well, especially the Papas bravas. Thank you for such a wonderful experience, definitely going back.

CVuP9aKL4ecftaUlvzmkOA.text: I really wanted to love this place as I love Mexican food. Everything was OK but the margarita. The margarita was so sour I couldn't drink it. Did I mention it was my birthday? And I still couldn't get it down- no bueno. Had the chips and salsa and guacamole. Star of the night was the guac. Maybe should have had a draft Mexican beer and guac and  left happy. Ventured to the crab salad next- it was OK, a little over dressed. Ordered the carne nortena- had a salty crust on it- too much; needed to back off. I think the server was stretched because  he went missing for long periods of time. When he did stop by he was attentive but you could tell he was harried. All in all it was over $100 for two and just OK. So many options in Vegas might want to just hit this for the view and an appetizer and keep moving.

pEimexeDryVL5ZENrT9xyg.text: Enjoy homemade tortillas with their street tacos in this cute restaurant next to the indoor section of the gondola ride in the Venetian. You can sip on a drink while listening to the singing of the gondola drivers as the boats pass by. Good choice for a date night or romantic meal. Server was really helpful and accommodating.

xKrecg9ngubQzMZn8LUkDg.text: Back at it again. Such an amazing place eith happy hour prices for pitchers of beer i got the apppetizer mussels and shrimp and chicken burrito. Amazing thank you Jean !!!!!!

j1gqs9ciGFeVk-Mr7K0yvQ.text: Great guac and queso fundido (we got it with chorizo and the jalapenos on the side). My Carne Asada was delicious but a little tough. The happy hour specials are wonderful and you can get a $5 margarita and watch the gondoliers drift by and sing opera. The location and ambience was my favorite by far during the whole trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from our table
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The gondoliers that drift by and sing opera.

AukD-LfjScXhUTv3r1awXw.text: Came to celebrate our Anniversary. Love this place.  Enjoyed sitting in the patio. Beautiful restaurant. Great service. Food was Amazing. Salmon was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L_AbIfLwVBDf5aakS2OE8w.text: Canonita is all about the atmosphere ! And the great ends there.   Pros: beautiful location right next to the canals!  Decorated beautifully   Cons: food leaves on a mediocre note.  Service subpar.   Booking a reservation through open table was a breeze and was honored when I showed up. And the good service comes to an end right there. Being seated right next to the canal was something very beautiful that you can only do in Vegas. Lights hang above your head and overall it really is a beautiful location. But the food does not match anything close to the decor. You'd expect amazing food at a prime spot at one of the world's largest hotels. Unfortunately not so much at this place. Not horrid, but definitely not wow. The fajitas were just there. You're tasting the steak the peppers the onions, but where's the wow ? Where's the melting in your mouth? Where's the mmm? Perhaps the waiter took it along with the what seems to look like a place with awesome service on the outside. Not too attentive despite a not so busy day. When asked for lemon or anything else to be brought at the table it took a good 10 minutes for the waiter to come around again. All in all was checked up on once. I suppose the service matches the food. Mediocre. It is a True travesty both could not match what is other wise a beautiful restaurant in a prime location. Do I recommend it ? It depends , what's your definition of a memorable restaurant experience while you're on vacation?

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MopbAKsnB_BmRunSCrrU2A.text: Some of the best Ahi tuna I have had when visiting Vegas and it won't brake the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really gooooood Ahí tuna a must have!!!

QRNifGCsO0kzYqRvWRrNOQ.text: Delicious mexican food.  Great service, but the highlight was Cherrie our server.  She was an absolute joy.  Thank you.  Sean and Trevor

JBADooGdvV4x8PSjg2Nmxw.text: Great place! It is easily located. Great seating area. You can see so much. Wonderful selection on food! The sangria is delicious. The service is wonderful. The guacamole is so good. I would come back for sure.

TAfoiF_rqZW2xHP70fRhTg.text: I went to visit the restaurant this past weekend. Very nice place. The waiter was nice but seemed a little overwhelmed with the party size. A few of my guest enjoyed their food and others not so much . Carnitas plate was very dry and the fajita plate was dry and had no taste. It was also cold. Some members weren't happy about that. Especially we drove 5 hrs to get there.

_oa8bXM0J4qbnSGy1PnMZQ.text: Group Dining Event Review:   We had a banquet here. We had a party of about 18. It was a bit difficult for me to plan since I'm out of state. I had some issues dealing with some other restaurants and finding a place that worked with our budget. For the event pricing, the prices were reasonable and the food and ambiance matched what we were looking for.   The event coordinator, Jessica, was great to work with. She was accommodating and very responsive. In our party, we had a child, an infant, and someone with special needs. Jessica and the restaurant staff were accommodating.  We had a special menu that our guests were allowed to pick from at the time of the event. I liked that we were able to do that instead of deciding days/weeks before the event. Our table was along the canal and we were situated a little further from everyone else. It worked out perfectly for us. Everyone at the table enjoyed the chips, salsa, guac, and their menu items. I had the Vaquero Beef Rib. It was excellent! It was tender and the polenta that came with it was great. I also tried the Chile Relleno. It was good. We had a great time and great food - we couldn't be happier with our choice.

b1LiYsJW5LvSmc-ZtHvogg.text: Beautiful ambiance, amazing food and fast service! Had the grilled chicken burrito. The quality and taste of food was very good.

cbfoBXTXI2XCbLe6pTgMcw.text: The food was amazing! Ishmael was a great waiter.  The shrimp and calamari appetizer was fabulous! The margaritas were so good.  Katherine came over to wish us a happy anniversary. She was so sweet and lovely! A wonderful place to spend our 25th anniversary right next to the singing gondoliers. Great night! We'll be back! Many thanks!

AzXFts6Vk8S709vk59aTzQ.text: The location in the Venetian is excellent, right on the canal which is cool, making the atmosphere great. Service was good. Unfortunately, I feel like the dining experiences in the Las Vegas area just aren't as exciting as they used to be. Canonita is no exception. I'm not saying the food was bad. But, for the prices these places are charging, I want to feel like I am getting my money's worth. And, come on... charging $4 for chips and salsa?  and another $9 to add guac???   Our dinner just was not exciting enough to make me want to come back. Standard Mexican fair at twice the price. . .

ogd5qk7O1NkTs5GsQhlGtA.text: We loved this restaurant!  We came here for brunch the day we arrived and loved it so much we came back the next day. Food was amazing, bottomless mimosas and great service by Jesus...

wFkpCkpCcDRIpRYEViLJDA.text: Went for a anniversary date with my husband we sat "on the water" which was nice with the gondolas passing by. The ambience was really nice not something you have to get dressed up for but you could if you wanted to. Food was good I expected a little more out of it for the price but it was good we had a good waiter Brian I believe and he was helpful they do offer military discount which is a plus. Overall a nice time.

tKTpXRpXbM43NTnfDClE_g.text: Great food! Pablo (our waiter) was really nice and Christine (the manager?) let us know that locals get 10% off. My salmon was delicious, and the guacamole was so fresh. Everyone loved their entree. The drinks were outstanding. I had a blackberry margarita. Nice ambience in an open indoor courtyard. Enjoyed the canal view too. Lovely. I will be back!

yTZ6m97g6Das7o--KsajKA.text: I had these tortillas with a queso dip, by looking at the menu I thought it would be regular cheese quesadillas, but I was pleasantly surprised when I received a very tasty cheese dip with vegetables straight out of the oven, in a cast iron plate. It kind of reminded me of pasta Alfredo, but without the macaroni. Thanks again, it was very good!

0xDYQ_t4pAnrjc5PDd6uMw.text: Best Mexican food in Vegas! Inside Venetian watching the grandolier pass by with their passenger !

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Located inside the canal shoppes. Listen to gondola men sing as they pass by while they ate.

aX4718tKIH-EPOvehRNqXQ.text: Located in the Venetian, the location was pretty good. You could watch the gondolas go by. The food was pretty good but the reason why I will not go back is because they charged me .75 for salsa. Are you serious? I ordered a burrito and the cheese fundito. I asked for hot sauce or salsa, which they brought out. But I couldn't believe when I saw the charge for salsa at a Mexican food restaurant. This is absolutely unacceptable. What's next? Charging me for ketchup on my hamburger? Ridiculous.  Forgot to mention. Chips and salsa are extra. They also made me a cherry coke using grenadine. But when I asked for a refill, the bartender said no more grenadine. This place is poorly run and not up to Vegas standards. Hire a new manager and make the experience fun instead of nickel and diming us to death.

po_H7L1MURbWPvzUGY0qvQ.text: Great atmosphere right by the canal. Good service and the restaurant takes reservations. The food was tasty but most importantly the atmosphere was super fun!! It was like sitting outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco sampler

HSXOpxn2vX8z4fYrD1H73A.text: Food and drinks were good. Definitely try the short ribs. I inhaled it! Fun location too.

Cei58O0mP6BS5iQBMEIhFQ.text: What an amazing location, these guys have the best view (feels like in Italy, eating Tasty Mexican food). Venice feels great, when you get a seat munching on food right next to water with singing people and tourists.  I m late reviewing this place and it's food, probably missed it amidst the glitter of Las Vegas. The food here is good, and we also tried some margaritas to go with our food, which were a bit disappointing. Couldn't taste much alcohol in them, so had them get a new order, which were far more improved version.  The food was good, but nothing out of the world. We tried tres leeches which was just ok, expected it too be better, but too much orange killed it.  I wished the food was a bit better as the location and service were excellent. Would like to come here and try something new next time, the vibe is just amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coco pania (ok drink )
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajita tejanas
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Empanadas

VyL6LNQm6PnSDus8pHhHTA.text: Jesus made our first time here exceptional! The group ordered quesadillas, enchiladas, and barbacoa and every dish was amazing! Thank you Jesus Salas! We will be coming back very soon!

vn6y3baPi4PGjx9C3vAwLw.text: I decided to try this spot since I stayed at the Venetian.  Who doesn't love Mexican food???  I was greeted by 2 friendly ladies.   Sat down promptly. The waiter, Jesus, greeted me & hub promptly.  Took our order.  I ordered the beef ribs quesadillas which was delish.  It came with black beans and rice which both were good.  I also ordered a side of guacamole.  Do not order it if you are the only one at the table that likes it because they give u a lot.  My hub ordered the braised beef tacos which he stated that he did not like the taste of the taco shells, but did enjoy the rice.  He said the meat was seasoned well.  I also ordered the ginger tea which was delicious.  It's a nice place.  A tad pricey but we wanted to try something different than the food court options.  If you are on a budget, definitely may want to look elsewhere.  This is more of a uppity food spot, but enjoyable.  The server, Jesus, was cool, on point with his service.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pENzGWy0FXAS-MUqPQw9Gg.text: Very surprised how good the food and drinks are. Was not expecting this type of quality for Mexican food in Vegas. Usually only find it in SoCal. Great selection of Anejo tequilas. 90% of people will see the drinks and never buy them but once's you try them you will never drink anything else. You will go to your local store to find an entire bottle.

kvmhTlT7WmZAcnDch5Og2g.text: Chips & Salsa was delicious for only $5.  Well worth it.  The meals are $$ than your standard Mexican restaurant meals, but the portions are bigger.  Service was good.  All in all a good restaurant.

cjFzY3AHcNL7SVfb2fSY6Q.text: Margs were really sweet, guac and chips are decent, fish tacos have minimal fish... just v mediocre in general

PmytAZnZpLjB38_v2oQpDA.text: Decided to have my wedding dinner here on 4.28.18 for a party of about 50. My husband and I had eaten here while on vacation the week we got engaged in 2016. We both really liked the food and loved the view of the gondola canal -we even saw a wedding in one of the gondolas while we were dining here! Once we decided to have our wedding in Vegas, we knew we wanted to have dinner here. I had been working with Valerie since I made the reservation around July 2017 so it was definitely a long planning process! Valerie was so patient and accommodating with my requests and questions, she made sure everything turned out perfect! At first I wanted a simple dinner, no extra requests. But after speaking with our photographer from the Wynn hotel where we had our ceremony, she suggested we could do a cake cutting at the restaurant which I brought up to Valerie. I was able to order a cake through the AquaKnox bakery -Valerie allowed me to customize it with flowers, my own cake topper, cutter and server. I sent her a pinterest inspiration image which she gave to the bakery and it turned out  A M A Z I N G!!! The bakery totally nailed it and it was so delicious too! The staff at Canonita were awesome as well! We requested our own sweetheart table when we got there -my dress was pretty fluffy with the long train so it was difficult to sit amongst everyone else with the chairs being so close. I asked one of the servers and they brought out a table and two chairs for us right away and took our drink orders as well. They definitely made sure we had everything we needed. They also made sure we were on schedule and reminded us towards the end of dinner about the cake cutting. Overall, we had an amazing experience and would definitely recommend Canonita for dining and special events. Thank you Valerie and Canonita for helping make our wedding day so special!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our beautiful wedding cake by AquaKnox bakery
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our wedding cake table setup

VtVkx_yz3wvdAf3sD4-gtw.text: We enjoyed dining at Canonita very much. I had a pork and rice dish, red sangria and churros. All of it was amazing. But what made the experience especially nice was our server, Laura. She was really attentive and made us feel like we'd been dining there for years. I'd definitely return for the great food and service.

nMq5TkF-I6h0uVmQ8W2sQw.text: Ordered the Tres Tacos. The tortillas were thick and soggy. They attempted to make street tacos but it didn't turn out well at all.  The Beef had a pretty good flavor. The red onions on the tacos were over powering. I definitely wouldn't order these again. Especially since they are priced at over $5 per taco.  I stick will the Taco carts in SLC.  Chips and salsa would have been good but the basket of chips they brought our table were large crumbs with some full sized chips mixed in.   I will give the waiter kudos for keeping my drink full.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Tres Tacos with cilantro rice and black beans. Read review before ordering!!!

cbUVHMNusbDtTQ4iDd_e9w.text: Be careful. They charge you without your permission for random stuff. They have floating customer base. So they don't care. Canonita charged me $400 for leaving the table late. Fortunately, my bank helped me block the charge and dispute it. BE Careful.

DDzV7YZtUZy2v3DIX4cQhA.text: This place is a gem! It's inside the Venetian right next to the water where the gondolas rise by. The food is so good that my wife and I went twice in one weekend! We started with a guacamole, and it was some of the best guacamole I've had and I'm from Texas where Mexican food is authentic and everywhere! The first time I ordered the braised beef quesadillas and the were wonderful, my wife got the steak tacos and they were even better! We ordered a pitcher of mango margaritas and it was one of the best margaritas I've ever had. Also, the pricing for this place is well below the average of a quality restaurant in Vegas. I will definitely eat at this place again!

MDmnRMn7f-kOcDmdKe2LAw.text: Overpriced. Margarita tasted virgin. Mexican is my favorite and the meal was double the price it should have been! I got the steak fajitas and the meat was very chewy with pieces that had a lot of fat and gristle. Not a flavor explosion like the other meals I've eaten in this city. I was disappointed. The guacamole was pretty good and it was a large bowl but it still wasn't worth $14

yCv1JRntYUHofweOUkGTJQ.text: We love the food here. Excellent authentic flavors and good service. Order a margarita! They are strong and yum!   The food is high quality, so don't expect freebies. Yes you pay for chips, salsa and guac. But the freshly made salsa is delicious and the guac is excellent.

9AGfmirl20BODFGBCLGlcw.text: Went for breakfast. The tables overlooking the water only sat two people and we had three but that was fine. My husband got the breakfast burrito and I got the sandwich with fried eggs instead of scrambled. I forgot what my daughter got but you will see it in the photos. Had a nice mimosa. The food was very good and our particular server was nice. My daughter is a very successful food/lifestyle blogger in NYC so when the food came out she took our plates to an EMPTY table by the water to do a 2 minute shoot for her blog which would have been free advertising for the place. A lady came over.I don't know if she was a server or the manager and blessed her out, saying loudly, you can't do that . Move that stuff right now! Talk about rude! My daughter tried to explain, but this woman was not hearing it. She kept repeating now we will have to reset this table! Really lady. Nobody is eating here. I wanted to just leave but we stayed. I guess this blog will be different than the one last week where she was invited to The James Beard House. Inexcusable behavior.

gT4F5ZqWEF3YwdhEdnc7tw.text: My BFF had her wedding reception here because of the "outdoor" dining, great prices and reputation and this place didn't fail to deliver. Loved the great / original selections of pesca/lacto-ovo menu items. Only complaint was the overrpriced margs but that's Vegas for ya! Would def go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy fish tacos were perfect!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great vegetarian wild mushroom enchiladas!

7GmwTrAkLYFGylj43uM30g.text: The wild mushroom enchilada comes with a cilantro cream sauce that will move the earth for you. Fresh margaritas...chips and caramelized onion salsa plus a terrific mole chick tortilla soup!!!!!! Wow

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
