N9KP88cQBWYji71odBtd8g.text: The rice was not fully cooked - crunchy. I mentioned it to the waiter and this macho man argued with me. I'm not mad, but overall this was bad food at a high price. It was not cooked. I left a little note on check number 4534. Based on the ticket, the server was Nathan. I was nice and he quickly argued with me. I felt disrespected.

UmK-XyfSYnyA96kBVftYBA.text: The view is gorgeous- white sangria is delicious, warm chips and salsa were soo good. Does it get much better? I went yesterday for my birthday, our server was excellent and brought me a free shot to celebrate. I left completely stuffed! The chicken fajitas were incredible! I definitely had a food baby when I put on my dress to go out that night...

wS33fvrT1iDQ1rkPXZMqZA.text: Lovely location on the Canal.  Classic margaritas are tangy with fresh lime juice, some of the best I've had. Queso Fundido comes with freshly made tortillas. A bit heavy on the fresh cilantro, but that may just be me. Hubby loved the mushroom enchiladas, I somewhat enjoyed the shrimp burrito. Shell was drier than I'm accustomed to in a burrito, but the filling was good. The cilantro lime rice was fresh and well-cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KlktX3UtDezVBvYhCq6OGw.text: Very pricey for very bad quality food. The outdoor view is nice. Waiter was very nice. They should fire the chef or the management who orders bad quality of food

ce6iJP4t0-suSgqpplMKDQ.text: Wow, very amazing place! Great to just sit, relax, and enjoy people-watching/the gondola singers. Waitress was nice and gave excellent suggestions, and this is what we ordered:  Chips and guac: Bf wanted side of guac for his burrito, and waitress suggested getting this ($8) as it comes with chips, salsa, and a big tub of guac rather than $6 for a tiny dish of it. She was right...salsa is AMAZING! Guac was plenty flavorful with a slight kick, and the chips were light, fresh, and salty yum! Not oily or heavy at all :)  Chicken burrito: Yum. Came in a big plate with rice, lettuce/tomatoes, and black beans. Wet burrito...very filling and flavorful. It was a wonderful dish.  Ceviche sampler: Came with a different type of tortilla chips...thicker and flaky with some seasoning. The crab-shrimp ceviche was AMAZING and the lemon added a zing to it. Ahi tuna/mango was very good as well, but you really need to mix it in the sauce otherwise it has a slightly fishy smell. The fish ceviche was okay, but rather plain and the oil really threw me off. The sampler as a whole was not bad though.  I think the bf and I found a new restaurant for us to be regulars at! Very relaxing atmosphere, good food at a decent Vegas price....what more can we want? Only thing is that for happy hour, the well drinks (whiskey and coke for instance) comes in a super tiny cup...may not be worth it.

4i-RJx70qYTBG7CPgGdUhA.text: Mexican food in an Italian themed resort. Sure, why not!  Came here at a recommendation of a coworker and sure glad I took his suggestion. The place was mellow for a Friday lunch. Grab a spot "outdoors" so you can pretend you're in Venice as the gondolas float on by.  We ordered the beef tacos and chicken fajitas entrees. Each comes with that addicting cilantro rice in that bright green hue. mmm...I could just eat that rice nonstop, and not because I'm Asian! The beans where meh. But, but...their beef and chicken were marinated just with the right spices which made the entrees so delish, both of us were borderline licking out plates.   Oh, and you can't get Mexican food w/o a Margarita. Hot damn..those were divine...

SKAWUtHu__ld437ihe3qnw.text: The hostess told us it was an hour wait, but people kept walking up and she seated them. They prepare everything with latex gloves so I couldn't eat here anyway. The customer service was awful. So sad for such a nice spot!

8q1K5G5coWnCl3KhuNnuiQ.text: Excellent margaritas (just say you don't want it sweet). Great service tonight. Delicious chicken tacos! Excellent veggie fajitas. Chips and guacamole and salsa were fab too. Nothing about this place disappointed us. We are glad we stumbled upon it. I think it might be a different experience if it was very very crowded at the hotel, but tonight it was wonderful.

UlI3a5sgMV7zPOtShZ7mDw.text: We were just here for drinks, but they were some damn good drinks!! I'm not even a margarita person, but the pineapple infused tequila... YUM! You can tell that the ingredients are fresh, and the service was fantastic. Shout out to Alex--he was a great bartender!

xABTz6npXu3zo-Y-JFrAXA.text: They put crack in the salsa   That's the only rational explanation   Because its not the chips, I've had better, and looking at the salsa its nothing special, looks like some regular old fire roasted fare.   But then you taste it, damnnnnn, before you know it you're on your third cup of it.   I've been coming here every Vegas trip for years, they must have a high turnover as far as staff goes becuase I don't recognize one person each time. Its a little cheesy watching the singing gondolas go by while you're drinking overpriced Don Juilio Real and munching on the chips and salsa, but hey its Vegas.   Back to the salsa, because as far as the food goes, we're spolied in L.A., we get better mexican food at little holes in the wall and at home than we do in these high end joints. It seems like they've kicked the salsa up a notch in recent years, still gabacho friendly but with a little bit more of a kick.

zDTjxstFIoO_1M7SUeoYkw.text: We will become regulars here very, very soon.  We like to go to restaurants and eat a few bites here and there, plus a good signature cocktail, wine or beer. Taqueria Canonita satisfied every taste bud possible.  We ordered: Sake to Me (Sake, Tequila, Horchata and Cinnamon), Chips, guacamole and salsa, and then two chicken tacos, one beef taco, one pork taco and one fish taco. Before I told the waiter, Ishmael, that I was gluten free, I asked if the tacos came with corn tortillas. This one comment lit a lightbulb and he knew I was gluten free and just a list of knowledge came from his mouth. He told me I couldn't have this or that meat because it is marinaded in beer or soy sauce (without checking with his chef/manager), that I can have the flautas, but they're fried with glutenous items, that the chips were safe because they were corn and that we must have the guacamole. WOW.   Normally I love guacamole that burns and cools all at the same time. Taqueria's guacamole was excellent, and that's without them asking if we would like it mild, medium or spicy. I didn't care that it didn't burn, it was fresh and delicious. The salsa had a healthy kick but the lime and cilantro added great flavor to the chips and tacos.   The drink? Wowzers. Not too sweet, not too savory, not a strong taste of alcohol but it definitely had a punch. Creamy but still silky without being too rich. I will try to replicate this drink at home until my dying day.  The tacos. Ohhhhh, the tacos. I wish I had ordered five of the fish tacos with a beautiful mango salsa, grilled and blackened and oh so happy. The chicken tacos were made of white AND dark meat (necessary)and were tender and flavorful and were topped with cilantro and onions. My husband could have eaten the beef tacos all night (not gluten free), and he said they were some of the top beef tacos he's ever had (and we eat far too many tacos). The pork tacos did not ignite as much excitement, but he still enjoyed them just the same. All of them were wrapped in homemade, thick, warm corn tortillas which made my world go round that night.   All in all, we will be back. If you're gluten free, get over here now. Great environment, try to sit on the patio which rests alongside the canals in the canal shoppes so you can hear the beautiful singing of the gondoliers and relax under the beautiful Venetian skies.

BVPqBlCXuTHP6MGtFOF19Q.text: The only reason this place gets two stars is because of their guacamole and cilantro rice. Otherwise-BOOOOOO!  I was seated with a table of 12 of my coworkers for a team dinner.The waiter had already served drinks to the first arrivals but when the rest of us got there it was literally about 20 minutes before he came back again. From there it was just a service nightmare. I think this guy figured that it was a party of more than 8 so his gratuity would be just automatic. After that, he phoned it in.  I asked for a veggie quesadilla-simple request-take your cheese one and add some peppers and onions. The server literally said "We won't have any veggies up any time soon other than potatoes." Most bizarre comment ever. I got an entree salad that had a few beans and tomatoes but other than that was a snooze fest.  It took about 45 minutes to get our entrees and by the time it was all said and done, the entire ordeal was nearly 3 hours long. That was from seating to the completion of the meal-and believe me, it's not because all my coworkers felt like hanging out all night. Skip it!

CE9HKfJyjd9oweHswcIVyQ.text: Had lunch here and it was very good. Started with the sashimi tro.  And then moved on to the ahi tuna that was fabulous. We tried the margarita on the rocks and they were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna

8c-z79ZV5drq-mLrGEEutw.text: The service was spotty and the stoic waiter only challenged the situation. As mentioned by a previous review - a Mexican restaurant in an Italian themed hotel should have been enough warning. My wife ordered a salad and it had browned edged iceberg lettuce and 5 bits of chicken.  My grilled chicken breast dinner came cut in fajita style.  My chicken was bland, tasteless and cold. I paid extra for two Patron tequila margaritas and got 2 virgin slushies.  This locale needs to understand the value of friendly service, proper food presentation and pride in customer service.

VVMFlMxOwI23fBEzGfeqUA.text: It's Vegas.. the city that never sleeps?! Wrong. My friend and I got a table for us & our boyfriend/husband. The hostess was very friendly and sat us right away. Once we sat down our waiter came by for our drink order & immediately told us we needed to order because they were closing. The guys were still heading down from the hotel, so we felt completely rushed and uncomfortable. We finally ordered and mine was wrong, and we sent it back. The manager started laughing! The place was a joke. If you are closing why would you seat a party of four? It makes no sense. Don't seat us and then rush us out. It was very strange and we will never be back. The food tasted terrible too.

u759wBLI__cZ0FAJ5-W3ww.text: Excellent food I didn't expected to be so authentic . Great ambiance very romantic also since you can seat along the gondola canal. Food was very tasty I got the tres tacos and a coco pina. OMG super Delicious it's a must when you are at the Venetian

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres tacos

diTMGfF72v-yh0XMr7zhoQ.text: I tried an ahi tuna dish that was very good.  I also ordered the salsa and chips as well as guacamole, all of which were fantastic.  It's pretty entertaining watching gondolas float by with the occasional serenade.  Happy hour 3p-6p and 9p to close.

plUJWx4RlzEzcC2_RyqF3A.text: Great place to grab a good burrito!  This is an awesome restaurant.  The food is amazing.  Portion sizes were great & the atmosphere was amazing.  While having dinner we witnessed a proposal in a gandola.. The outdoor seating gives it a romantic, elegant atmosphere.  The staff is friendly and truly dedicated to their customers.  Ensuring the best quality of service!  Great place to dine!

3k2TagjyEVh3g47rBsjcuw.text: I looked over the many Italian options in the Venetian, but this cute Mexican restaurant with its twinkle lights, yummy menu and wonderful location right next to the Grand Canal just stood out for all the right reasons. So glad we had lunch there! First of all, the gondoliers belt out beautiful songs there as they make the turn to head back under the bridges under the painted sky. We opted to sit right next to the waterway and were not disappointed with our view and dining experience. Our server was friendly, knowledgeable and quick to refill my husband's ice tea numerous times; thanks Juliette! The food was delish and the picky eater in our group was happily fed. I'm still craving the Queso Fundido and I have to go back and order the Taco Sampler again so I can have more of that Mushroom Taco. Would not have typically ordered that but it was packed full of flavor and had I not already been stuffed, I would've surprisingly finished that too! Unfortunately our tabletop was a little small for containing our order but it was definitely worth shuffling plates around a bit and the servers were very accommodating. Overall, a great experience which I intend to revisit in the future and I highly recommend trying out if you are in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table at Cañonita on the Grand Canal in the Venetian.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cañonita on the Grand Canal in the Venetian.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cañonita on the Grand Canal in the Venetian.

iOGucfoIktFhLaM2xrnPDQ.text: Best meal I've had so far on this trip! I highly recommend the salmon dish. The side of plantains is unbelievable. Our server couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating either. 5 stars all the way!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon, corn, and plantains in a homemade corn tortilla

WKYC4oHi_Cc8Iz2vwCR7bA.text: This is always one of our favorite spots for Mexican food in Las Vegas! We have been twice already this weekend! They have delicious food whether you are  dining or stopping in for guacamole and margaritas or sangria. The location overlooking the canals in The Venetian provides such a nice ambiance. Our server, Alex Robles, was excellent and made our time there so enjoyable!! We will definitely be back!

MS6frZAKnnVQ_ZENCqwxpQ.text: Loved this place! Chips and salsa were delicious. Ask for the hot green salsa and mix the two. I had the pork, mashed potatoes with chile colorado. It was amazing. Good coffee too.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zmy62jYEIVj94b0dzOn8Rg.text: We went here for lunch. It wasn't full. We were seated at a table right next to the water where the gondola rides are. The view is so pretty! I ordered the chorizo gorditas which were decent. My boyfriend ordered the Mexico city enchiladas & I really wish I had ordered that! They were yummy & his cilantro rice was very tasty. He also ordered a margarita which I had a few sips of & it was delicious! We had chips & salsa which cost around $3. The chips were nice & fresh & the salsa was so good! It's not spicy at all which I liked. Our waiter was really nice & the service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexico city enchiladas. Yum!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My chorizo gorditas

HmTtH7-c-DZHBfJ5DcHYxA.text: Nathan was awesome! Super attentive and made us laugh. Drinks stayed full, and all his recommendations were spot on! I ordered the mushroom enchiladas which were delicious, and my friend and the tres tacos that he really enjoyed, especially the cilantro rice.  For dessert, we ordered the coffee flan, and the lemon cheesecake both were yummy. But the star of the dining experience was forsure Nathan!

s0NnKpa4wpfedU7DJ6zLAA.text: Reserved a table for Friday night for 8 people. The house was pretty full but the noise level was not too bad. We had seating on the patio, but because we were on the far end near the shops I almost wish we had just taken a table inside because you couldn't see the water anyway. Just something to consider when you have a large guest- you will not be right by the water.   The food is not good enough to make me want to come back and I think more than a few people were a little disappointed in their dishes. I will say though that if you are looking for a spot that does Mexican dishes a little differently, with a creative twist, this might be your place.   I will mention that the hosts were very friendly but our main serve did not make me feel comfortable.

QVe-3eLvS0hEGq6aNyQShg.text: Awesome food, fresh homemade tortillas, great margaritas and great service!  Nathan is awesome.  Ask for his table.  Also ask for extra spicy green salsa!  Yummmm

9oPKackAU-ydk5x6t84JXw.text: One of my favorite stops while in town!! I've only spent time at the bar but the service is great, fellow patrons are fun and the vanilla & pineapple infused tequila is delicious. Alex and Danny didn't disappoint today. Alex shared some inside info that's sure to make my upcoming Birthday party a hit!

2qTWX5YwPZsvFa5Fe5dmNA.text: The food was good we had breakfast here. The server was nice but not consistent and the host was not friendly at all. We also had notified them that it was my daughter's birthday and if they offered anything special they said yes but never went through with it.

VauSxeSyDu8yqmDZb6CRlA.text: We go to Las Vegas often and always stay at the Venetian/Palazo and Canonita is a must for us. The food is amazing. We especially love the steak tacos and the steak fajitas. My kids do not like rice but crave the rice from this restaurant.  Last time we went, Laura was our server and she was amazing. She is excited to be working there, loves the food and just has a wonderful positive energy that can't help but make you smile. I highly suggest asking for her if she is working when you are there. She will make you feel like part of her family and her service will reflect that. She is a gem.  LOVE this restaurant! Oh, and the margaritas are fantastic!

FnLlmrhGZXd1d36QUlI74A.text: Had an amazing time the food was great. This is the second time I've been and both times I had a great time. The food is excellent and the service is amazing. My server Jerry great. He was always well aware if we needed anything and insightful of the dishes served. He recommended this oyster dish which was really something to come back for. I look forward to spending a great dinner with my family here again.

rwZPmiKfpzNOy3aPMZqlfg.text: The menu doesn't materialize to what you get served in real time -- real life, specially for a restaurant in Las Vegas where portions are extraordinarily great. You have so many choices competing for your business and this one doesn't stand a chance. Pretentious isn't even a word, La  Canonita is misleading and overpriced. Service is just there. Not average , not good. Flavor is ok and food almost cold when served. Not a fan other than of the atmosphere.

KMVDz-W6pedh6rwbgBREgw.text: Happy hour 3-6 pm and you get a $5 margarita!  Nice ambiance with a view of the canal. Friendly service and okay food. We ordered some empanadas and although they didn't pack a lot of flavor kids enjoyed them and presentation was nice.  I've been here before and its a nice place to stop in for some quick drinks and apps when at the Venetian Hotel and Casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red sangria
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry lemontini $5 happy hour

F6etU-CPnY0DYVtADxTXyA.text: We enjoy this place, so we keep coming back. I appreciate that everything is made fresh here - they make their own tortillas at a counter where you can see them at work.  The flautas are a tasty appetizer - be sure to spread the sauce on each bite!  One of my favorite dishes here is the quesadilla (see attached photo). We've also tried the Mexico City Enchiladas and a few other dishes, and always the sauce and the freshness of the ingredients made it tasty and delicious.  The margaritas are a little small, but that's okay if you're a light drinker.  And the location is relaxing, with the gondola boats floating by the railing.  This place gets super busy at peak times, so we try to go at off hours to get a seat without waiting too long.  The service is pretty good - most of the wait staff have been friendly, so we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty quesadillas.

o-LEW0YmXeVY3Si4xwJk3Q.text: I had the best dish ever here and the best service. Juan Carlos was amazing and thanks to his recommendation I fully enjoyed the short ribs. I will absolutely be coming back here.

3zm_TUAhIa3D8vxrBDdVjA.text: The food was good but I wouldn't say for the price it was great. Way over priced for what you get. Our waitress messed up our order and split the kids lunch (quesadilla) which I didn't ask for. Luckily she did because my son did not like it.  So that saved me money. The waitress was slow to get us refills on drinks. Save your money and go to a fancy restaurant, you'll pay the same price. I paid the same amount for lunch here as I did for a 5 Star meal at Chef Ramsay's Hell's Kitchen at Cesar's Palace. Which was unbelievable good! Best service there too! Again, good food, over priced, and slow service.

Y55-jKMkPJEoOCBSfLzpIw.text: Love everything about the restaurant! Amazing tasting food, hard working staff in the kitchen, & out on the floor as well! The manager Ricalynn was so friendly & accommodating to where we wanted to sit! Gave us an amazing spot, & throughout the night checked on numerous tables including us to see how we were doing & if we were enjoying our entrees. Loved the amazing consideration she showed to everyone in the restaurant & the help she provided for her entire team. Danielle served us & was very knowledgeable about the menu! Loved her amazing service on such a busy night, & loved all the recommendations she had for us! Overjoyed to come here & can't wait to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing view from dinner

ziFmGI5bsu-XBHUIcarezg.text: 2 stars for poor service. I came during happy hour on a Friday and it was not busy at all. After I was seated and had waited 10 mins or so and still no one had come over to my table, I asked a hostess to please send someone over. I ordered a drink, chips & salsa, plus guacamole to start ($14 btw). Everything tasted fine and very fresh, but the waiter only came over once during the hour or so that I was there. He did not stop by to see if I wanted to actually order dinner, so I got the check (which I of course had to flag him down and ask for, and then wait another 10 mins before I got it) and left after paying. Not a great experience overall.

dZtwjfnZv8t2_o_GCt6AIQ.text: 11/10/16 When we visited. At about 9pm. We walked right in to sit at the bar. Our drinks were perfect, Tequila sunrise and Margarita. Chips and salsa were awesome. Later on we got to try the strawberry Mojito. It was amazing, we almost stayed to have a couple of them but were on out way to Hakkasan.   The Bartenders were very pleasant, the best.  Thank you,  The Chileno.

tv_JnVqUsa1KDZpm-B33OA.text: I was there around 8:30 a.m. and ordered the huevos rancheros and coffee. I was seated overlooking the "canals" inside the Venetian shops. I liked that. It kind of felt like you were outside but not really. The restaurant is spacious. The service was great. The coffee was really good. The huevos rancheros were good (I especially liked the salsa on them and my "over easy" eggs were cooked perfectly) but I'm dinging them one star because they weren't hot enough. I would go back, though, for sure. It's also nice that I could get free WIFI while I ate.

uPANnzQNC4DL_Nb5m5TXeg.text: Carne asada was chewy, but the corn tortilla cheese foundation was quite tasty.  I opted to not go for the cheese on top of the steak, but the sauce was good as well.  I did enjoy the tea, which had a passion fruit flare to it.

yMJJTGMU9akLUliAvSkvyQ.text: I love their chunky, spicy salsa. The food is really good. Sit right next to the river where gondolas pass by. Great happy hour deals on house margaritas. The go to place for a Mexican craving on the Las Vegas Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp stew dish

YAH6SEgyiHoRWY58cPZeXg.text: The service here is horrible. The food wasn't good at all and it's very over priced!!

_cqdjS0F9voT9carXbqpgA.text: Juan Carlos was fantastic - he recommended the Barbacoa dinner which was absolutely amazing!  Flavors reminiscent of eating in Mexico City.  Ask for Juan and order this dinner!

2rA-CO0S9nLOKml9bewzqw.text: This place was a wonderful surprise. We did a google search for Mexican Food and Canonita came up so we gave it a try. Great food with fantastic service. It is probably the best Mexican cuisine I have ever had.

aOZi5tULBzCf7VQ_A7PHeA.text: Amazing restaurant option for casual dining on the Strip with a view of the Gondoliers passing by singing in Italian...located right on the Grand Canal in the Venetian. I loved their Pan Seared Mahi and the Warm Banana Brownie, yummm.

WQ7ApOiw4UQ35DrWwJxXJg.text: Easily my favorite meal out of the entire Las Vegas trip. The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is the service. It took nearly ten minutes to seat us when over half the restaurant was empty. Our server also made sure to put the 'wait' into waiter.  The food though... the food was freaking fantastic and so were the sangria de rojo and regular sangrias. Barbacoa, fajitas, burritos - all outstanding. The sangria de rojo is an awesome mix of a red sangria and a margarita. Heavenly! I like to sit near the canal and watch the gondolas.  You could say the place is pricey, but I had plenty of terrible meals for the same price as here. Nothing is cheap here.  Don't miss this place.

MEK8Y6ucKwUpn1BZXqcdnA.text: So just to be honest we didn't eat at the main restaurant but had the chicken singa tacos and guacamole and chips from the taco truck.  Amazing tacos and terrific guac.  The chicken was shredded and marinated in a wonderful tangy red sauce.  Would love to know what was in that tasty sauce. Highly recommend.   Very authentic.

BlUAP0OXY-MKO4St-CO4kQ.text: Very happy with the quality of the food and service!  I like their chips, salsa and guacamole! I even crave their guacamole from Where I Live (LA) so I always made a stop here while i'm in Vegas. I came in, dine in, twice in this restaurant and very happy with their food, coctails, margarita and service. Our other favorite dish is their first of the day catch fish. Always delicious, never dissapointed. Consistence and friendly people. Definitely will make this my regular place.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the &#39;out door&#39; indoor ambiance

6r9lhEoAkmSow-ITr-BFDQ.text: Great feel, great service, great food, great location, what more could you ask for?!  The margaritas were nothing special, certainly not worth the money we paid for them. The chips and guac are a must try along with the chicken fajitas.  So much flavor packed into each of the items!  The decor and feel of the place is like a True modern cantina.  Sit along the edge of the canal and watch as the gondolas circle through the end of the canal.  The server was very friendly, knowledgable of the menu, and prompt to get us whatever we needed.  Overall a great experience.  If you're looking for mexican food in this area of the strip it's worth a try!

xlo7E5XLLQ_67wgTrUiMlQ.text: Good casual mexican grub..... awesome queso fundito!! But as others have said... entrees were just ok. Not bad, but nothing that will bring me back again with all the other Vegas dining options. They do have a great "Patio" - next to the indoor grand canal. So that was fun.  Service was awesome... I even forgot my brand new sweater....they had it tucked away safe for me!

5UFNbh37Ho_bUUdCfcVg9A.text: Decent restaurant. Las Vegas expensive. I'm giving it 4 stars with demerits for the entrees.  The guacamole and queso fundido were excellent. Service was spot-on. Great drink list.  Why can't I find a restaurant in Las Vegas with amazing entrees?

jlI1bBsIhT0JU6xBBBtSOA.text: A Mexican restaurant not for Mexicans. This place looks like it might be good - handmade chips and tortillas, a Mexico City menu, etc. - but the flavors are not right. The tacos are neither street nor gourmet: on a par with Chipotle. The sauce on the chile relleno had way too much tomato and not nearly enough spice and tasted more Italian than Mexican. Also, the batter was the thickest, breadiest - not light, airy, or fluffy - that I've ever had.   On the plus side, the chips were freshly made and warm, the cilantro rice was tasty, and the shrimp cocktail was decent.

Jd8TwGB_mVh7yp4z6bZ-Ng.text: Superb service, delicious food choices and strong drinks!! Our waiter was a super sweet lady who came around often to ask how we were doing and offered suggestions. I had a chicken meal while my husband tried some steak. We both left full and a bit tipsy ;-). The prices were actually less than at other hotel restaurants. I particularly loved that we had a table overlooking the gondola river ride so we were able to hear the romantic Italian songs being sung. Try the coconut drink in an actual coconut! So worth it!

q2yxtWM9NJFKNmzHULb8lw.text: very pleasant my visit here our server was very attentive and on top out table due that we where a pretty big party and they where a bit busy and the food is amazing delicious the barbacoa how it compliments with the cilandro rice just prefect great recommendations from our server  . most definitely with be coming back here with friends and fam...

NU-T8axa3TlAnrRLghDODQ.text: Beautiful spot, will definitely return. Excel any service, delicious food. Chips and salsa delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres tacos. Great chips and salsa, loved the salsa!!!!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything made fresh each day! Hand rolled shells.

8t9ZbrX9v86lgcbmXB4NBQ.text: Our server was great. The food wasn't so great. Went for breakfast and ordered Heuvos Ranchero. Wasn't very flavorful and I've actually had better at a non-mexican restaurant.

wZIOeW_PK4RauBbQjqPE8w.text: Huevos rancheros. Dry tortilla, eggs done wrong. Espresso: week coffee in a little cup. Avoid!

wTwpk01Y0HY87rZDDyCb7Q.text: The service could have been better. It was a very slow day that we visited and the wait service was even slower. It look 20 minutes to make a margarita. Seemed like an eternity before a waiter came to take our drink order of water. The ambiance was dim lit in the center of the restaurant. The patio area is very romantic because it allows you to watch people being strolled down the river in a gondola. Overall I was not impressed by the customer service it lacked luster. On the bright side the food was more than delicious it was magnificent.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed fajitas

yL9eLDARXDjNjBBQebS5eg.text: Lovely place, good service.  One of the best breakfast burritos I've every had.  Sitting on a patio, next to the canal, under the painted sky, is quite idyllic.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My awesome burrito!

azcIbQP4-NBkDrC2moqKvQ.text: Great spot along the canal; right at the end where the boats make their u-turn so you've got a steady stream of people watching during your meal.  Restaurant is very laid back and open air.  Guacamole was good; chips were warm which is a nice touch. Salsa was decent.  Margaritas were strong but not overpowering; the Raspberry Fresca was delicous.  Skirt steal with the fajitas was tender and moist. The mariscos plate was good, nice spice.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and guacamole
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajitas
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mariscos

FWFgLuEJDohuzwR-vZ2_wg.text: Bottomless mimosas bar was great! I had the breakfast burrito which was delicious. Great service!

zV7EDj-0VS_WB_0rM01wmg.text: My boyfriend and I were staying at the Palazzo for a quick trip and needed to grab lunch before our flight back home. Very conveniently, we walked from the hotel lobby into the canal shopping center and found this restaurant. I ordered the chicken enchiladas which could have very easily lasted me two meals, and my boyfriend ordered the 5 taco plate. The food was okay, wasn't a disappointment but wouldn't make a special trip to come here. Prices are a little up there but so is everything else on the strip. We did however have a great view of the canal and were able to people watch as the gondolas came by

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken enchiladas, chips &amp; salsa, and 5 taco plate

JbJLDyGoqjlheEIRqqp9pg.text: Beautiful ambience by the canals of Venetian. Good food. Great service by Armani. Complimentary churros for our bride to be.  Thank you Brian for our coffee refill and our photo!

fcYAtlICtIvJ3YnCCRQ8Lw.text: My mom and I split the wild mushroom enchiladas and it was amazing! So delicious! I also had a prickly pear agua fresca and it was really good. So good in fact I ordered a second one to go so I could sip on it in the afternoon since we headed to the pool deck after lunch. I highly recommend it!

qGJtz_bBL1t2tumSfMrrMQ.text: Best Margaritas Ever!  Loved their watermelon margaritas. Loved the food as well. Didn't think there were many veggie options. But we managed. Cheese quesedilla is something I seldom order, but it turned out to be pretty good. Servers were very courteous and nice and the location along the canal is perfect. Had a wonderful lunch with my friends here.

fLZgJStf1A952XjquULdIA.text: Beautiful location for great views of the gondola rides on the canal! Located inside the Venetian we decided to give this place a try. As we walked in the hostess was very friendly! our waitress was very friendly i wish i would of got her name she was great! We ordered the combination 5 tacos one with mushrooms, chicken ,pork, beef, and fish and chips and salsa!  will definitely be back again

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NuEc_afJDBqtJCsyUBMJNw.text: Looking for a place for breakfast and stumbled upon Canonita. Was seated right next to the grand canal and was able to see the gondolas get ready for the day (it was early in the morning!). The portions are decent and the food was pretty tasty. There's quite a few options here for breakfast which was nice. They also had a mimosa bar option as well. So all in all, it was a pretty decent experience for breakfast. I'd probably come back to try their lunch and dinner options since I've read that others have had really good experiences!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classico breakfast

CKhedMJrwoAPUxoMOoinQA.text: Absolutely disgusting meal, service, drinks. Just stay away! Slowest service ever, asked to move to the empty table behind us and they asked if we still wanted to move AFTER we got our food! The food was gross. The meat (pork and beef) was over cooked and SO fatty! The rice was a green color and tasteless, which was so disappointing. Last, they somehow burnt the tortillas so everything tasted charred. A point for them taking the burnt meal off the bill, but that's still not enough to justify everything else. The drinks arrived after our main course and were way way too sugary. Just an overall bad experience! Skip!

Dw_oycie_W4TN9TiE58CvQ.text: Great atmosphere of course in the Grand Canal Shoppes...   Pablo was our server.  He was awesome.  I started with the Jalepeno Margarita.  Note, very spicy hot and not for everyone (more than typical) but I personally liked it and had another.  The classic Margarita (special for $5) was also reported to be pretty good.  We started with the Guacamole.. pretty standard fare, no complaints.    I had my standard favorite which was the Pollo Mole Poblano, which was an excellent choice. They had a Quinoa side listed for another dish, so I substituted that for the rice and I wasn't disappointed!  This really made my dish unique and awesome.  (Not something you would find anywhere else.)  Definitely would return and I'm typically hard on Mexican places as they are usually not my "goto" in terms of types of food I crave.

9i-d-cdruBXwdKQ4VqF4xA.text: This place is located right in the heart of all the shopping and restaurants at the Venetian and Palazzo. We wandered into here on a busy Thursday night. They were able to get us a table fairly quickly. Our server was attentive and friendly through out the experience.  We started with the Queso Fundido. We opted to add the housemade chorizo and house pickled jalapenos. It was good. The chorizo and jalapenos were nice additions. The cheese was good on its own but those additions gave it even more flavor and texture. One of these is a good starter for up to four people.  For my meal I chose the Pork A La Michocana. It is a roasted tenderloin with manchamantel sauce and cranberry-tomatillo chutney. It comes with roasted vegetables and potatoes gratin. The pork was ok. It was a touch dry but the flavor was good. The potatoes were the best part for me. I truly enjoyed them. You get a large portion of them too.  This is a solid place. It falls somewhere between three and four stars for me. The service was good. The food was mostly good.

2bcsGNtOhw68xJ5CVgCvQQ.text: This is our first visit. Starting from the host all the way to the food everything was amazing.  All the staff were friendly and not just with us, but also with each other. Our server Carlos was amazing. Very friendly, enthusiastic and patient with us and our baby. Highly recommend this place to anyone that is visiting.

epp7esgQ8Pfb9ccV91OqCA.text: "Dined at Canonita for dinner this weekend, the jalapeno margarita was amazing... great recommendation from our server Anthony. Definitely a must try if you're in Vegas!

_It_QThyWwO3LEi7n6Fj8w.text: Had breakfast the first time stayed at Venetian. Very convenient in the Canal Shops. Had the BLT on brioche with house potatoes. My husband had the chilaquiles and the kids splitter the breakfast burrito.  4- presentation  3- taste (a little too salty on black beans) 4- atmosphere  4- service  Will have to come back for the tacos!

81P-X2SsiFHigU0pyxux8A.text: Located inside the gorgeous Venetian/Palazzo shopping area makes this place such a wonderful environment for a great meal! Came here on a Sunday prior to going home that afternoon for brunch around 11 and got seated right away with no reservations. The staff was friendly and accommodated all our diet restrictions and gave great suggestions. The huevo rancheros came with a side of beans and potatoes and it was wonderful! They also have a all you can drink mimosa bar for around 14 dollars which is a steal for Vegas! I would definitely return here in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros - so good!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white omelette!

kvD8PMTiOS4UAAo24M1l4Q.text: We really wanted to try something other than Italian tonight so wandered over to Canonita along the canal. Really liked sitting "outside" next to the canal to watch and listen to the gondolas passing by. So relaxing and enjoyable. Nice selection of classic and more modern dishes. Shared the Vaquero beer-braised short ribs and they were so tender with wonderful flavors. Also had the flour tacos - chicken, beef and fish - all so good. And to have some greens, enjoyed the chicken tortilla salad - very fresh and crunchy. We couldn't pass up the highly recommended tres leches and chocolate brownies accompanied by some coffee and Baileys. Very much enjoyed each course. Staff and service were wonderful and attentive. Will be back again when in the canal shops. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tortilla salad, tacos and Vaquero beer-braised short ribs
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches and chocolate brownie sundae

pEX4TFuRNxmZbcdIYRcarA.text: This restaurant is a great spot to grab some food for a casual dining experience. It's located inside the Venetian and is situated right alongside their indoor canal. Food is great! Service is excellent! Drinks are delightful! They describe themselves as Mexico City Soul Food and I think they nailed it with that. The food was so delicious - traditional Mexican food with an upgraded twist. Not your average Mexican restaurant that's for sure! I had the Barbacoa which had some really good, flavorful spices and coupled it with their "Independent" cocktail off their happy hour menu (which also had some great beverage choices for the adults!) Would definitely recommend and go again! Lastly - If you are deciding between the short rib plate and the barbacoa, I highly recommend the barbacoa because of the sides it comes with. Short rib plate is a little more hearty and heavy because of the hominy which tastes similar to creamy mashed potatoes and the tortilla chips crumbled on top. The Barbacoa plate is paired excellently with cilantro rice (SO SO GOOD) and black beans with a side of tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso fundido with chorizo and tortillas
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbacoa plate!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno plate

R_Sqy8CiOwMlhWmNcypGnA.text: Canonita was great all around. Our server, Nathan L was fabulous and made sure to take care of our every need. Kathy made sure to check in on us too. The setting along the canal along with the restaurant's atmosphere were very enjoyable. My favorite dish was the Oven Roasted Mussels and Shrimp. Also, some of the best Margaritas out there!

QGDybAVPwwz6ho1qGznwdQ.text: the food it's good, the tacos need a bit more flavor and sauces. no free chips while you wait for food. that's a classic Mexican tradition.

lJOcdq5MgMQPQim63GjjLw.text: Pros: great service, good authentic Mexican food, and located next to gondola rides, awesome mole, and great lunch prices...  Cons:  few items on menu and food not spicy enough (at least for my taste buds)...  Overall, highly recommended Mexican cuisine on the strip...

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

26dn9JroLnsn5zQOSyRk_Q.text: Great food.  We had fajitas which were great.   Appetizers included queso with tortillas.   Loved sitting in the patio with the boats goi g through the Riviera.    Would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great atmosphere on the Riviera.   Food was good, but not great service.  Once they delivered the entrees, we did not see our server

EnunoDkdTrem6t0mKHgAuw.text: I find it odd that a really good Mexican restaurant is located in the Venitian of all places. But hey, no complaints because it worth it! Settled along the indoor river, Canonita is a large establishment that features great food at reasonable prices, or at least, as reasonable as you would find on the strip. The taste is amazing to their credit and the service is professional and efficient. I have come in big parties and small, they have always been able to accommodate me fairly quickly. The drinks are pretty strong here as well. There isn't anything I didn't like here, except maybe the prices but that is the Vegas strip in general. Overall, if you want some good Mexican food, I recommend coming to Cananita.

vFAaqtZs7ppgO1-tjYyI4Q.text: Amazing amazing food try the shrimp fajitas the best I ever had chips and salsa one of the best i ever had great canal tables and. seating outstanding service you will be glad you visited as we stayed in VENETIAN this was no brainer we will visit again also we received a great service from Azalea

FoY6NNCzGZ48HJluqawzdg.text: I was disappointed after reading all the great reviews. Maybe it was an off-day, maybe because I'm used to really good, authentic Mexican food being from So. Cal and living in Phoenix, but the food was sub-par and over cooked. My friend got the chicken enchiladas and I got the chicken fajitas. Both tasted dry, chewy and not very flavorful. Afterwards, we both got really horrible (read: painful) gas bubbles, which isn't normal after I eat Mexican. So, for the price, I expected much better food that doesn't cause discomfort. Plus: great agua frescas.

Xz9BMmxJLUSyqyYQA2aC8Q.text: The view awesome, drinks awesome food awesome and the service amazing!!!!Honestly we did not expect for the food to be good, you must try their guacamole! Wow!

CKbdJrswpPP8zNKU0UHxVQ.text: Burritos next to a fake canal under the fake blue painted sky? Yes, please! Canonita serves up some tasty mexican food with a nice setting too. The beer selection may be a bit underwhelming here, but the margaritas are off the hook. Service is friendly and warm from the bar and wait staff. The food is excellent and huge. The burrito was nice and spicy with a burn that could only be put out with the margarita. If you want to eat on the canals of fake Venice, but don't want Italian food, it's the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2hpzXv2iox0dblZGzLqGXg.text: Full Disclosure: When I visited Canonita I had already eaten, so I only sampled the salsa and drinks. However, I had a great time here!  Located in the Venetian right off the water, the ambiance is great and you are right in the middle of excellent shopping and yet are eating Mexican food while in "Venice." However, while some people found the singing Gondoliers charming, they were a bit obnoxious for us. Different strokes I guess. I sampled the drink in the coconut (don't remember the name), and a habanero margarita. My drinks were delicious and the coconut drink was awesome as well. We also had a great server and I enjoyed hanging out here on a Sunday morning while the boys were enjoying the football game.  Overall, I had a good time here and would come back when I'm back at the Venetian!

VwdTPkdxikqDdv_P9ghXqQ.text: This place was pretty good. Overpriced a little but it's right in Venetian which was convenient for us. If you like the gondolas then u can get s great view of them in the canal. Personnal I wasn't a huge fan because I felt a little claustrophobic under that fake sky.   Food was pretty good. Both had fajitas. Very average as far as Mexican goes.

Zcl7Bg_e7l5BiVbP-8qxwA.text: Went with a group of 4, we all decided the chips and salsa were some of the best we've ever had. The carne asada was buttery and tender.  The chicken and steak tacos were so flavorful.  We all absolutely loved the cilantro rice,  so good! Service was a tad slow,  but the food was so good and the ambiance was nice so it wasn't that distracting.

i-m5_PnIW2E0Aq5iXIiCKQ.text: Pretty good breakfast place Mexican style I had the omelette it was cooked perfectly fluffy and moist not overcooked and dry but like everything in Vegas places pretty expensive Services ok I think it's better than Lux

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YhN4EfS_E9_UkXkEcsftXg.text: The shredded chicken here tastes horrible and gave me a bad case of nausea.  They use the same chicken in all the chicken entrees and the taste is just off.  There's a reason this restaurant is always available on open table, considering it is in a prime location with views of the gondolas but the food is just that bad.  Avoid and eat somewhere else if possible.

H8Rb3A-N4qbgXHpAcXjI_g.text: We are visitors of Vegas and was told that Javier's is a Tex Mex place located at the Aria hotel to try.  Given it was NY eve, we didn't want to venture out from where we were staying (Mirage).  I yelped for a few other Mex places and came across Canonita and decided to give this place a shot. I am glad we did. We were a party of 5 and got seated immediately.  Jonathan, our waiter, was engaging and gave us great tips on what to order.  We were given ample amount of chips and salsa dips to start.  The chips were freshly made and hot.  I got a five taco entree which you can mix and match the protein (chicken, beef, fish, etc). No additional if you get fish.  It was nice to see they also offer corn tortilla as my wife has gluten allergy.  She got the scallops appy which was also fresh.  For drinks, we got the frozen margarita mango flavor.  Wow that was one tall pitcher for $41.  All in all, great great place and highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango margarita
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop appetizer
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 tacos sampler

mytn9WXqxTRmLPcSmtow1Q.text: The egg white veggie omelette was stuffed with a variety of veggies. Very flavorful. The potatoes had a touch of red paprika like stuff. Not too spicy. Just right. Only one kind of toast. But the bread was awesome. Good service tpo

fyyzd71vsrfzyLb3UxGXhw.text: Came here for an early Mother's Day celebration. We sat next to the rail with a view of the gondolas. View was very nice. I think for the strip and the Venetian it's gotta be on the less costly restaurants.   The menu is small. But we ordered the Santa Rosa plate and the "Chicken mole". They were well portioned. And certainly a meal type. It's not going to over stuff you. My plate that included the chicken mole. Was very tasty.   As appetizers we also went for the Pork Empanadas. Which by the way were very sweet tasting. I am more into sweetness then spicy foods. They were rather small. But I'd definitely go back for those.   Then for desert we finished with a tres leches . Sharing it. It definitely was "tres leches" it wasn't at all dry. Had sufficient fruit on it as well.   To drink we had two Horchatas and one Watermelon. I think something like the Horchata was spiked because I felt rather dizzy throughout.   The service was very nice our waitress was very attentive and quick. The restaurant was actually very empty maybe that's why the service wasn't late.   The bill was $85 and I would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gondolas
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-YY7nDmsJ-ZB_7DMTslLbg.text: I didn't know what to expect from this place but HOLY MOLY their food is bomb. Salsa was fire, chips were light, crunchy and perfectly salted, entrees were superb, and dessert was the icing to the cake. Oh yeah, the cocktail was quite effective. A little more pricey than I would have thought, but well worth every penny. Service was also amazeballs. Ask to sit in Brian's section!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FYBPY_NjB0x0ONYu9F1zNg.text: good view, the presentation of the food is great, but it didn't taste as good as it looked, i ordered a quesadilla because there wasn't many options as a classic Mexican restaurant. But i don't recommend ordering the quesadilla, it's a pretty simple dish, but they found a way to mess it up, the cheese was a bit odd, and the frijoles and arroz was very bland, no flavor what so ever. The pico de gallo had some flavor, also you have to pay for your chips and salsa here, but at a traditional Mexican restaurant it's not common where you pay for the chips and salsa.

P2L-2TriEsrYeJOOTMSM9A.text: I got the breakfast tacos, the "Chef's Special" of the day. Fantastic. Soft corn tortillas with eggs, meat, onion, guacamole and pico. It came with a side of cheesy breakfast potatoes. Very filling! I would definitely come here again.   It is a little noisy but so are all the restaurants here. Many of the tables sit right on the water so you can listen to the gondolier singers as they bring their customers up and down the little indoor river. I would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast tacos (Chef&#39;s special of the day) with a side of cheesy potatoes.

GZF0R9hn1Rdt5veMM0PAmw.text: Review for taco truck.   Got pork and beef tacos. Both good. Beef better than pork. Could have been higher temp. I also god chipotle and felt chipotle was on par with these.

SOzp3wBKkxrvcetbDmeIbA.text: This is a fun place with a feel of outdoor seating under the artificial sky with canal side seating with views of the Venetian's indoor gondola rides.   The food was very good. I went with the taco sampler which came with 5 versions of their corn tortilla tacos which were all very tasty. The mushroom taco was something I'd definitely pursue further as it was much tastier than I'd expected.   My wife ordered the beef rib which was a HUGE and meaty portion.

s4ot-TtgIxrjUoPoHGHWzA.text: A group of 8 of us ducked into this place after a) not feeling the overpriced food court and b) not feeling ballerific enough to eat some place fancy. If you read my other reviews, you know I'm especially hard on any Mexican food, especially ones located under a fake blue sky and a much cleaner version of Venice's grand canal.   Boy, was I surprised. I started off with a few bites of the ceviche and ordinary chips and salsa, which were both surprisingly tasty. I ordered the three pork tacos with corn tortillas and they were done very well. Their flavors weren't too strong, which I liked.   Can I just write that it tasted, well, good?  Oh, and the horchata...magnificent! Perfectly balanced between sweetness and thickness. One of the best cups I've had.  For the price, atmosphere, location, and food, this place strikes a good balance for those on a budget but don't want to wander onto the strip looking for the McD's/Denny's/Chipotle around the corner.

GHDI3QOEUcmGG48e3DPNzQ.text: Very clean flavors.  The tuna was seared to perfection.  It was subtly seasoned and had really great flavors.  What I didn't like was the slaw.  It was mediocre at best.  The shortribs with chipotle mash was yummy!!!  Thought it was something I can make at home myself, the tuna, on the otherhand, I couldn't.    This was a great option when you want something casually nice but don't want to walk too far (if you're in the Central Strip).

Ty0onSElCNrKhvg6t3HdOA.text: I would give this place 5 stars, except it took us forever to find the location, when we arrived, we had to approach the chatty group of hostess girls, and they still took time to sit us after we said we had reservations.  So the rating is for the food and our specific server.  Started off with signature margaritas, and mussels. Both were great, my boyfriend doesn't eat mussels but was exceptionally wowed by the broth that they sit in (weird, I know).  I had the platter of tacos, which was excellent. My boyfriend has enchiladas which he said were seasoned great.  The setting is right off the end of the Venetian canal.  The location is central to that of Ceasers palace and the Wynn

Zw0CfNsgmVlTMEIIU-VbSg.text: Great place with good ambience.  Had the Chile Relleno.  Probably more authentic that I expected, had more soft cheese and had dried fruit inside the chile.  Tasted great but was expecting maybe the more of just the cheese inside.  Still, the flavor was very unique and good.  Their margaritas are awesome, good variety.  Guacamole is perfect, as is the Queso Fundido. Good sangria also.

ojNwD36GvxwaiChyP-SuBA.text: STAY AWAY FROM THE CEVICHE. Play it safe at this place. chicken, pork steak. the Ceviche tastes like fish dick. the drinks are good too and they have a good selection of tequila, just don't expect much from the food. think El Torito.

NWz6Bt-MMPvt2er4l15K-w.text: Mexican food at an Italian themed hotel. That should have been the red flag :)  Definitely not my favorite of my time in Vegas, but a decent meal. Not quite sure I'd give it only 2 stars, but it's not truly a 3, though their Cilantro Rice made me feeling generous.   We started our meal with the following apps: Chips, Salsa and Guacamole. Salsa was good- fresh, hint of spice, tomato based salsa. The Guacamole...ok. I'm not too keen of tomatoes in my guac. I prefer it to be simple- garlic, lime, cilantro & onion, it was just ok. Queso Fundido w/ Chorizo- My fave of the apps- Slightly spiced, ooey, gooey cheesy dip mixed with crumbled chorizo sausage and served with warm tortillas. Yum! Pork Empanadas- Crisp pockets of shredded seasoned pork  For my main dish I chose the Tres Tacos with the Grilled Chicken, Grilled Fish and Crispy Pork Belly. The chicken was pretty basic- grilled citrus flavored chicken amply piled into the soft taco shell. The Grilled Fish- my least favorite- had an odd overly fishy taste. I didn't get sick from it, so I don't think it was bad, but it was poorly flavored. I'm not sure what they put on it, but perhaps they should just stick to some S&P and grill, leave it simple. The Crispy Pork Belly- well...it wasn't very crispy. I was definitely expecting something different. Something closer to a bacon texture? The Pork, with a nice smoky flavor, was tender but didn't have that crisp sear I was hoping for especially given the description, but still tasty.  The highlight of this dish? The Cilantro Rice! WOW! I loved this stuff! What a great fresh, light taste! It had the familiar light and fluffy texture of mexican rice, but was tinged green from the cilantro and had this great herbaceous, savory cilantro flavor! Had I known about this rice, I would have nixed the beans for sure! This rice along earned it the additional 3rd star :)   The service was friendly and the food came out timely though we did have to flag down our server to get refills.   With a plethora of options in Vegas, I'll definitely pass on this one on my future visits, overall a 2.5 star review, but that rice! So delish, for me earned that extra 1/2 star.

Fe_jC4ICrpH1MJlP1p4quQ.text: GREAT MEXICAN DOESN'T HAVE TO BE DIVEY  Canonita's food is right up there with the best Mexican I've had in LA, San Diego, and even Mexico City.  Since it opened, I have not gone to Vegas without eating there.  Everything is delicious without exception - right down to the salsa and chips that are hard not to fill up on.  Even the rice, which comes as a side with just about everything, is not to be missed.  The star of the meal, however, is always their salsa verde - hands down the best salsa verde I've ever had.  Ask for a side of it (they will charge you $1 or so but it's worth it) and pour it onto whatever you end up eating.  Don't expect a taqueria in the conventional sense because Canonita has little in common with the holes-in-the-wall where you often find the best Mexican food.  Which is not to say Canonita isn't authentic - it's just a gentrified (and thereby both healthier and more elaborate) version of the same cuisine.

qZQz160RiGxq2-iXFuvo-A.text: We actually ate here twice during our short stay in Vegas.  The second night were we going to eat elsewhere, but the crowd looked big so we moved along.  We decided to eat here again after hearing that the wait would be 30 minutes.  (It was after 9:30PM on Friday night so we figured that would the norm at other places.)  We had our table in less than 5 minutes.   The food was amazing.  Quick and good service.  Great sangria --- a bottle provide 6 full glasses.   I had the shrimp enchiladas both times.       Will definitely go back the next time I am in Vegas.    Oh, I forgot, they have cilantro rice -- very good.

YSs10nMAi6O-TqMtD9yW8A.text: The food here is surprisingly decent although pricey (of course).  I seem to always be able to score a nice table right next to the canal and it's cheesy but I like it.  The margaritas are good (and pricey) and the service is friendly and efficient.  The last time I was here, I had a coupon for 15% off the entire bill and I definitely appreciated that.  I ordered three fish tacos and they came with rice and beans and extra tortillas.  The tacos were very good and the rice was cilantro rice and tasty (don't be put off by the green tint).  The beans were good, too.  We also had chips and guacamole which was very big and quite good.  I was definitely full when I left here.  When staying at the Venetian, this is a convenient and good option that is less expensive than some of the other options at the Venetian.  I think it makes a very nice lunch or casual dinner destination.

ivsd71GRbfYDU11MXnSVjQ.text: Inside the Venetian is actually a decent Mexican place. Who woulda thought? The menu is kind of an upscale, semi-authentic Mexican. Not your typical taqueria nor Mexican food you typically find in the US, but not perfectly authentic since this is Vegas. The recommended things are the tacos as an appetizer and the smoked/steamed carnitas in a banana leaf. The guacamole was ok, if not a little bland. Their salsa is ok, lacking a little on spiciness for my taste though.   The service was friendly and efficient. The place does get loud since your on the canal and you have multitudes of people walking by. There's also a bar with decent drinks. Their margarita mix is way too sweet though.

gEvsVaKMcgkyONjIxArLJQ.text: We came here for my birthday and both the food and atmosphere were excellent. I was actually in the mood for the type of Mexican restaurant like the one in the movie Dodgeball. You know, the Dirty Sanchez. And no, there's no need for you to make any jokes right here! Anyway Canonita is definitely on the other end of the spectrum; it's the type that doesn't serve margaritas by the pitcher. Still tasty in served in a glass though. I had the carne asada, which was delicious. Did I have a lobster tail with it? ...I'm sure it was delicious if I did.  I loved the setting! We sat in the "outdoor" area of the restaurant. The Venetian was nice enough to turn down the lights to create a "dusk" effect since it was dinner time. If only I could've seen the sun set behind the Kenneth Cole store across the walkway!

nooDIVTAZxtOSNgKMP8tFA.text: Canonita remains one of the better values on the strip.  We started with the pork empanadas. Then we had 2 salads, the Spinach n Manchego and the Mexican Chopped. Then we shared the Pork Loin Entree that comes atop a mixed mexican style vegetables with a spicy corn bread muffin served in baby iron cast skillet.  In short, food was great esp for vegas pricing and portions are super solid.  Problem here is service is so so at best, crappy at worst.  Servers here make less than their counter parts at other Venetian eateries and seem to punish you for it. Go for the food and prices, if ur server is crap from get go, ask for another server.

AuRRFBk-g4oYSQLG3b_mIQ.text: I don't know how this nice, but not too expensive restaurant right on the canal in The Venetian got so overlooked, but the three of us were seated right away on Valentine's Day.  We weren't in the "patio" (along the canal), but were beneath a graceful arch and close enough to see the gondolas drifting by - actually they were maneuvering quite a bit because it's near the embarkation point.  In fact, the only thing separating us was a small group celebrating a wedding - I thought it a very suitable venue for a Vegas reception....more of a choice to forego the big church wedding and Italian honeymoon instead of a we-can't-afford-it substitute.  Well, that's the vibe I got since they had obviously put in a lot of attention to detail with the nicest spot, table set up, cake table, etc.  Well, it lent some romance to our dinner since we weren't a menage a trois, but there with our teenage son.  The menu was very tempting - there were a few things we couldn't decide between.  Looking over at the next table, I recommended that my son order a dish full of shell fish, chicken skewers, and delicious looking bread; it turned out not to be quite enough for him.  The ceviche appetizer was sufficient as an entree for me though - the tuna was good, the shrimp and olive too salty, and the third not memorable.  Oh, another diner came over and asked me what I thought of it, so the dishes match the menu description very accurately!  My husband had the succulent pork, and we shared a carafe of strong (I felt) sangria.  It would have been nice if chips and salsa were included instead of being offered separately on the menu (duh, restaurateurs, I probably could have handled more sangria then).  I'm recommending it for kids also because watching the boats is pretty entertaining, it's noisy anyway, and I imagine the railings are close enough that they can't slip through.  I think this place was mentioned in one of the in-room magazines, but in this case, it wasn't all hype.  Besides the tastiness, the setting and presentation make it truly special.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant in background

WBnZQQ7-pvXjecfSisq7gg.text: I went here just the other evening and was pleasantly surprised.  Our waiter was quite the character, clearly excited that he is a real Mexican working at a Mexican restaurant.  He said that everything on the menu was to die for, except the chicken enchiladas.  This made my choice very easy as I was trying to decide between the mushroom and chicken enchiladas.  They were A-MAZING.  I ate up every bite until my stomach hurt (not such great self-control this evening).    On another note, there are two different kinds of rice that could possibly come with your order- mine came with a plain white rice with some veggies and some of the entrees came with a cilantro rice.  i was a bit jealous that mine didn't have cilantro rice. So, if you might care about such a thing, you may want to specify which kind of rice you want.   I'm only not giving it 5 stars because of the service/timing of the food delivery.  We sat down and waited a good ten minutes before our waiter came over for our drink order.  When he came, he was wonderful and talkative.  We waited another good 5-8 minutes before we got our drinks, and salsa and chips.  We ordered our entrees at this time and they were in front of us in the next five minutes.  It kind of threw the dinner off a bit, and was a bit irritating.  I'd definitely check it out again, in hopes that the service would be more consistent and they could earn that last star back!

nWz1NYaIEQS1mwOsIZUKBg.text: food was good & nice atmosphere next to the indoor canal. Service was slow, but we were not i a hurry. I had empenadas (which were good) for appetizer & chopped mexican salad, which was good sized, but not much more than romaine with aome slices of grilled chicken. very little roasted vegetables as the menu described. My companion specifically asked about cilantro on her salmon because she cannot stand the taste of it, & waitress thought there might be some in the pesto sauce (which made no sense to me, but perhaps they prepared their pesto differently, so we went with the flow). When the dish came, it did not have any pesto on it, but DID has cilantro sprinkled on it. Guess waitress put the order in to hold the pesto, but didn't know how the dish was prepared, or the kitchen messes up.

H5XtnHnwbOeEhhbwy3I-fw.text: I had to revisit this restaurant again with three people who had never eaten there....and was NOT disappointed!  We had a great time - I ordered the same dish which was still amazing!   This time around we had a couple of bottles of Sangria which we fell in love with.   This is my favorite casual restaurant in all of Vegas to date!

qMt4CptmDNW6fIxev9jcBw.text: Surprise! Surprise!  I am meeting some friends for a reunion dinner. The Italian restaurant we were going to had an hour wait, so the group settled for Taqueria Canonita. It was Friday, the place is pretty pack but I am still second guessing the quality of food since this restaurant is located inside the mall.  I ordered...  Mojito $9 - Sugar rim and very sugary with very little herbs NASTY! I had to returned it and replace it with a soft drink  Pork Tender $20 - Very good... the pork is moist and tender... the dressing is fruity with just the right amount of saltiness  Atmosphere - Fun Service - Average... we have to wave down our waiter for every needs (i.e water refill) and requests, etc. Price - Fair for Vegas  Note:  18% Gratuity added to party of six or more

ci0A3_DTpX1-I9KPHsY8Gg.text: A bit of a disappointment.  After Phantom of the Opera, we decided to stop and have a drink. We decided to go to Taqueria Canonita because we can sit next to the canals and watch the gondaliers. We have also eaten here in the past and the food was very good.  The hostess was very friendly and promptly seated us next to the canal. We waited for quite awhile before the waiter came over to bring water, it went south from here. He took the drink order and we never saw him again. The manager delivered our drinks, brought the water we had originally requested and that was the extent of our service.  This was very disappointing as the restaurant was by no means full. The waiter never checked back in nor did the manager. He dropped the check on the table without even stopping and was observed chit chatting over off to the side while tables were being ignored. We left cash to cover the drinks, no tip.  Although the food is good, and the ambiance of being next to the canal is nice, the service of an eatery speaks volumes to me. I doubt I will ever go back. If I treated my clients with that same type of service I would be out of business. Maybe they ought to think of that, my bill pays your wages, without a client you won't have a job. Enough preaching. Just disappointed in the lack of service I am seeing in some of my past favorites in Las Vegas.

JXJldwInIkGfYxfwmRsDxA.text: Good guac at this place... spicy salsas too. Taqueria Canonita is one of my favorite mexican spots in vegas. I love the location- inside the venetian shops and open air to the gondolas. You can sit right at the edge and see the gondolas go by and sing. All of the food that I've had here was good quality, good size portions (I'm usually STUFFED when I leave here), and tasty margs.  Definitely will come back again and again when I am in vegas.

wCEhwihFTM10M6wqVM47YQ.text: First, was our waiter Joey.  He was amazing.  I have never had a waiter go as out of their way to make a meal a fantastic experience.  He offered great guidance on choices and was just all around amazing.  A special thanks to him for a great time.    The setting is very pleasant on the canal shops in the Venetian.  The table salsa was smoky and delicious.  Joey suggested a particular Tequila flight was was fun to experience the differences between the Tequilas.  All of the food was great.  For me this was 4 1/2 stars but Joey made it a 5 1/2.  A great stop if you are ever looking for a casual spot in Vegas.

lTO-fe9X8lyw8G7yPh_O3A.text: Fabulous dinner.  Mexican chopped salad was wonderful.  Portobella Enchiladas outstanding!  Coffee flan out of this world!! Missed 5 stars due to rice and beans.  Skip them!  Good service and atmosphere- a bit loud but that's to be expected here.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jJ44othSVM35ywBfpIqb3A.text: Very impressed with the flavors.. i was spectacle to find a food Mexican restaurant in a hotel but this food was amazing. The portions are a good size. You need to do the chips and guacamole its finger licking. They took a while to bring our food out but it was worth it.

BZs_ojPvv3AtQ5YHTtzZ3Q.text: This review is for Happy Hour.. Went on 3/28/16--Monday.   We were greeted at the bar by the bartender Mario. He immediately told us he would take care of us. We ordered chips & salsa, several drinks ( 8) and throughout the entire time we got excellent service. Many people around us were also commenting how down to earth and great the service is at the Canonita Bar, which I can't help but agree. I've been coming to this bar since 2012 and will continue to go during their happy hour.   Thanks again Mario!

jPu0qnskFT89WtjZ60ICzA.text: Stopped in tonight (Wednesday) at about 8:30 pm and was dining solo.  The hostess asked if I wanted a place at their shared tables - I expect this was because they had some type of private event going on taking up a lot of spots that are "canal" side. I decided I'd rather sit at the bar and was immediately helped by multiple bartenders offering me Margaritas and the like.  I was looking for a lighter and less calorie stuffed meal, so ordered a large Pellegrino w/Lime.    The bartenders seemed very knowledgeable about the menu and practically congratulated me for my decision to order the Pozole Verde.... which... was.... delicious! The flavor was fantastic! I was a little bit disheartened to see the size of the pork -- not that they were skimpy on the pork overall, just the size of the pieces seemed awfully tiny compared to other Pozoles I've had. I probably could have stopped there as I wasn't ravenous -- the Pozole was probably about a cup and a half. Not too big and not too small.   I ended up deciding I was hungry enough to get something else and tried their Tuna Ceviche Tostada.  The presentation was simple -- one corn tortilla, tostada style, secured on the plate by some guacamole (underneath) to prevent slipping around the plate during transport and topped with a Tuna ceviche that had a cilantro and serrano pesto with onions and jalapeno.  The bartender had warned me that it was spicy, but I guess I didn't get a very spicy jalapeno because I could have handled more heat.  On top of the well portioned ceviche was about a 1/4 avocado which was ripe and tasty.    Overall, I really enjoyed my meal with Canonita and will likely visit again sometime this week to try another dish as many of my bar neighbors seemed to have some delicious dishes in front of them.

yHsLGLrOqNkRz2mu73uUjw.text: I would give canonita a 3.5 in stars. I came here for breakfast this morning with my boyfriend.   Great location on the canals, we enjoyed our breakfast right next to the canal.   I got the Mexican torta. It seems like a lot of bread for the food inside, so I took it off the bread. There were tortilla Chips underneath it anyways. I do wish they offered this dish as an egg dish instead of a sandwich. I also wish that it came with two eggs. The inside of the sandwich was very tasty!   My boyfriend got the breakfast burrito. He said it was okay (I definitely chose the better dish!)   Service was fast but nothing special. It was a good meal, which is why I would rate it 3.5.

HZ_2w9nV9EX7bYylPVi5hg.text: This is one of the best restaurants in the shops at the Venetian. Shout out to Alejandro who is a great waiter and appears to also run the bar. LOL. The manager got us in without a reservation for my friends birthday so we will always remember fondly this place. Definitely recommend the food kind of a cross between Mexican southwestern fusion. But take it up a notch.  A must go to!  Awesome chips and salsa, the appetizer empanadas were amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmm

dE8wn_lgQPFlF9kGAfPnIg.text: Breakfast was awesome! The breakfast burrito was good, coffee was good and the view is amazing! Ask to sit on the canal! Fun to watch couples be rowed in and out and hear the gondola rowers sing! My husband had the steak and eggs and the steak was juicy and tender. Our server was one of the best we were lucky enough to have while visiting Vegas. Our server Hyder made our experience that much better! Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee on the canal!

FFFjWfzxR1kAXXuGiJaKpQ.text: Very slow service. Restaurant mixed up all the orders--one person never got their food until everyone else was done eating. Manager refused to comp that person's $70 meal on an over $3,000 order. Food is just mediocre--pass on this place there are plenty other good places to eat in Las Vegas.

l-jKOLc18T0PksDuoAbYdw.text: My friends and I wanted a good bite that was neither fast foody or wouldn't break the bank.  Great choice. Food was delicious including appetizers, entrees and margaritas.  To plus, the setting is very nice- an "open air"/replica of the day time sky ceiling and location next to a "Venetian canal" added great ambiance. Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7ywjG9bp7m5Fd63JXs_9pQ.text: Great food awesome location. I absolutely loved their take on Mexican street corn. It was delicious. A bit pricey for date night but ok for once in a while.

dXOsHto0k8o2PPnjapu0GA.text: A bit hesitant to do the Mexican place in a hotel with the Italian theme, but we weren't in the mood for pasta at the time. The experience at Canonita was OK. The service was up and down. They changed waiters on us mid-stream and without notice. It was VERY slow to get a check and so forth, even though the place had pretty much emptied out.  Fortunately, the food was pretty good. They do have this annoying thing about trying to up-sell you on stuff. Like they charged for every little side you ask for.  The mushroom enchiladas were really good and the veggie fajitas (not explicitly on the menu) were decent. It was "happy hour" and we were tempted by the drinks deals which ended up not being very happy. Just a weak showing there.  Overall, not bad. We did get a really nice seat next to the canals of Venice. Gotta make the best of the fake world we were in.

JCpgDuXd8_rV3GwgiO-rFQ.text: I happened to be a the Venetian and initially had planned to eat at Javier's for my last night here on business but was too tired to walk all the way back to the end of the strip so based on a recommendation from my wife who recently ate here I decided to dine for dinner. Had the chicken enchiladas and requested suiza instead of ranchero sauce along with a House Margarita.   Overall...I would give the meal 3.5 stars which translates to 4 stars. My server was very engaging and guest experience overall was great however, I was dining during non-peak dinner hours (mid to late afternoon).Price and value is better than Javier's and recommend this for folks who are on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Tres Enchiladas con Pollo with suiza sauce instead of ranchera&#34;

8i_FWiqrWtqJRtjb75jI0Q.text: Great quality food! Carne asada nortena and mushroom enchiladas are delicious. One of their best sides is the corn tamales!! We make it a point to go here every time we go to Vegas. The service is great and the view sitting by the canal is fantastic!!

7jrtOCr27Hbn7CjvjfyqFQ.text: This was delicious! 4.75!!!!! The mole was really authentic Mole.  The fish was succulent and the kale (substituted for the beans) cooked but still crunchy. The corn was Mexico city Authentico!  Orale!! If you KNOW Mexican cuisine, THIS will make you contento. Disfrutalo! Oh yeah, my margarita hit the spot too.  I'd come back for sure! Perfecto.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi Mole Magnifico!

z_RpxbvVoSKrjePT56TN0w.text: MANY surprises, most of them good ones! Chance choice. Cute, by the canal, etc. Wife said this was one of the best margaritas she's ever had. Fish tacos WERE the real deal. Simple and tasty. Mushroom tacos were the stuff of memory. Rice and black beans were prepared 'just so,' and our server was knowledgeable and friendly.
