WJ7UXOQykr7CeYgaj5BFew.text: Canonita is a great place for breakfast!!  Pass up the typical buffets and hotel restaurants and stop by.  Service was excellent, atmosphere is charming and food is delicious.  On my visit, I tried the Mexican Pancakes served with potatoes and bacon.  The portions were generous and flavorful-they hit the spot!  Food was so good, we went back again the next day.  Tried the Steak and Eggs-it was a home run!  Will definitely be back to try out the dinner.  Tips: Breakfast is served until 11:30. Very convenient if staying at The Venetian.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Pancakes and Potatoes.

BNU4KZ9cFNVoUterJeCTew.text: Really loved this place!  For drinks, we ordered the jalapeno margarita and it was really good.  For food, we ordered a guac for the table and it was delightful.  My mom and I split the vegetarian enchiladas and the sauce was fantastic.  I almost wish I had my own plate of enchiladas instead of sharing but it was probably good I didn't (I had already eaten enough chips and guac by that point :) ).  My dad ordered the mahi mahi and he said it was very fresh, tasty, and light.   Our server Danielle was wonderful; she made sure to check in with us a lot, she was I eat about what was vega and what was not, and she was fun.  Note: the restaurant charges for all additional sauces, so don't be shocked when the bill comes.  I really like how this place has a lot of veg options that are delicious. Would definitely return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable enchiladas, guac, and the Mahdi magi to the right.  Yum!&#39;n

0JbNi_Q9dzhTSnOGZ2XmnQ.text: Had a great dinner..ordered the vegi burrito that waiter suggested because its not on menu. Also at table shrimp burritos. .everything was very good. .waiter was great..

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8GWPh2-Ak6XR_cP7PrGsIA.text: Drinks were great and well priced and the crab cake appetizer was worth the money. However, I ordered a chicken tortilla salad and the chicken was inedible. It was so dry that it tasted like chalk. I'm not impressed with the $15 price tag on a salad in which the chicken breast couldn't even be cooked properly.

sj4DQ3ZQT_OT1lgGV_xQPw.text: This is me and my best friends first time staying at The Venetian and I love it! I came here yesterday with my bestfriend and the bartenders and drinks were so good we came back her a 2nd time and we are going to make this a daily thing!!! Danny, Armando Dhiodara and Trayle they are  fantastic!! Excellent personalities and really genuine people they made me feel so welcomed!! Thank you guys so much for making our stay that much better!! And the drinks were divine!! You have customers for life every time I come to Vegas I will go out of me way to come and have a drink Can't wait to come back next year!

e2DN4C6GF51THio6CCCIVQ.text: The drinks are wonderful.  Try the raspberry mojito - very refreshing.  The salsa was not to my taste, though the guacamole was great.  If you are getting tacos, I recommend the chicken.

bm16tq8v9DuuZ8VvMHBRsQ.text: It's hard to find good, authentic food when you're in a new city, but I'm so happy we found this restaurant! The food is incredible, perfectly portioned, I love the grand canal next to the restaurant, the staff is very friendly and on top of things. I'd eat here everyday if I could. The food is flavorful and there are many choices to choose from. I would say this is 2nd best to food from Mexico itself!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xdLkQ9hh9cjbB5sadAakRA.text: Best breakfast I have ever had in Vegas. Sometimes spur of the moment ideas are your destiny. I research and plan almost every minute of my vacation. Throw in a 21 year old and you have to be able to adjust. As she slept in, our breakfast buffet plans went out the window..like Doug's mattress.   So, down the strip we went in search of a place for a late breakfast. She had never been in the Venetian and as she stared wide eyed at the tables next to the indoor canal, she said, "At some point I want to eat here." I took a quick look at the menu & they serve breakfast until 11:30am.  We were seated immediately, right on the water. It was so lovely to watch the gondolas pass throughout the meal. This restaurant is in a prime location, right where the boats stop for a brief serenade. We heard numerous versions, from the traditional to the light hearted for the kids.   Now for the food. I am still thinking about my plate here. I have searched high & wide for an excellent Huevos Rancheros and Canonita truly delivered. The rice was light, pillowy, fresh and full of that deep stock flavor that a good Mexican rice deserves. The beans were also fresh, seasoned perfectly, and had a hearty texture. Each side of the plate featured a sauce, red to the right and green to the left. The red sauce was slightly sweet and complimented everything on the plate. The green sauce had just the right kick to make your tastebuds sing. Both were complimented with a perfectly cooked, over easy egg and luscious jack cheese.   Service was wonderful and the prices were great, especially considering the ambiance. The whole experience was truly 5 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional bacon &amp; eggs
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing huevos rancheros.

FTr9pBFlDM0Gpf_MwB3uAQ.text: When you come and eat at Canonitas they make you feel like a queen. My server Christina was super Friendly & amazing, she is a 5 star server! And makes this place look great!   Besides the amazing service, another thing that gives this place the advantage of being 5 stars, is simply the Location and view of the whole place, in the Venetian Next to the water & gondola, with italian Fences, and an adorable flower on the table. This place gives you an amazing feel under the Beautiful Fake sky that makes Las Vegas so amazing!   My drink was amazing, & the food was excellent! This is Mexican food by the way, served in a very fancy way. I loved that they have flan. Yummyyy!!  I will defenetly come here again forshure. I recommend canonitas to everyone. Its a MUST come if youre out here in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from my table is very Lovely! I loved it
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from my Table at Cañonita

4JRjSOezAyggXwPd5tbmqA.text: I had seen this place on our last trip while shopping in the Grand Canal Shoppes and decided to make it our stop for dinner after the Elton John concert. I love that it's located next to the canal so you can watch the gondolas float by.   Our reservations were for 10:15 PM but it was nice that they were able to seat us earlier. At that time of night Canonita was only half full so we got a prime table on the water. This is a great photo spot by the way!  I ordered the Tres tacos with a beef filling and my husband got a chicken quasadilla. I expected ground beef in the tacos but the meat was actually in the form of small cubes in a tasty sauce so I loved the tacos! You also get this delicious rice and black beans. My plate was spotless when I had finished! It's just the right amount of food. They also have a great happy hour that we were able to take advantage of when picking drinks. All in all, I loved this place, and would definitely come back to get some good Mexican food.

kfVb2J75sNRUHV7f_-C3gQ.text: Very good. We were surprised. Chorizo breakfast burritos were really really good need a little salsa or something. The short rib and egg breakfast nachos we're really good. A little bit of spice.

5mgtOuPtUc7qV58FtlpafQ.text: I normally write long reviews, but this place... Yum.   The spices are incredible and the dishes sing.   "I'd fly to Vegas just to eat at this place."

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gT8BlAe24yimwfqcSXmR2A.text: I've honestly had better- Javiers, El Dorado Cantina, El Sombrero, Tacos El Gordo and even El Segundo Sol (on a good day) all come to mind. Canonita describes itself as Mexican soul food and I just didnt taste it. Whenever I try a place for the first time I like to stick with the basics- if a Mexican restaurant can impress me with great tasting tacos then I'll venture out and try the mole, sopes and enchiladas. Well they didn't impress me with the Tres Tacos. I think when the server told me they came with salsa already on them I knew something was amiss. I asked for the salsa on the side because often times the salsa will hide the flavor of the whole taco and to be honest I've never had a taco come with salsa on it. Thats like covering a flat iron steak in A1.    The entree arrived with 3 tacos and one hot, dried out lime, rice, beans and salsas on the side and to my surprise the cilantro and red onions were on the side as well! Yes, red onions on a taco. The beans were awful- lacked flavor and were hard. The cilantro rice was good but seemed like a waste to even bother eating it. The chicken taco was dry- dear god- was it a dry taco. The corn tortillas are made in house, but I'd never had a tortilla like that. It had the sturdiness and dryness of a corn tortilla and the softness of a flour tortilla. My mouth was perplexed. The carne asada taco was just as dry, but their saving grace was the pork taco. Its hard to find dry pork so they get a pass on that one. I expected more flavors for a $4 dollar taco at such a nice restaurant.   The margarita was good but short on ice and a bit too sweet and I drink the same margarita everywhere I go- on the rocks, no salt. Perhaps that's just personal preference. In closing, I'll never understand how a server disappears when it comes time to present a check, pick up the check and return with the change. This place was no different but I wasn't on a schedule so I was fine waiting and waiting and waiting.   Would I venture into Canonita again? Perhaps not.

G2cFS0dcYaPg9IZt1w1fCw.text: This place is beautiful!! There is a beautiful view of the gondolas that are passing by. Additionally, the person who is directing the gondola is singing and they all have beautiful voices!  Ambiance is romantic and soothing. Food was delicious!! Authentic Mexican food!! Tortillas are handmade!! My husband had enchiladas, that were a tinny bitand I had a cocktel and flautas!! Their horchata has bits of rice in it that makes it unique tasting!! Prices were decent for their taste and portions.  We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kbj9myKDOkoX_kGkkJbo8Q.text: Best Mexican food in Italy I've ever had! Ahi tuna entree was THE BOMB. The polenta cakes and sauce were so unique- very tasty! Also, guacamole is on point! Great flavor twist on Mexican food! :)

r8XyKYGOiWacJYcVUXjdOw.text: Nice location inside the Venetian next to the canal - but the rest, YUK. The service is impatient, rushed, and overall weak.  The drinks are ok, but the food is seriously lame.  You pay five dollars for weird salsa and chips.  The chips are fresh - but the salsa is weird smoked garbage.  Our waiter - OMG - he was so annoyed that we didn't order the second he came over - 30 seconds after we sat down.  He approached again 1 minute later, and again two minutes later.  Hubby almost lost it.  I had "fish tacos" - tilapia - and two pounds of red onion.  Nothing else, just bland fish and chopped red onion in little soggy tortillas.  No slaw.  No crema.  No sauce.  So bad.  I grabbed a fork and just ate the fish - left the rest on the plate.  GROSS.  My hubby had the Pork Carnitas plate - three chunks of meat on some lame white rice.    The bill - a cool 100.00 for crap.  Again, nice location, but the food is better at Taco Bell.  And seriously - what decent Mexican place makes you pay for chips and salsa.  Just pass on this and go over the Mandalay and eat at Hussong's.  (Hussong's was soooo good!)

LdLBFF1LDjPsrNiUcCyEVg.text: The biggest asset for this restaurant is the location, but the food however was just average and the prices are exorbitant. My family and I came here for dinner, I made reservations for 9pm, but they did not let me know that the kitchen closed at 10pm. Once we got there, we felt like we were rushed to put in an order, although the waiter apologized it could have been prevented by letting me know when I made the reservation a week in advance. They did not have a couple of the wine we wanted to order, and the food was just ok. I did not find them to be of great quality and though we did not order alot, the bill was more than it deserved to be. I did notice that during the day time they had street tacos available, so I would recommend doing, or just getting drinks. I did not find that spending money here for actual dinner and drinks was worth it besides the view of the canal.

HJlByXjuH0cMSFSzwx4LfQ.text: We had a nice experience, it was a last minute decision to have dinner here. To our surprise it was yummy, my husband and I shared the taco sampler and a dish called Mar Y Tierra which I found excellent!!  Our server was knowledgeable and kind.

6ljOUDpdr2nEYt4WA8I5Lw.text: Canonita is a nice Mexican joint in the Grand Canal Shoppes at the Venetian / Palazzo in Las Vegas, right on the canal! (I mean the fake canal, but hey, you're in Las Vegas, this is what you've come to expect.) They have decent vegetarian options including enchiladas, mushroom and tacos, and their rice and beans are vegetarian.  They also have Mojito and Margarita flights available (and who doesn't love a flight of anything?!)  I had the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas. This was a great dish served with three enchiladas. This was a bit more creamy than "enchilada saucy" but was very filling. The white rice with peas and corn it was served with was light and delicious...as were the "special" kidney beans that were mixed with corn and were just very good.  They offer chips and salsa for $5. I maintain that if you are at a Mexican restaurant, it is your god-given right to have chips and salsa automatically provided as part of the experience so I balk a bit at having to pay for them separately...and in this case I wish we hadn't...the chips were a little too thick and were not evenly salted. The salsa they came with was good though.  As I mentioned, it's right on the canal so the atmosphere was nice (though you have to be a party of 2 to sit at one of the tables next to the water.)

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Five Dollar Chips and Salsa
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Enchiladas

QtxBuxSww-gasiwKkp_EjA.text: Visited Canonita while on vacation. The food was great and has a nice view of the gondola rides. I had the chips with salsa and guacamole as well as the taco sampler, which came with five different tacos. Everything was delicious and the atmosphere is lovely.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hStxjDQlq9bhXhJd4T4ITg.text: I ordered the Pork Chop an when it came out it was cold in the middle an really under cooked.  I cut the pork chop down the middle an showed my waiter.  I informed him that this this is under cooked.  He took it back and an felt the need to tell me that this is how they serve the their pork chop with the internal temp of 135 degrees.  This is unexplainable.  Pork should be brought to an internal temp of 160 degrees.  What a cluster.   Very unhappy chubby kid...

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q7uxGLo2HLAgcuNUmAnNJQ.text: Javier at the bar is amazing. We sat at the bar waiting for a table, but quickly cancelled the table and sat with Javier. He made me an off menu drink I asked for, and it was perfect. His food recommendations were spot on. Highly recommend Canonitas!!

xnNMsDG__krwlJ42AJkGRw.text: Mexican "Soul Food" in the heart of the Italian Venetian's Grand Canal Shoppes? Sounds pretentious and I had my doubts. I was surprised! Don't judge a restaurant necessarily by its location.   Chips, guacamole and salsa were pretty standard, and freshly made instead of broken, bagged chips would've made a big difference.  Canonita's menu includes Americanized, non-threatening Mexican fare; however, it also lists inspiring and unique takes on Platos Fuertes traditional regional dishes such as:  *Santa Rosa Barbacoa - Guajillo chile-ribbed pork wrapped in banana leaf;  *Vaquero Beer-braised Short Rib - Negra Modelo, mushroom hominy, spiced tobacco onions, pasilla Oaxaca chile reduction;  *Pollo Mole Poblano - (unfortunately named) Airline chicken breast;  *Seared Cabo Ahi Tuna - Padilla Oaxaca chile cream sauce, papas bravas, smoked tomato-roasted serrano aioli. I chose this dish mainly due to college memories of deep sea fishing in Cabo San Lucas, catching and eating the freshest Ahi tuna I ever had, in many different ways including as sashimi.  I questioned the waiter about how much it was seared and didn't want it over-cooked. He assured me it would be great. And he was right, an excellent sear on fresh, very rare Ahi and generous portions. The sauce was awesome! It earned 5 stars for taking me right back to Cabo, and was the highlight meal of my trip.  Service was constant, personable and friendly. There was no rush felt to turn over the table. In the frenzy of the mall, we were able to relax, enjoy Margaritas, and taste a bit of delicious Mexican soul food in the middle of "Italy"!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Cabo Ahi Tuna*

l1RbFTwi2uk1yMZYeiBI2A.text: Arrived at the right time, Happy Hour!!!!! Oddly enough it's 3-6 and then again 9 to close.  The classic margarita $5 and they were taste.  We ordered a queso fondido with jalapeno and my only complaint would be that I wish it came with tortilla chips versus the tortillas.  I ordered the wild mushroom enchiladas and they were delicious.  The filling was tasty but the green sauce took the dish to another level.  I was not a fan of the rice and beans because the beans had a bite to them which I don't like in my beans.  I'm also more of a refried beans type of gal. The other dish ordered was the Veracruz mahi mahi, WOW!!!! The presentation was beautiful and that sauce, veggies, and fish was exquisite.  Try their homemade hot sauce,  I really enjoyed it. The customer service was grade A.  Our waitress checked on us appropriately and our drink were refilled constantly.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xg79lFlZKw-gsTHhOjINYA.text: Barbacoa was super delicious, best ever and prob the first time I had it. Super soft meat, big portion for me. I had to take the rest back.  Chips and salsa was ok, would prefer spicer salsa.   Otherwise, everything was great. Seated fast, service was friendly.

QDNvCYq4mrbajVZByODUhw.text: We were walking around the hotel and the tacos lured us in. We were seated promptly next to the gondola ride which was nice. Our waiter didn't start serving us til about 15 min later. We ordered the happy hour drink specials margaritas. Appetizer we got the lump crab and shrimp cake and for entree the tacos. The tacos came out fairly fast, but we still haven't gotten our appetizer nor drinks. Waiter was hard to come by to address. Finally, he was able to bring them out and said he upgraded our drinks to a large, which looked regular size to me. Once we were done with our meals again, waiter was nowhere to be found. Handed us the wrong check and laughed about it.   Overall, very poor service. Food is decent. Would not recommend.

ZlpWELfK0je7v2ExfQHfSA.text: While visiting Vegas I decided to check this place out for some good taco. The fish taco was delicious and the flan was scrumptious. The waiter was attentive and accommodating even though they were extremely busy. Their mocktails were also quite flavorful. Would come back again with family.

RACt39ZSt14Lqnb2RP4RDQ.text: We arrived just at the end of happy hour so we caught some $5 margaritas to start our dinner with. We also tried the tequila flight which was fun to try different tequilas. We had the guacamole and queso fundido and both were amazing - very fresh and great flavors! I would highly recommend them both. I had the short rib quesadillas and they were just okay. I expected the short rib to be shredded and it was more like grisly pieces of short rib. I loved the black beans that came with it. If you are looking for something spicy to accommodate your entree or chips, get the hot green salsa. It was extremely spicy so start off slow. My colleagues had the crab salad - the avocado croutons are to die for, the cazuela de mariscos and the fajitas and they all said their entrees were good. The guys had some issues with the tortillas falling apart but other than that everything was great!   Service was a little slow but he was friendly and knowledgeable. Can't beat the prices for Vegas!! We sat on the patio and it was a great view of the gondola rides.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib quesadillas

7XkCa4MYcEvY-TSMeD6GhA.text: This place was awesome, food was delicious and the waitress Laura was a great server. We truly recommend this place to anyone going to Vegas. And thank you for the bday dessert as well as the military discount.  Please buy tapatio or habanero.....

Hap1Lf2y6YPQUS40HolxTw.text: Today was my second time here and I wanted to order the 2 tacos for $7 dollars deal and was going to give the guy working there a ten dollar bill and have him keep the change. As I was about to pay, I asked for a cup of water in which the guy told me I have to buy a bottle because the company doesn't want to give a plastic cup for free. I then proceeded to tell him I was just there yesterday and the lady gave me the water no questions asked. He then told me not today and basically rudely implying I should buy a bottle and not be so cheap. At this point I asked to speak to a manager and the manager agreed with me that he should have given me a cup with no problem. I left because there is no way I was going to let this guy touch my food knowing he is capable of doing something to my food like SPITTING IN IT! I will never give this place any business again and will tell all my industry people that this is how they run their business.

0fJDnCX8JvIpurjKmnJXWw.text: I love this place!  Located right on the "canal" set in the Venetian.  Since recently being in Venice, this a treat.  They have the gondola rides going by, which makes for a fun environment.  The service was excellent.  I had the braised beef, which was super tender and hardly no fat.  Also tried the nachos, perfectly crispy with plentiful toppings.  Overall great experience, I definitely recommend sitting by the canal.  Also recommend walking to LV's version of St. Mark's Palazzo around the corner.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. St. Mark&#39;s Palazzo
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gondola rides open to the public
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;outdoor&#34; type seating

CvtIH8pWc5l0sjY-trM3sQ.text: Been coming here over the years - great location, food is good, service consistent.  Would like to see a margarita on the happy hour menu.  I'm usually opposed to paying for chips and salsa at a Cantina, but I let this place get away with it for some reason and order them every time ! Thanks for the locals discount!

-5tcTxFyAMHGsU4nSBT1Dw.text: We had the glazed scallops and chicken enchiladas - both were delicately seasoned with fresh herbs & spices and excellently prepared.  For a quick and tasty  weeknight dinner that doesn't break the bank, I highly recommend.

jwmHUcN-A0e4W0eIXlcpJA.text: The service was not on point. Waiter got the order wrong twice and it was just for flautas. Friend had mole that she said was not seasoned and that the mole sauce tasted sweet so she returned it and got a different meal.  Margarita platter was good. Chips and salsa good

-1AaGAadQz97qS3Dr6m1rg.text: Beautiful restaurant by the little Venetian river! Their carne asada is amazing here! I definitely recommend it. My boyfriend ordered that entree with a Dos Equis of course while I had the chicken quesadillas! Duuuuude, the cilantro rice is so good with the quesadilla. It also came with black beans. Although it might not look like much but the plate with just two quesadilla got me full!   The carne asada was packed with flavor. I definitely recommend those two dishes! Short review since we came for late lunch but it was definitely affordable and worth the trip out!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Quesadilla &amp; Carne Asada, of course with Dos Equis

zaU4bUyEXq9NniuOKohpLg.text: This place has great food and great atmosphere. The Venetian is already beautiful with the sky roof top. It definitely redeemed itself for Jerry's amazing and excellent customer service. He is a nice, polite, and descent, waiter! We had a great experience thanks to him.

AiVMrNXnsFpcaDXiJ0oE9g.text: Love the make-your-own Bloody Mary bar. Chilaquies for brunch were really good. Great atmosphere on the canal at the Venetian.

Aob9hkeWgoZuIpDWsH5H-A.text: Lunch today with Stephanie as my server.  She was attentive, made good recommendations on the menu and some "local" insider tips. Food arrived very quickly. It was delicious!  I had the carnitas with chipotle BBQ.  Beans & cilantro rice also very good.  Sangria margarita was also very good.    I wish I could go back. Trapped in off strip resort for three day conference. I know I'll starve!  Oh and the location?  Charming!  Gondolier's serenaded throughout the meal.

zD_pMPfqeOPf86d2ztYfdA.text: Outstanding treat!!  Total surprise!  The food here utterly astounding.  Spinach Salad, Salmon, and Ceviche.  Totally unique, delicious.  Our server, Nathan, was the best!!  Kind, prompt, fun, knew his stuff.  I've been a server and he's cream of the crop!  Would recommend this place in a heartbeat

ii_66egsXgYxnfWoH4M87Q.text: Nice mid-priced option for good food and fun atmosphere.  We sought this restaurant out on a recent visit to Vegas because we both remembered it fondly from independent visits to Vegas years ago. It continues to be a nice, mid-priced option for good food and fun atmosphere. You aren't dining in Vegas's finest here, but you also aren't paying for that. It's in the mall part of The Venetian. Think of it as an excellent, mid-priced lunch option as you move about the strip. The restaurant juts into the canal that the gondoliers come down. A major 'stop and sing' point for them is right where you dine, separated by just a railing over the water. The chicken mole was amazing according to my husband. My slow-roasted pork (in a banana leaf) was ok. The speciality drinks were good. I really enjoyed the pina, served in a coconut, but felt it was a small amount of liquid in the actual drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the tables against the railing
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Mole dish
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pina drink is served in a coconut

1GVdy47vihrvFGHu5ZpySQ.text: This was a great atmosphere to be in, especially after a long day of traveling. I'm usually really picky with my mexican food but this place was great! I had these Carne Asada strips that were so tender and they came with some sweet corn tamales that were to die for! I can't wait to go back! Especially for those tamales!

tvkkwrkCSMfFRV2LAF0tTg.text: We felt like having Mexican food and after reading some reviews we decided to eat here ,unfortunately the food was below  average, we ordered the ceviche and guacamole and later tacos , enchiladas and the mushroom enchiladas, nothing was good , Taco Bell will be a better choice for dinner

7H_OHAq4-wXMVXXHPYQSWA.text: Great food very light and flavorful it was a colorful meal!We came around 5:00pm and there was zero wait although it was a Monday so I suggest making a reservation if your planning on eating here during the weekend. The atmosphere felt like you were eating right on the side of the river I suggest asking for a table near the water feature. You felt very isolated and quaint although your right in the middle of the rush of people. The service was great and the staff was very helpful and kind. I recommend eating here if your looking for a casual amazing place to eat!!!

9GF2RmP_4Z3bePzPpq82Jw.text: Holy crap. Some of the best filet mignon I've ever tried, and I'm a steak fan who usually avoids the stuff in favor of more flavorful/fatty cuts like ribeye.  I wasn't expecting much from ratings, but I was quite surprised. It's a good size for filet, very tender but flavorful, not dry at all.  Cooked to a perfect med rare. Unfortunately it was about a 40 min wait to get it to go.  Um, well worth it.  edit: went to Craftsteak the next day and got a ribeye for $$$.  This was miles above on both flavor and texture.  Cannot trust yelp reviews anymore e_e

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Togo box
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet. Delicious

wxsZ5K7A97Jwg_Pt8ZIrAg.text: The food at Canonita is decent Mexican and the service is satisfactory. As far as restaurants go in the venetian/ Palazzo this one has been very accommodating for our large party, we even got custom printed menus. As with everything in Vegas this all came for a price.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

w-zgOifQd88onNaz48Qx_Q.text: Service was weak. Waiter tried his best but didn't seemed trained enough for $175 tab for a party of 3 -type place. Apps came out 2 seconds before dinner. Having to ask for more beers or margaritas?!?!  Have to pay for chips and salsa which were good but c'mon?!?  Food was Americanized-Mexican and doesn't come close to other spots along the strip.  Good for a cocktail along the canal and that's it.

XM7bOzjxo-i47uLR8ihR-Q.text: Delicious barbacoa! We also had the seared mahi-mahi on a pepita mole -- which was very good, but the smokey, slightly sweet and savory barbacoa was the real standout. We had chips, salsa with a lovely charred flavor, and guac too- very filling! Definitely worth a visit if you're in Vegas and have a taste for upscale Mexican food.

Yu07l9PSKQLWgbgBWK-oXA.text: LOVE this place! Thank you "Juliette" for a great lunch on my husband's bday! We had a blast! Thank you! GREAT FOOD! Love the POM Margaritas, and the MUSSELS! Great Guac too!

NqvhiuYct1Q2s5FVf8-zLA.text: Canonita is undoubtedly the best restaurant I've ever been to. The food here is so delicious that it brought tears to both my sister and I. I highly recommend this place to everyone. Everything we ordered was utterly breath taking. (I recommend the roasted corn.)

MBj3siWC989DOY6D-wlTYg.text: Absolutely delicious!  Had dinner meeting here and had table of 20. Specific menu with  appetizers, salad and 4 entrees. The queso fundido and empanada appetizers were so good!  Loved my spinach salad and the salmon and sweet corn were to die for. I only wish I didn't eat so many chips with guacamole and appetizers so I could of eaten all my salmon and corn!  The sweet corn was so good!  Definitely worth a stop next time in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonora filet mignon
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chiapaneco Salmon with Mexican sweet corn
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WEw1_elue6V70Ph_ePPNWA.text: Nice place in the Venetian. It was very nice seeing the beauty of the hotel while eating yummy mexican food. Their guacamole is AMAZING. Probably the best guacamole I've had at any other restaurant, (still not as good as momma's homemad guac though lol). I got the Tuna tartar which was yummy, but a little too much tuna lol which is nothing to complain about. My friends all had different dishes and they all enjoyed it, so no complaints on the food. The margarita's weren't amazing but still not bad. Would I come here again if I were in Vegas? probably not, but I did enjoy my time here. Also, the service was wonderful as well.

UjJGy1tegCy-e7mjdvv8kw.text: This is a solid, but certainly not fantastic, dining experience that is enhanced by being adjacent to the canal at Venetian.  We always get the 3 taco plate, which I guess is as close to a "bargain" as you can get on the strip.  My favorites are fish and pork, with the pork having a very good pineapple salsa.  The queso fundido has been an appetizer we go back to several times over.  The chorizo is a good addition, but can be greasy, so be advised.  Also, the cheese hardens fairly quickly, so this is an appetizer I wouldn't linger over.  Standard Mexican beer selection and some margarita choices.  It's a fun way to not lose your shirt on dinner on the strip.

QxII7eIZiW6iedqVvEMtBA.text: Well the portions are pretty huge but for the price it's kinda meh? Part of that is just the cost of doing biz in vegas I suppose but you can do better in this town.

aPlZv25a-9-gOP0dAr7Y2A.text: Absolutely delicious food! I had a chicken quesadilla and my husband had the tres tacos-chicken, beef and fish. The sangria margarita was delicious as well. We also ordered the chips and salsa for an extra $3. The chips were warm and fresh and the salsa was awesome. Our waitress was super nice and we loved having a seat by the canal. Can't wait to come here again when we visit Vegas again!

1NNuYHI5z25AWRNYzfNKWg.text: Great food, I had the 3 taco, Cilantro & Lime Rice, with black beans. It was VERY good! My uncle had the Enchiladas dish with beans & rice which he liked very much! We were seated right along the Canal which was great too! We also happen to catch "Happy Hour" and got $5 Margarita's which how couldn't you love that!?!? The prices were great it's a must try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 Taco, Cilantro and lime rice, and black bean dish! Tasted great, loved it!

zPwGqYLN14qvBhgDFKYVBg.text: I remember this place fondly because of the tasty mojitos they offer.   Oh what a difference 3 years make.  I was looking at the menu online and it seemed like a good idea to revisit this place since the entrees are between $14 - $23, which is affordable for a place located in the Venetian. The drinks were WEAK (we ordered a carafe of white sangria and two mojitos), seriously when I'm in Vegas, I want to be at least tipsy! (if not passed out!)  My pork al pastor with pineapple salsa was salty and dry. Same thing with my sis' chicken quesadilla. My bros said their burritos were okay, but then again, those two will eat anything. (yup. they don't Yelp either!) On the other hand, the cilantro rice was actually pretty good.   Oh, did you know that this place charges $2 for chips n salsa?!? That's a crime -- even for a Mexican restaurant on the strip! What's even worse is, there's an additional 50 cents charge for refills!   The service. Holy effin guacamole.  I couldn't tell you how BAD it was. (okay, you insist so let me tell you) Let me start by saying, my sis and I both used to work in the restaurant business. My bros still work in the food industry.  Bad service means less than 15% tip or no tip at all. Our server does NOT deserve the automatic 18% charge on our bill (we were a party of 6).  We waited awhile for our dishes to come out, we had to keep asking for water refills, napkins, utensils and it took FOREVER to get the check.    Canonita, get your act together! the only decent part of this experience was the nice ambiance sitting next to the grand canal. Kudos to the smiling hostess as well. I know parting is SUCH sweet sorrow....  NOT.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WEAK mojito
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork al pastor tacos
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadilla

Lqkwl9wFtHK9rTBeuTAxMg.text: This Mexican restaurant is located inside the Venetian. If you eat here, make sure to get a seat "outside" next to the canal. Eating here is quite mind boggling when you consider that the whole atmosphere is a sham. No, you're not in Venice. And no, you're not outside. It really doesn't matter when you're sipping a delicious strawberry margarita and watching the gondolas float by. No matter how odd it may be, everything just works together to give you an interesting, if not wonderful, eating experience.  The sangria's and margarita's are great, the service is good, and the food passes in my book. The chips and salsa are delicious. I definitely suggest getting some guacamole to accompany your crunchy treat. The soups and taquito's were also yummy. I got a chicken ceasar salad as my main course, and unfortunately, I wasn't too impressed. Let's just say I've had better. Aside from that, I really enjoyed my experience at Canonita's and wouldn't mind giving it another shot in the future.

LZaVz7JjE8Pk4QaS-GtilQ.text: It was my wife's birthday dinner, and we were seated right on the Canal at The Venetian, what a great atmosphere!!  I ordered the roasted pork and I have never tasted better.  The General Manager, Annaliza McKiiey made sure every part of our meal was great.  Everyone in our party raved about the authenticity of their meal.  We will go back to this establishment every time we are in Vegas!!!!

9A1pAZ1Bsp_5pj4YkE659Q.text: So while strolling the Venetian,my friends and I decided to grab a quick lunch,nothing fancy..and they had 5$ margaritas so wth..The place wasn't super busy but it still took the hostess a while to get our table ready as it was 5 couples..Our waitress took forever with our drink orders,again it wasn't busy!! ..We had some specials of the day, like chicken and beef quesedillas which were actually pretty good! The quacamoli was to die for!!!! sooo good,main reason why this place is getting 3 stars!The waitstaff needs to get on their gaime,seriously!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y3KxKenk1Q_hl4-dxuv4Qg.text: We passed this restaurant by a couple of times and after looking at the other restaurants available, this menu looked the best.  The pricing was great. The portions were filling and the service was good as well.  Chips and salsa are usually a hit or miss at most Mexican restaurants.  It was a hit here. The guacamole was fresh. I did wish the salsa was a little more spicy, but i guess we need to keep it 'PC," right? Both dishes we ordered were fabulous.  And you can't beat the gondoliers (is that even a word?) passing by singing their hearts out.  I'd go back in a heartbeat.

9j-e7MBtwNqQ0b3tKhzJXg.text: I think the food is pretty OK.  What really disappointed me was the way they charged for everything.  Like 50 cents for this, or a dollar for that.  Come on- do I need to pay extra for Salsa?!?  Do you even want to live in a a place where you gotta pay extra for salsa.  Salsa should be free- you get it when you sit down.  There is a big picture here people- look at it.    Anyway try Dos Caminos instead...

me4_Qr6_eEO4Jm0JmV4X5g.text: We dropped by Canonita wanted to grab a quick dinner before going to Tao night club, and this is going to be our MUST stop next time we're in Vegas. We got Santa Rosa Barbacoa de Puerco and Carne Asada Nortena. Both were AMAZINGLY delicious! I've had quite a fair share of Mexican food, but this was surprisingly delightful. The sweet chipotle BBQ sauce perfectly complimented the Barbacoa. I didn't care much for the cilantro rice and bean though, but the meat was more than enough to satisfy my appetite. Boyfriend was in love with the angus steak, cooked to perfection. His plate was completely empty in 20 minutes. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful in explaining the menu. The food also came out pretty quickly.

LWMoj25u1qq9yIvAwoPNLw.text: Freshly off the plane and having checked in at the Palazzo, we headed over here for some lunch. I had read this place boasts of a nice view, so we walked over from the Palazzo. First off, it was quite confusing to get here, we asked for directions several times, since the path from Palazzo to Venetian is a bit of a maze. But once we walked into this beautiful fake piazza looking area, with bridges and gondolas we were in awe.   We wished we could have sat right next to the canal at this place but they reserve the canal view for tables for two. We were still able to enjoy the "fake" sights "outside". We ordered a pitcher of margaritas that our waiter had recommended which had Grand Manier, and boy was that strong!   We each got the taco platter which comes with three tacos you can choose from (you can mix and matches them too), and also comes with cillantro rice and beans.   I got the pork, beef and fish tacos. The pork was a bit dry, but the mango salsa on top was to die for! The beef tacos were my favorite- moist and flavorful. The fish ones had the mango salsa as well and were also very good. You could also choose the kind of tortilla, but unfortunately, I don't think they serve hard shell tacos which I personally love.  Their tomato salsa was also very delicious (and cheap) so I would recommend putting in an order of those. The waitstaff was friendly and helpful for the most part, though they were reluctant to allow us to charge our bill on 6 credit cards even though we were splittling the bill evenly. Eventually the informed us they would accomodate our request "just this once", but that it might take them a while to do so.

MiwNtQZ4Dwr3Z7l1_bL7OQ.text: I'm a sucker for a good Happy Hour and after spending $12 and up per drink for the past two days in Vegas, a $5 specialty margarita was looking pretty damn good. We went there for Linner (that time between lunch and dinner) and ordered a few Fire and Ice margaritas (so yummy!) and some appetizers. The ceviche was eh. It didn't seem fresh at all and I have had some killer ceviche (at La Mer in San Fran) and made ceviche with Iron Chef Jose Garces. Yes, I actually MADE shrimp ceviche with an Iron Chef but that's a story for another day or one you can read on my blog. :) The quacamole and chips and salsa were tasty. The chicken flautas were good. I still love flautas from Chevy's (they are just yummy unauthentic goodness) so I compare theirs to everyone. The view of the canal is what really sells this place. We had great seats to listen to the gondola singers--their voices are amazing. I do not know how they sing all day. Ok, I digress, Taqueria Canonita was good for the Happy Hour and ok for food. Go there for the view of the canal and the Happy Hour...now!

HmK7nE9nAs1HMOK_5W_DxQ.text: I like this place for it's location and the related ambience.  I came here for happy hour which has reasonable drink prices but limited draft selection.  They had interesting cocktail offerings; however, nobody raved about their drink.  Looking over the menu, I would probably only return for happy hour.

ZBJ_1IVe1H7BmevAnOCtnA.text: I wasn't impress. We sat along the canal and that was the highlight of the meal. Chips and guacamole was decent. I had the Tres Tacos, I thought it was bland and also they were those small tacos, I was expecting something more hardy. Even though the place was dead, service was slow. This might be a OK place for drinks, but I would skip it for dinner.

58jHL1Q6LtC0JyOY3cS49w.text: The food is okay..  But the service is terrible.  It took 7 minutes for them to bring our drinks... And thirty to get our food.  The server has only checked on us once.  The chips taste like they are out of the bag..  But hey The presentation is beautiful.  When you come to Vegas I think you should stick to the buffet.

K_D60Rq_NsKZXrJkmnIa8g.text: Found this place while wandering inside the Venetian. We asked a few people that worked at the Venetian about a good place to eat and a lot of them recommended this place. We got a table next to the "river" so we were able to watch the people on gondola rides while we dined. They have a great margarita selection and I remember getting the house margarita that had silver patron and it was really good. The food was excellent and the portions were quite big. I guess you get what you pay for over here. I was immediately in a food coma after I finished my dinner here!

FhAuXWk-Mmv_QWZhBCwfRg.text: Like everyone else has stated, this place is superb from location, price, taste, service, etc.  Everything one would want in a restaurant, Canonita possesses.  I had the taco plate for $15... each taco (SIX of them) was a different combination of filling (meat + seafood) and flavors, all on double corn tortillas.  It was a crap load of food but after a long day of traveling and walking, it hit the spot.  I was with a group and we had a plethora of margaritas and tequila shots (a few on the house) and our waiter brought us some pineapple slices soaked in tequila that were also on the house and pretty much knocked everyone on their ass.  We all left with a satisfying buzz and a full stomach.  It has made it onto my must-dine list when I'm in Vegas and that's not an easy accomplishment.

rB6n7hTAQFu6YcU4515Wyg.text: We enjoyed this restaurant. It has a nice location along the canal inside the shopping corridors of the Venetian. There are not really any walls in the dining area of this restaurant but some tables are located under a roof of this restaurant while others are "outside" under the high blue roof of the Venetian.  The atmosphere is nice. It is somewhat loud because let's face it, you are basically in the middle of a mall.  The food was quite good with a variety of rather unique twists on traditional mexican food. The portions were adequate but not ridiculous.  Prices were typical of the Vegas factor - higher than what they should be for what you get but weren't outrageous.  I'd return to this restaurant.

gLd-EspHoKLHrdnTwTEYWA.text: The guac was delicious and the view amazing.  I had to eat solo while attending a conference but the waitress was super attentive and made me feel very welcome.  Next time in Vegas, I'll be heading back.  The food was good, but I'm fortunate to eat a lot of excellent Mexican dishes.

3Ioi1EMRIep7nzAsIn0nsg.text: Wife and I went here for happy hour - I ordered a classic margarita and a maple whisky cocktail (the name of the latter drink is lost on me), she ordered a non-happy hour mojito, and we split a tres leches cake (which we ordered later into our time at the restaurant). Service was prompt - we were seated immediately, by friendly employees. The waiter was very attentive - was proactive about bringing us water after I had finished my first round of drinks - a very nice plus. Drinks were fine - nothing special, and on the weaker side, but still good. Waiter asked us multiple time whether we wanted to put in food, which, being from New York felt a little pushy, but it was also towards the end of the night, so it probably had to more to do with the place closing soon, than being pushy. Anyway, we ordered dessert towards closing, a tres leches cake, which was again, was good, but not necessarily the best tres leches cake ever. For the hour we were there between 10 to close at 11pm, it was nice to sit by the fake venetian canal, enjoy some solid drinks, talk and relax. It's a worthy place to relax in the late evening, especially if you aren't trying to get drunk.

CggmNuqVsXqOFzyQ9WNABw.text: I really wanted to find Mexican in Las Vegas, but there were so many places and reviews that we just came here since it was close to our hotel. Our waiter was Mexican, and had some good recommendations about what was good. He was very friendly and knowledgeable about eh menu. Also, I got enchiladas and they had 4 or 5 sauces to choose from based on spice-level. I got the mild mole and they were awesome! And even though it was $18, it seemed worth it since there were 3 of them, plus a huge heap of rice and beans. Given Vegas overpricing, it was definitely a decent value. The chips and salsa was $3 and good, so we didn't mind spending the 3 bucks. We didn't drink because we were too exhausted and dehydrated (1st day in Vegas- walked way too much!), but overall we were happy with our decision to try this place!

pGkw6LXIbue0_V39tMG-4A.text: We ate here most every time we have been and mostly it's been consistent in quality and service. This time wasn't a major disappointment but we will question eating here again in the future. I had the Tres Tacos (fish, pork and mushroom). The pork taco was a bit to "porky". It just tasted like a low end taco shop taco in my opinion. The fish had an odor I cannot describe and while it wasn't offensive it wasn't exactly inviting. The mushroom taco was good and as always the cilantro rice was really good.

17ovR0uYgYOvwej2eOpDQw.text: An extra star for letting allowing us to sit in close proximity  to the bar with my 2.5 year old and getting the happy hour rate for apps. Score! I was at the venetian for a conference and decided to meet up with some peers for a post conference drink and pre-dinner nosh. Try the horchata margeritia it was  a party in your mouth. Service was prompt,friendly and helpful. LIke many people stated the cerviche was fresh and clean.

qp1359srPL-XB47UsdatFg.text: Fabulously strong $5.00 margaritas, awesome guacamole and chips and a wonderful setting made this a great night out with friends.  Dinner was great too!

g_KW0Xtqj9t88uVH5loD9A.text: Great food. Good margaritas. Can't beat the view overlooking the gondolas. Reasonably priced.

ETZf3NomaeXngg1i1t0jqA.text: Yep this was a home run.  For apps we had chips/salsa, quest, guacamole, and flautas.  Then the classic Rita's.   I could not hold back and ended with 3.  Everything was tasty.   For the main course I had a shrimp, mussel, clam, fish seafood delight.   I have to say this was my best meal in Vegas and it was priced lower than the powerhouses.  Will hit it when we come back for sure.  Tip...come early or late or get a reservation.

XDvfeDRoHPJjzMkeZNUgoQ.text: Beautiful ambiance.  Of course I booked a table via Open Table and requested canal side table.   The Crab Cakes were probably the best I ever had.  The Tuna Tatare were yummy as well.  I will be definitely recommend and return on my future trip.

i6C_lzpUgfXLhyDMNsT2dw.text: Hmmmmm, HMMMMMM ya know what, I wanna give this restaurant an amazing review but it just don't sit right with me that you have to pay for chips and salsa at the table. Guacamole, I get that, that's always extra (amirite Chipotle?). Any sit-down Mexican restaurant should give you chips and salsa at the table, ESPECIALLY nicer ones like Canonita is trying to be. I payed for the chips and salsa because it's pretty necessary ($5 in case you were wondering), and they were just alright. The chips were great, but the salsa lacks heat completely.   It's the kind of salsa that is afraid to be salsa, afraid to offend the palates of as many people as possible. But brah, it's a Mexican restaurant, we need spicy salsa. At least like, kind of spicy?? If you can't hang with some heat, you shouldn't be at a Mexican place. I don't really get it. Canonita, please raise the damn heat above level 0 on the salsa. Also it should be free at the table. Pls.  I also ordered the chicken burrito. Was it $18? Yes. Did it taste like an $18 burrito? Meh. Don't get me wrong, it was tasty, but for that price that burrito should have everything and the kitchen sink in it. I wasn't wowed by the cilantro rice on the side either, that wasn't terribly flavorful. Chipotle does better rice, I probably should have just gone there instead. Sigh.

XBN8QNw1uoVoDbY4q_z7xw.text: The manager KATHERINE thinks she is doing the customers a favor when it's her job to provide customer service and she is just awful at it. Worst place i have been in Vegas so far!!! A manager who does not know how to manage. It's SAD. Do not even bother coming here!

6A6PZLQWx6djRksmH3Xarg.text: My friends & i came here an hour before closing feeling bad that we were coming so late & the staff was so accommodating! Our server was Jesus & he was amazing!! He recommended amazing drinks & food that we all loved. We got the Barbacoa, quesadilla, enchiladas & my friend who is vegan got vegan enchiladas! 10/10 would recommend to anyone looking for authentic mexican food in Vegas with amazing service! We'll definitely be back soon

nOG-59cuClT0Ga_6kPf9Sw.text: Had a great dinner at Canonita, right on the canal in the Venetian. Jean was a fantastic waiter, extremely polite responsive and informative.   Food was excellent, and portions were just right.  Upscale Mexican... Great atmosphere outside in the canal with the gondolas passing by.  Looking forward to the Bloody Mary/ mimosa bar Sunday AM!

eB4AqXrty5gOXVHE0rX0Og.text: Great spot for Mexican food in Las Vegas. Wonderful setting next to the canal in the Venetian, the service was impeccable, and the enchiladas were delicious. The prices were quite reasonable too. Don't forget to order a margarita, they were really good as well. I would highly recommend trying this place.

TZHtzXgjPCFoiQaMe-pdcQ.text: Nice area waiter was ok . Love the scenery love the guys singing in the water  need more enthusiasm from the staff make the customers feel like you want to serve them and like they are customers even if they are visiting from different locations .

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZZcJpSP24lfCrp9B_akoyg.text: Best margarita ever The margarita was tall, fresh and delicious. I'll get one to go. The food and atmosphere are great too. Mushroom enchiladas and tacos were great.

hAQmmZq9Wzc1NG6plW8Afg.text: The main reason to some here is the atmosphere, right on the canal. The downside, they secretly add up charges to your bill. A meal for one person was $70, not $$ level.  Issues: Fajitas order, no rice or beans; this is standard any any mex restaurant.   Asked about getting both Guacamole and some salsa, they said sure, they charged $14 just for that! After they brought the meal the offered to bring salsa, oh that happens to be another $1 on the bill at the end.  The you need more than 3 street taco sized tortillas, that's another $1 Save your self the overcharges and eat elsewhere

gRK0xfVqvRqi4VDQkVquCQ.text: Such a cute place, watched the gondola riders float by and be serenaded. Food could be better but the Venetian alone is beautiful, and the location is perfect for people watching and taking in the views. I'd visit again.

4JvJzvkuGM7SF-oVcIuEhg.text: Nice server nice location but food was really bland.  All three diners reported same thing.  Flavorless. I wouldn't return.

tytPo-Sf0JHnIERkSvB5jA.text: This place is located inside the Venetian very romantic spot right next to the gondola ride where you could look and hear them singing the pozole is really good the chicken tortilla soup is also really good. My honey had the fish tacos with black beans and cilantro lime rice very good very tasty fish and I had the braised beef enchiladas with black beans and cilantro lime rice I really did not care for it the sauce on the enchiladas was not all that great I had a drink an alcoholic beverage called the Red Kryptonite very very very yummy all in all

Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised beef enchiladas black beans and cilantro lime rice

2PmGB5b4hNpulUO0t-xjkQ.text: We come here every time we are in Vegas. It's a score if you get a table next to the canal!  Great food and service. We tried the happy hour drinks and they were smooth with a great price.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YVpepWSBZNpwC1HxCkPChQ.text: We enjoyed a great dinner at Canonita in the Venetian during CES 2018. The barbacoa pork was delicious and the sauce served with it was very tasty. I didn't care for the rice. The pitcher of margarita was pretty average and seemed light on tequila. Service was decent. Restaurant was a little noisy and crowded.

HsxxMMFqr0UTK9v4U1tEQA.text: One of the best casual meals I've had in Vegas.   I was wandering around killing time, looking for a Sunday brunch spot and decided to eat here in a whim. I was very pleasantly surprised.   Jesus, my server, was attentive, but not annoying.  I was indecisive with my order. I asked about the short ribs and he mentioned the chiliquiles. I love chilequiles and was not disappointed. They were exactly what I was craving.   The pomegranate margarita was wonderfully tart and very strong.   I was impressed with the fast, attentive service.   I will definitely return, and recommend friends go here.

jkFt-qYXmY47Heb35PoLvg.text: A great dining option located in the shops at the Venetian right along the canal.  Pretty standard Mexican menu offerings, but they are all of decent portion size and quality.  The chips and dip were tasty and fresh and the Quesadilla I ordered had great filling and came with a healthy side of beans and rice.  The service was quick and friendly and the ambiance of being seated next to the canal so you could see the gondolas go by added that much more to the experience here.

x6CkvvbJwyko-fKdENTgVQ.text: Came for lunch for a bachelorette of 6 girls. The food was so flavorful! Every bite was so tasty! This has to be my new favorite Mexican restaurant! Not to mention the view! Right on the canal inside the Venetian hotel. Our server Jesus was so attentive and very kind! Very sweet man.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qLjduq68T8fZlVeicDvXvQ.text: Omg this place is amazing amazing drinks to dessert food and service amazing I can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z8yZAiAFfzSU4ju0DKNP1w.text: First of all, you cannot beat the ambience of this restaurant. Even though you're indoors, you have the replica of a sky above you and gondolas passing by in the water next to you. Hearing the beautiful Italian songs while eating inventive Mexican Cuisine, helps you to appreciate the best of what Vegas has to offer.  We ordered the shrimp fajita, and the Ahi Tuna Crudo. The shrimp fajitas also came with a side of the cilantro rice. The shrimp fajita was more than generous with the amount of shrimp that you actually got. Full of lime, garlic, and lots of pungent peppers. The Ahi Tuna Crudo was covered in beautiful edible flowers, and had just the right amount of salt. They serve the Crudo with rosemary crackers, that are so filling they could almost be a meal on their own. The cilantro rice is the surprising star of the entire meal. It is so bright, and flavorful. I honestly expected only a hint of cilantro, but what I ended up getting was a True to flavor experience. If you are on the fence about whether or not you enjoy cilantro, steer clear. This is full flavor only.  I can safely say I have a new favorite spot the next time I come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Tuna Crudo*
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Fajitas

rxwcCCJkJUyy04_I0zj99Q.text: I wasn't looking for Mexican food in Las Vegas, but I walked by and told my boyfriend, "You know what? I could really go for some chips and salsa!" So we stopped in! I'm glad we did! Rico was our server and was a friendly face.  We ordered the chips and salsa appetizer with added guacamole. It was delicious!! The tortillas are made in house, so the chips were very light, crispy, and wonderful. The guacamole was seasoned very well with occasional chunks of avocado. The salsa had no heat to it whatsoever, but was very Smoky.  My boyfriend ordered a patron margarita that was very good.  I docked a star for prices. I know we are in Vegas and everything is more expensive, but I felt it was not clear on their menu that chips and salsa was $5 and the guacamole added was $9 additionally. It seemed it was $9 total for the guacamole, chips and salsa. I would come back just knowing what I am getting this time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips And Salsa

_Kfc6e1QvmOXsJ0qlzWzyw.text: Meh... Good, not great.   Girlfriends and I were starving after sitting out by the pool all day and we wanted to grab something quick. The menu for Canonita caught our eye, so we decided to check it out.  I feel personally victimized when I go to a Mexican restaurant and they don't rush over an order of chips and salsa. At Canonita, you need to place an order and they're not free - the nerve! But of course we were greedy and ordered the chips, salsa and guacamole as our appetizer. For my main entree I ordered the shrimp burrito. The flavors of the burrito were more Spanish style than Mexican. The sauce on top was on the sweet side and the burrito was  mostly filled with bell peppers, which I did not care for. I did, however enjoy my side of cilantro rice and black beans.  As far as service, it was alright. She did the bare minimum of taking our order and bringing out our food. No check ins or asking if we needed refills, etc.  Not rushing back here on my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Burrito
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and guac
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love the Vanetian

uElTTje4M7KPY-rEuM2Yxg.text: This is a fun restaurant inside The Palazzo! There are so many different shops, restaurants, and bars in The Venetian/The Palazzo (The Grand Canal Shopping Complex). After walking around for a bit, and looking on Yelp, we decided to try Canonita. I LOVE LOVE LOVE Mexican food, so we had to give it a try, and I am happy we did! The atmosphere alone was great. You can sit inside or "outside" on their patio, which is right next to the gondolas passing by in the water. The ceiling in this portion of the shopping center is painted in the sky, so you have bright colors opening up the shopping center. It's so relaxing and different, very delightful when having a meal with my hubby. I, of course, ordered the enchiladas, and my husband had their taco plate. I will drive to Vegas, just to have these enchiladas again. The tortillas were stuffed with chicken and drenched in their queso fresco. Holy bananas..... My mouth was in heaven, haha! I couldn't tell you if my husband enjoyed his tacos or not because I was in my own little world enjoying my enchiladas. I am sure he did because he cleared his plate and said they were good, but I looked like I was enjoying my food more than him. I do have to admit; I almost stabbed him with my fork when he tried taking some of my food! :) I eventually shared, and he finally understood why I was so happy. The only reason I didn't give the restaurant 5 stars was the service. It took our waiter some time to get our drinks from the bar and a very long time to get our waters. There were not a lot of people in the restaurant at the time, so on a slow day, I am not sure what the hold up was. Other than that we really enjoyed our time at Canonita. We will be back on our next trip to Vegas in a few months!

MELuO432zuUmeTg_lQZt6g.text: Was looking for Mexican street tacos so we decided to stop in here for lunch.    Location: Closer to the Venetian side of the mall. There's two entrances; one coming from the Palazzo side and one from the Venetian side.  They have 'balcony' seating so you can watch the gondolas as they float by and indoor seating.    Staff: Our hostess and waitress were efficient at getting us seated and getting our order out, respectively.    Food:  I ordered the fish tacos and hubs ordered the braised beef enchiladas.  The fish was tender and flaky with a lot of flavor.  The braised beef was also very tender and tasty.  We both loved the cilantro rice that came with our dishes (so much that we looked up how to make it).    Overall, great place to grab some food and watch the gondolas float by.

yq9llc8sFnFMiPFSU9uW8Q.text: We were just wondering around Vegas and stopped into the Venetian.  Always a good time!  This please is huge.  So huge it has its on canal with rivers with gondolas going up and down.    We were just looking for a nice spot to sit and watch the gondolas and listen to them singing as they went by.    Canonita was in the right spot and not very busy so we grabbed a table to have some drinks and small plates.    We order the margarita flight which had some pretty tasty versions along with the classic.  To have something to wash down with them we had the queso fundito.  Can't say it was the best I have ever had but it was good with the drinks.    Over all this is an OK place for sitting kind of outside to enjoy the ambiance of the Venetian and having some drinks.  The price is on par with Vegas which means expensive.  The queso was just OK so if the rest of the menu is similar would probably not come back just to have dinner as there are many more better options.  But not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. more margaritas !!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu - drinks!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita flight

0KQiKGImu1ZXvOodQgYIng.text: Finally tried this place out after 3 years. I have passed this place time and time again, and was uberly excited to be able to taste it. My fiance and I decided to check the place out during the week and the second to the last day for restaurant week.   Glad they decided to be participating as one of the restaurants in collaboration to supporting a good cause. I thought it was an awesome deal that they decided to do a 3 course meal. Instead of their daily menu my fiance and I both had the prix fix meal. Luckily they both had good options for all 3. We both ended up getting the Santa Rosa Barbacoa along with cilantro rice, beans, and fresh tortillas. I also got the Caesar salad, while the fiance tried the tortilla soup. Dessert, was a brownie sundae and churros with their sauce.   Wait time for everything was perfect and so was the service. Getting the salad proved that their portions would be generous. As soon as our barbacoa  plates came, ohhh how I was thinking that it was going to rock hard. Luckily, as soon as I took a slice it was soooooo tender, juicy and omg the best barbacoa I have tried thus far. The cilantro added a kick of spice to the meal. Definitely would recommend if you love this combo. The entree itself exceeded all my expectations that I cannot believe we waited this long to try this place. What made the cake itself was the desserts. Churros were hot and fresh and enough to share. They also were made to perfection not too cinnamony or sugary. As for the brownie sundae, this too was amazingly good. Felt light not to sweet or overbearing. Almost close to a flourless chocolate cake. Top it off with ice cream and it makes a home run!   Definitely Canonita has our hearts and we cannot wait to come back to try out the regular menu. Try the place out as you will want to come back. Thanks Canonita for the experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That huge chunk of barbacoa
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All proceeds helped out Three Square
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortilla soup

XkgLZ5JM92KhC5orT123dA.text: Always our first stop after we check in the Palazzo strictly for the taco sampler, guac/chips and a great glass (or two) of wine. Good service and great views keep this place in our Vegas favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco Sampler- Carne Asada, mushrooms

GxHtZiA9t_TnGfCE0tZHYA.text: We sat at the bar tonight and Javier was amazing! The drinks were on point and the food recommendations were so good! Definitely recommend the queso fundido and the crab cakes. Will definitely return on my next trip!

y0A4aAbfh7B5kAmdrH7ipA.text: This restaurant is indoors in the outdoor setting of the Venetian and of the Palazzo. It is a full-service restaurant and just outside of the entrance it has a "food truck ".   Today I ate from the food truck. Trust me, this is one truck you'd love to be stuck in traffic with!  I wasn't overly hungry so I went with two street tacos and I love that they used corn tortillas instead of flour. The roasted mushroom taco was my favorite! I also recommend the Mexican city street corn which tastes like it was just cut from the cob after a summer time grilling. You will encounter husk however, but that's the price for fresh ingredients I suspect.

Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w7wcK5SG35eAoOXa8H_NWQ.text: If you get an extra shot in your margarita beware it's $11 extra.  It would have been nice if i knew this beforehand. So after spending about $25 each on a small margaritas I'd say it wasn't worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G4sn3Nvt0P5ruIY-cuEZgw.text: Love the food, service, atmosphere, and most especially the drinks! I was expecting for an "okay" meal but left happily satisfied! The bartender here definitely knows how to make a mean Mojito!
