l5ZEdACNuLcXdIC6utTItA.text: Amazing food. Fast service and great environment. Great variety of main courses. Taste is right on point as well as preparation. Love this restaurant! Right next to the Gondola Rides

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Pork a la Michoacana.

T-FSvBLaMYjSSHNxbixyRg.text: If you get here relatively early on a Saturday or Sunday (and by relatively early I mean around 9 am) I guarantee you can find a nice table by the "canal" because majority of people in Vegas will still be asleep/hungover! That is exactly what we did and it was awesome! There really weren't that many people so it was quiet and relaxing, add on top of that awesome food and perfect service and this place is definitely one that we will come back to if we're ever in Vegas, at least for breakfast!   For our drinks we had just regular coffee and a cappuccino. Nothing special about the cappuccino but my husband really enjoyed the drip coffee. For our food we had the Braised Short Rib Chilaquiles and the huevos rancheros. We also requested a side of guacamole and at the end we got churros as breakfast dessert even though we were so full already. Seems they make everything fresh here, including their tacos and quesadillas so overall I just highly recommend this place. Of course our experience is only with breakfast and I cannot speak to other courses that they have.  On to the food. If you're hungry and want meat, you should get the Braised Short Rib Chilaquiles!! These were absolutely delicious and the portion size is humongous, honestly you could probably share it between 2 people. The Monterey jack quesadilla that comes with the huevos rancheros was a nice and unique touch, the eggs were perfectly cooked over easy and our side guacamole tasted fantastic (its $6 for the side guacamole by the way, just fyi, a little steeper than I thought it would be). The churros were also freshly made (upon ordering!) and while they weren't like the ones I had in Spain, they surely were delicious still. They weren't overly sweet which I really appreciated and enjoyed.   I think the only constructive criticism I have for this place is that they could try heating up their coffee cups and more so their plates before serving the food. The plates were cold (not for the braised rib dish as it comes in its own plate, but for the huevos) so it resulted in the food getting cold faster than it would have had the plates been warmed a bit. I think this would make a world of difference in a customer's experience, especially for those of us who eat slowly.  Also, our server Kim S. was so fantastic that I do hope a manager reads this review and gives her a raise or a bonus or something, because she absolutely deserves it. She never made us feel rushed, she gave us space but was also readily available when needed, and overall just a great person. It seems a lot of reviewers were happy with the service they received so it must be a restaurant culture thing, and they're definitely doing a great job with it! Keep up the great work!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised shirt rib chilaquiles - absolutely delicious and highly recommended. Huge dish, can be shared
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros and side of guacamole (extra $6)
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros! 3 freshly made pieces per serving

237r7d8Z2lguFmJeC6K23A.text: This is an updated review and sadly after this dining experience we won't be going back again.  Not only was the service less than stellar, the food was not worth the cost.  I gave this two stars because the margaritas are amazing and the house made guacamole was delicious but very expensive.  I still have no understanding why chips cost so much when at other places they are still free.  When we sat down the server appeared but he spoke so quickly that it was impossible to understand him.  We asked a couple of questions and I was sure that he understood while my mouth liked heat, my stomach didn't so I couldn't tolerate anything too spicy.  I ordered a chili relleno which normally is not at all spicy and the server took my order without batting an eye.  When the dish arrived, it didn't look like any dish of that name I'd ever had.  It was a deep fried roll on a bed of red sauce.  I took one bite and my mouth was totally on fire and I knew eating that dish would not be in my best interest.  While I like spice, this was bordering on hot pepper status.  I pushed it to the side and finally the server came to ask what was wrong and when I told him his comment, well it's probably because the pepper was picked in the winter and they are hotter.  I've never heard that before believe me.  He offered another dish which I declined.    There is no reason the dish should have tasted like that, it's typically a very bland dish.  Believe me we won't go back again

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting choices

L5BqHWqNrl2M7-4tdEwVfA.text: We stopped there after seeing O at the Bellagio. The restaurant is in the Venetian and is a sit down restaurant. Service was excellent as was the red sangria :) I had the corn flautas with cilantro rice and black beans. It was very colorful and was as good to eat as it was to look at. You can get a table overlooking the "river" and watch the gondolas go by.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

52m0dJPwz_YJy7jXD_1MPA.text: This is a great restaurant to relax and eat while shopping through the canal. I was seated alongside the canal and it was wonderful. I ordered the mushroom enchiladas and was very happy with my meal and the service. Alejandro was nice and attentive. I will come back with my husband as I was dining solo and this is definitely a place to enjoy with someone you love.

1icEbaw40VVyKZzPF9AmWg.text: We went here last Saturday after looking all around for a place to eat. The service was impeccable. I believe Cynthia was the name of our server. We had a party of 11 and she was very attentive to each one of us. I had the posole and beef enchiladas. The soup was amazing and the enchiladas hit the spot. They had generous serving sizes and the flavors were authentic. She even had the bartender make us micheladas which aren't typically on the menu. She also split the check amongst each of us with no problems. I highly recommend this cute restaurant for a great meal. I hope to come back to this place again and try some of their seafood options! Everyone loved their meal!!! Can't wait to be back

vPORyJQJbWcGeKLvwgWnuw.text: We were really craving Mexican and what better place than what we like on the Canal where you listen to singers on the Gandolas.  We ordered... Classic Margarita  Corona light Guacamole and salsa with chips Mexico Quesadillas  3 taco plate (pork, fish and mushroom)  Everything was fresh and tasty.   Our server,  Kim S was very helpful and attentive with a great personality.   Looking forward to next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quesadillas
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole,  salsa and fresh chips.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corona light and regular Margarita.

9btqI50jxWK578k8sD7J9Q.text: Lorrrrrdly lord, I was not prepared for the deliciousness I encountered while dining at this place (I actually ended up here more than once on my trip to Vegas).  Here's the breakdown of what we got, not in one sitting, but over the course of the couple times I've been here...   Caution - everything was delicious.  CHIPS, SALSA, GUAC: def a standard starter at any Mexican restaurant. I NEED my guac and theirs is pretty dang tasty! (Rating: 10/10)  QUESO: We added chorizo and house pickled jalapenos. My GOLLY I'm craving this right now. It was a little thick for my liking when it comes to queso, but it was still good AF. It also comes with some bomb flour tortillas. (Rating: 9/10)  PORK POZOLE VERDE SOUP: I'm a sucker for pozole and FML I loved theirs. Definitely add this to your list if you need a hangover cure. The pork was so tender, and it had a good amount of it in there. (Rating:10/10)  VAQUERO BEER-BRAISED SHORT RIB: If you like tender short rib, GET THIS. I'm drooling thinking about it. The creamy hominy acts like the typical mashed potatoes you'd receive with a short rib dish. It's on the heavy side, so if you want something lifht, I'd avoid it. (Rating: 10/10)  SALMON TORTILLA SALAD: I love a good grilled salmon salad. It's really their chicken tortilla salad, but we just subbed out the chicken for salmon. Highly recommend! (Rating: 10/10)  BREAKFAST BURRITO: If you need the perfect hangover cure, ORDER THIS! I was nursing an awful hangover and this was everything I needed and more. We ordered it to go, and they literally gave us a side of salsa, beans, etc. for each burrito. I think I walked out of there with (10) sides for the (5) burritos I ordered. Will be asking for less next time I'm there since the salsa sides are pretty big. (Rating: 10/10)  They also have this drink that comes in a coconut that's freaking delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork pozole verde soup - get this if you like pozole
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon tortilla salad (subbed the chicken for salmon)
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quest with jalapeño and chorizo!

PyQLZV5fk6scUYQrjBnIzQ.text: We had such a great experience here! I had the biggest craving for Mexican food and this place definitely satisfied it. The poblano enchiladas were to die for! Best of all, our customer service was GREAT... from the hostess, to our attentive/sweet server Cherri, to the friendly management. Well for sure be back. Oh not to mention, the cool view of the gondolas.

u5hODk_Q-RMqi3LI0l_6eA.text: I love this place so the low rating is a shame.  They changed their Chili relleno dish from a delightful special dish to a typical treatment. I hope they reconsider.   Otherwise it's a great choice for margaritas and casual Mexican when you're on the strip. It's on the canal for an "outside"dining experience when the weather doesn't cooperate. ..

dl0wJNzeAvAf2moNmTV9DA.text: Awful. We arrived and asked for a table next to the canal. They informed us that they were reserved even though they were empty. The canal tables remained empty through our entire meal. They charge 3 dollars for chips and salsa. Any Mexican place that charges for this is a joke. Especially when the entrees were $25 a plate. I had a salad that had some strange dressing that was OK. That was the highlight of the meal. Then they delivered some barbacoa with rice and beans. The rice was green and flavorless. The black beans were the same. I've had better seasoning on beans from a can. The barbacoa was tender, but the sauce was awful. Only salvation was to dip it in the bland ass hot sauce they provided. There was no heat at all in anything.

xctRUupKvhxoFlD09vksCw.text: The flautas were delicious. The jalapeno/pineapple Margarita was not my favorite. The following day, I tried the pork empanada with nopales salsa on top (appetizer). The green pozole soup is homemade and not from a can, both were exquisite. The service is friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Empanada

s6yUTAtoIzqyGGPG1S1l5A.text: I seriously don't get why this restaurant doesn't have more stars. This is easily one of the best Mexican food I've ever had. This place is soooo good!   The ambience was perfect and decor was lovely as expected since it's in the Venetian. I thought it was gonna be just your average Mexican restaurant but it was so much more than that!   I had the cheese enchiladas with cilantro rice and I can't even begin to say how delicious it was! It was too perfect for words.   I've had cilantro rice at a few other restaurants after that but it's nothing compared to this place! The portions are big enough to where you can have leftovers to savor for a late night snack!   A little pricy, I'll admit but well worth it! To this day I'm still raving about my amazing dining experience at this place! I'm definitely coming back the next time in Vegas!

Ueyp5KGJYCgE8gzZw-zD8Q.text: Eating here was a bit of a happy accident. Our group of six was on the hunt for a brunch spot and didn't want to spend upwards of an hour waiting for a table. We also didn't want to admit defeat and eat at Denny's. We started looking for lunch instead of brunch, saw that Canonita was nearly empty on a Saturday a little after 11 am, and decided to look no further. I had no great expectations regarding authenticity (I would have gone to Tacos El Gordo for that) but I was optimistic that our meal would be reasonably tasty. I was right.  As luck would have it, the special that day was a chorizo and egg burrito, so I got to have brunch after all. The massive, fork-and-knife burrito was served with cilantro rice and black beans. The beans were nice--mild and lightly sweet--and the rice had a refreshing quality about it. The burrito itself was very tasty (I mean, chorizo and egg, how can you go wrong?). My cactus margarita (made with puree of the fruit, not the paddle) was kind of dull . . . it could have been any margarita, really. My friends ordered a pitcher of some sort of pineapple infused margarita and that was a great choice. Incredibly sweet, but really good. No free table chips/salsa here, but it's Vegas so everything has a price. We ordered chips, salsa and guacamole and it was all very worthy.  Although everything was tasty I'd probably only award three stars if it weren't for the canal-side seating and the fantastic service. I recognize that we were one of the only parties dining at the time so attentiveness should be a given but the attitude was superb as well, particularly when we managed to spill not one but two beverages (and that was before we started drinking!).

4bL5A_M1omkBYVEBYhyHsg.text: I Love, Love, Love this place.  The ambiance is spectacular, I love sitting by the little river and as a real steak lover, this place is tied for the best Fillet Mignon that I've ever had in my life.  The other being at Bonefish Grill, believe it or not.  This place and Bonefish toppled my previous favorite and all are better than the renowned Smith & Wollensky in NYC.  I try to go back to this place every time I am in Las Vegas.

Ozk_SdN05uTJxlfULgBOlA.text: We weren't sure what to expect coming here for dinner before heading out to see a show, but we were pleasantly surprised! Our waiter was very attentive and had great food recommendations. We made an Open Table reservation and were seated by the canal with views of the gondola tours. The appetizers were great and so were our dishes. The portions were great, we weren't too stuffed for our show later that night. I ordered the Mahi Mahi dish and it was excellent! We also ordered the espresso flan and weren't disappointed. We will return the next time we are in Vegas!

rrIxqIA_B0iJg8vwoZfRxw.text: Margaritas and chips and guacamole. On the canals of Venice Italy... Aka Las Vegas :) I'm by myself and only order a little, but they gave me the best seat in the house and I was able to listen to the beautiful gondola singers the entire time.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TqJrGaOu9yuZMVj5HtTR5w.text: The best thing about this restaurant is the location. It's very relaxing watching and listening to the gondolas. But the food here is not very good. They say Mexico City cuisine but it's not even close. It's more like a cross between Mexico City cuisine meets American meets Tex mex. The food temperature was almost cold or barley warm. One person in our group is a vegetarian so as part of the 3 dishes he ordered, one was a Cobb salad minus the bacon. Their version is spinach with some shaved cheese and dressing. Last time I ordered a Cobb salad it has tomatoes, eggs, cheese, and a few other thing. We did order the flautas and empanadas as an appetizers.  The flautas were probably the best out of all of our dishes. The empanadas were ok but they had so much sauce in the serving bowl that they were soggy on the bottom. The stuffed chicken was oddly flavored with half the dish being very sweet and have more savory. Very odd. Lastly the staff was not very friendly at all.

FSEcoStGI04flRMVD5Xs2w.text: Three course dinner was DELICIOUS and a great deal! There are a few options. I got chipotle chicken soup, salmon with whole corn and plantains, and coffee flan. Yuummm! Hyder was so friendly and accommodating!

c30pdkiCzDu4Cy4817c9rw.text: Excellent service! Chips and salsa are great! Awesome atmosphere! You need to try the tacos!

My selection of green pozole was out of the world and hubby special order of salmon (the chef came out to take his specifications) this is what we call service!!! Highly recommend

Thank you Jesus for your recommendations! #CanonitaRocks #Canonita

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexico City Beef Enchiladas

ZqtZa0dCg4l8eb30xqQ2lQ.text: Went on a Thursday night with a reservation on OpenTable for 7. Got right in and the table was waiting for our table of 4. Liked the ambiance and atmosphere of the restaurant even though we were more to the inside. Chips were great as was my margarita. I ordered the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas, which had great flavor, but was a little more spicy than I expected (not a big spicy guy though). I think everyone in the group enjoyed their meal, but I docked a point for the service being on the slower side.

GHAHb2v2kByGmh_tI4gV3A.text: We visited Canonita back in April during an anniversary trip when we stayed at the Venetian.  We tried 6 of the Venetian restaurants on this trip, and this was one of two that we really enjoyed.  Our waiter was Jesus, and he was excellent!  He happily recommended menu items for us that turned out to be really great.  He was very attentive throughout the entire meal.  We had a seat right next to the canal, so if you enjoy the singing of the gondoliers, it's a nice environment.  They also have seats more inside toward the bar if you don't want to be near the canal.  Appetizer:  Queso Fundido - this was amazing!  We ordered it with chorizo, but I would probably order it with jalapeno as well next time to make it spicy.  It was served with fresh tortillas and we ended up requesting additonal tortillas for it.  Meals: - Wild Mushroom Enchiladas with poblano chili sauce, cilantro rice, borracho beans (pintos and corn). - Carne Asada Nortena with black beans, roasted cerranos and garlic, and sweet corn tamales. - Requested a side of fresh tortillas for this dish also since it was sliced up in a manner similar to a flank steak.  Both meals were presented very nicely and the food was great.  Dessert: - Tres Leches - very good!  We'll be back the next time we come to Vegas if for nothing else than to order the Queso Fundido again.  The only knock on it was that we had to keep requesting more tortillas because they were really small and we were charged each time we requested them.

vKypQ7CSVaGkm-Ye48VcyQ.text: I came here for breakfast around 8:30 while the rest of Vegas was mostly still asleep. The service was polite, prompt and attentive. I got seated at a table next to the canal and had a great view.   I had the breakfast burrito which came out within ten minutes of ordering and was decent. The portion was generous, it was a good mix of rice, potatoes, beans, egg and condiments. Then it was stopped with salsa like a wet burrito.  Four starts because the food wasn't amazing but it was good but the service was solid.

69lywnVIG-CstnvnGqDVzg.text: Yummy, tasty food, great service, and right along the canal under the Venetian's cloud sky!

IHs1PaYbQtiLAD0U_6ynbg.text: The just alright:  After a 14+ hour work day, we came here to get a quick meal before bed.  I wasn't too hungry, so I just ordered chips and guacamole.  The guac was serviceable and had a bit of a spicy bite to it.  Another coworker got the stuffed chile relleno, which she didn't even eat half of (said it wasn't all that great).    The very bad:  My other coworker got food poisoning after eating here.  He was up for hours later that evening puking his guts out.  (I'm pretty sure he got the carne asada.)  The moderately bad: This is a really annoying place to eat if you just want peace and quiet.  We were seated "outside on the patio" which really means "inside the building but they painted the ceiling to look like you're outside."  The gondolas go right by you, which I suppose could be a touristy thing to see, but it's painful when you've been working all day and someone boats by 2 feet away shout-singing in your ear.  All in all, I"d never go back here.

wMLpaxZ-jtQmOEw1Pe12VA.text: excellent customer service, food is super delicious and the price is better than eating in a buffet in Vegas. 5+ good job Canonita.

TYtRFkCyFqDttutN2OhXqg.text: Canonita I love you ! Thanks for the amazing food and great service see you next time ^.^

258Hbx0V92ilbqUlifEOpw.text: Although the waitstaff was excellent and environment was nice; just overlooking the gondola rides the food was quite sad.   They use the phrase soul food however there is definitely no soul in this food. The restaurants food didn't have any flavor at all; it was incredible plain.  I have tasted more flavor from the seasoning packets at the grocery store. I recommend you go somewhere else and save your money. The only thing delicious here are the chips.

KnLcprMPvFhKFyBLLDbHKg.text: Great service, good food and nice view...Very enjoyable. Had chips and salsa, spinach salad and chicken enchiladas. Very tasty and quick from order to table.

Xfoa3JFtNg2C5SrkM-nETA.text: Super delicious food. We lucked out with a super awesome server called Ashley who made some great suggestions for us. Everything from our drinks (Watermelon drink) to our mains, the Portabello with super nutritious and delicious greens, and the vegetarian Fajitas ( not on the menu, but suggested and organized by Ashley ) to the yummy dessert ( yes, suggested by Ashley!! ) At our request for less oil, they even delivered on that! :-)   I've been to this place before- two years ago and had a good experience. Glad to note, staff is still friendly and attentive, and of course food is great!

TBcDAZMrlN7HnaZlPxZJeQ.text: Stopped by for a dinner here in April 2017. What an ambience. We got a seat by the canal. The lighting, ambience and service was exceptional.   The food was good with the right amount of spicyness and flavour. The staff were very helpful as well.Had a great time with nice food and the singing from the men in Gondola rides.

IuUGte2PF59PkvMs1sv3EA.text: A couple nights ago my friend who is the Beverage manager at the Taqueria Canonita invited my friends and I to an event to celebrate the new concept and remodeling that had taken place here. I had been to the Canonita and the food had been good and the locale is in a prime spot for people-watching. Since it is right next to the Canal in the Venetian, you get to watch the gondolas go by while you sit at one of their tables "outside". Now the restaurant has been remodeled and it looks great. The changes are small and discreet, let getting rid of some paitings and adding more light fixtures, etc. But it really looks nice. They painted sectionsof the walls above the kitchen turquoise green and it brightens up the space. On the outside patio there are now umbrellas and little tables that lend it a casual and inviting scene.   They were serving ahi tuna on plaintain chips; the tuna was fresh and delicious. The pork empanadas, short rib on tortilla chip and the albondigas con papa were all very good, and very addictive. There was also a fried avocado with sesame seed (I think sesame seed) that was kind of like a Mexican tempura. The shrimp skewers were kind of difficult to eat the way they were placed on the stick, but were good also. They were served very interesting though, stuck into a big piece of pineapple. Cool presentation.   At the far end of the restaurant they had a couple of people preparing tacos to your liking; they offered carne asada, chicken, carnitas and a couple of different meats. I went with the carnitas, they were very good. They also had different toppings and salsas to add on as well. Oh and for dessert they had pastel de tres leches. Now, any of my friends will tell you that when it comes to dessert, although I have a tremendous sweet tooth, I am still kind of picky. I don't like flan, jello or anything that's too moist, like pastel de tres leches. However, I had been snacking on salty food (and plenty or margaritas) for two hours straight (thanks Alex!) and was open to try a bite for the sugar rush. I must say it was quite good, what won me over was the strawberry jelly. I would recommend you try it.   The food is is supposed to be Mexico City soul food, I don't know if the mean like cocinas economicas or what. I'm not sure if it's particularly chilango food per se, maybe they should add some huitlacoche, flor de calabaza, etc. But all in all the food is very good and quite affordable if you consider where the restaurant is located. As they say, location, location, location.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastel de tres leches with a side of strawberry sauce
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h5Dm0PmV-TL2mWap-wIwHg.text: This is always our first stop when we drive into town. Great margaritas! Tasty chips and guacamole. Taco sampler is awesome. You get one of each carne asada, chicken, carnitas, fish, and mushroom (my personal favorite). And the service is always top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pitcher of jalapeño margarita.

XlshWuCb9ont1vaJC9YeUw.text: Worst food ever! It's not about the quantity but the quality of food!!!The Tortilla with chicken soup was more like a tomatoes soup which was thick we had to ask for hot water to dilute it. IT'S REALLY SPICY!!!! Even The posole was really Spicy!!!Doesn't not have sour cream when it clearly states it on the menu and avocado used to come with the soup, but four small slices of avocado cost $4.50. Umm, breakfast is great,but not lunch the quality of food has gotten bad and low quality food then what it used to be. Horchata water taste really nasty taste like coconut, orange juice is out of a box carton, limeade  is not good and you pay $5.25 for each drink. Would not come back to this restaurant after being one of my favorite restaurant for the last five years in a row.

fJvhb9jRxjplWCKEEcwN1w.text: I was surprised to find a Mexican restaurant in the middle of an Italian styled/themed atmosphere. We rushed on over to be seated right away!   We were seated immediately right by the river so we got to see/experience the Gondola's float by as well as listen to the amazing songs of their driver. Luckily we arrived during happy hour and was recommended by our waiter to try their margaritas; so I ordered one while my boyfriend stuck with water and Sprite. It didn't take long to get our drinks either; I'm a super fan of speedy and professional service. =)  Dishes: I ordered the Mexico City beef enchiladas and my boyfriend ordered the Carne Asada Nortena. Our appetizer was the pork empanadas. Dessert was their famous tres leches. Everything was divine! The cilantro rice was flavorful and the carne asada was rich and tangy. Yum yum yum!  Only downside is the location of restrooms; it's by the food court. It's not a bad/far walk but kinda strange. The food though was excellent, the service was quick, and the ambiance was fun and relaxing. If we're in the area again, we'll be back!

Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork empanadas

P1XTLNdQOVrU9nJxShrqsQ.text: Enjoyed the pork tacos very much! I have a high gluten intolerance and the wait staff were really helpful and considerate of my food issues! The guacamole and chips are a must and margarita topped it off nicely! Ask for a table by the canal, makes for great people watching while you dine.

LOqNSJj3P0rmGxg9_56LNQ.text: I am a big queso fundido fan and this was the best I had in Vegas, with added jalepenos and chorizo.    Enchiladas were ok, not spicy at all despite their label.  Excellent tequila drinks.    I got a seat right next to the gondolas, which was beautiful, but the awful singing was annoying.

OHNFwcjkxuTUKl_jeLp4Sw.text: Great quality food - I just didn't like the "reduction" aka Barbecue sauce but other than that the food is great.  The servers here are knowledgable about Mexican cuisine and are fantastic.

GIJkMMMb0l1c_Hn1XZeSHg.text: Awesome ambiance! Right on the water in the grand canal shops at Venetian. We were here last night and got a seat right at the railing of the water, it was stunning. Service was superb, attentive but not overly in your face. Food was excellent but I thought overpriced for what it was, but it is the Strip so to be expected.

D5-KpBSwv6icU4OTlgxlhQ.text: Delicious!   A nice flight  of tequila  to start things off. Very hard to choose what I wanted, menu is great. Went with the mahi and it didnt dissapoint. My friend got the pork in Chipotle  bbq sauce with rice and beans which was just as good.  Lovely setting as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi!

uEVvuUOrbFEh34qeVzqeyQ.text: I absolutely love this place. The location is just right, since it sits right by the canal inside the Venetian. You get to admire the gondolas and hear then singing. Our waiter Jesus, was just amazing. He helped us make the perfect selections. The mojitos are the best, highly recommend, which our waiter Jesus recommended and he was right. The food was just incredibly delicious, I did not want to leave any behind even though I was extremely full already lol. Will be back to visit.

_qrF9J2ZWZ0KpVrY838VLA.text: Food was amazing! Super delicious, wonderfully prices and great porky on sizes. A little upset the meal didn't come with chips and salsa but other than that I love this place.  The biggest issues that I had was with the hostess. Upon entering the restaurant I was told rudely that "UM YEAH WE DON'T ALLOW OUTSIDE DRINKS IN HERE SO THROW THAT AWAY NOW". If she had simply informed me politely that they didn't allow outside drinks that would have been fine but she pretty much went out of her way to make a scene. When I finished my drink and was seated with my party the ENTIRE night she kept motioning and pointing to me, telling the wait staff to keep and eye on me and kept shorting me dirty looks and shaking her head. A shame that the hostess really ruined a great meal for me and my party...just remember: it's not what you say but how you say it!

XtzYOyu4yw4x901bOrMtoQ.text: We went here for happy hour drinks and appetizers. The drinks and food was decent. However, the reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because of the terrible service. We had an awful waiter who was not polite at all and not good at his job. He messed up our checks twice, did not communicate prices or specials well, and took forever to come to our table even though there were barely any people there. Do not recommend this place.

zvCKlDzVYfTaPt8l1cTjGQ.text: Great meal here and very convenient if you're a guest at Venetian. Ate dinner here. We had the chips, salsa and guacamole appetizer - good portion, we brought the leftover chips back to the room to snack on later. Standout appetizer is the mussels and shrimp with chorizo. I think we only had two pieces of shrimp but the mussels were generous and the chorizo sauce was amazing. The dish needed more bread to soak up the sauce. My boyfriend had the pork barbacoa and said it was delicious. Would definitely return.

vaoGFycG3AW8olFK1ZfmAw.text: This fun spot has seating right next to the canal so you can see the live  serenades taking place in the gondolas, it's kind of amazing people watching.  We only stopped in for a snack of chips, salsa and guacamole (which was amazing, I had to restrain from licking the bowl). The service was great, I'd go back just for the people watching!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xzRLI6A6WK3GtcsnxilBTQ.text: Located in the heart of the beautiful Venetian !!!Very nice atmosphere and good service. You can sit by the canal and enjoy the view and listen to the Gondola singers. Waitress was sweet,she explained a lot of things to us. Food came out fast but it wasn't as expected. Was on the spicy side and gave us acid burn but it was a good experience to try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View :)
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi-mahi
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Muscles

hEU2L2fcRHoOzmYPks7Hhg.text: Really pleased with this visit. Food was amazing. Every dish we ordered was superb. The drink also spot on. We had a table of 6. The waiter was also very helpful. Overall it was an amazing time. I will definitely repeat. If your looking for some great food and awesome service this is your spot.

9brGorKBLcLFkmtGDNNPLw.text: Was looking forward to eating here because it had decent reviews but the food was very bland. The shrimp and calamari cocktail appetizer had 2 pieces of shrimp and calamari the rest was just tomatoes. Waste. The enchiladas didn't have cheese and were completely bleh, same with the rice and beans. Left more than half of my food on the plate. The only thing that was good were the flautas! You'd probably be more satisfied ordering room service.

3c6eHfhod0yZYkoDyCQkDg.text: Great service, Alejandro (our waiter) was amazing. Truly made it a wonderful experience, not to mention having a beautiful view of the Venetian Gondolas. The food was also delicious. Highly recommended this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious meal! Definitely coming back next time I&#39;m in Vegas. Highly recommended!

mFz8hRkj2JJmszFNL5JHEw.text: My taco sampler was satisfying. My favorite was the chorizo taco. The Vaquero beef rib and Santa Rosa Beef Barbacoa all looked delicious, but not worth the price. The chicken burrito was on the dry side with not much else inside the burrito,

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco sampler. The chorizo taco was the best out of the rest

AVO7aHmucMGHGIs5VZa3-g.text: This restaurant is overall really good but not excellent. We ordered a margarita pizza which was good, the gnocchi al fromaggi (pretty awesome), the angel hair with basil, tomatoes and marinara sauce and all of these were really good. But once my father, a meat lover who knows a lot about meat, ordered his oysters and after that the ribe-bye steak, it was another story. The steak was asked to be cooked "Rear//Red//Bloody" and came "Well done" with baked potatoes that were cold and hard as rocks. Also, the oysters were good but some of them weren't fresh and were stinking really bad. Hence my 4 out of 5 star rating.  My advice - Stay in the pure Italian register such as pizza/pasta and you'll be more than happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angel hair del pomodoro as they call it I believe and one word to describe it: DELICIOUS! I never had such wonderful angel hair.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters, good but some were not fresh and we had to return it.

aNONugkG7_wfktgOiW8jNA.text: Went here on a first date, decent food, friendly attentive staff, beautiful view of the water way, and perfect temperature to exs pace the Vegas heat.   Only downside, difficult to locate

dX3lnuoYSB71I6XV_DHX8g.text: Very good. We had a nice breakfast. Away from the normal casino heavy eating. This was well priced and not super busy. We were unsure at first but very glad that we ate there. I would recommend this establishment. Eat well.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros

JHJhos-6t7nyoMMC9Ewr4A.text: Nice location but Service was very poor. Ordered chilaquiles but food looked like some of it was missing.

ykZ_K0Zmv_J2Yf_MK9vlyg.text: Review #700, I'm taking it on the road! Canonita is well worth the trip. Of course, if you're staying at The Venetian, it's as close as the gondolas.   Came here for a party and was delighted from the word 'Go'. Mind you, I kinda stopped with the Mexican food thing because it's so often so mediocre (and that's in any city). And, truly, not the healthiest. But Canonita blew up both of my prejudices.  * Margaritas. Yes, very tasty and potent without knocking me over. Enjoyed the balance of sweetness to citrusy tartness. Mmm. (And they gave us cups for when we later taxi'd off to Karaoke.) * Chips and guac. The chips were tasty, with just enough crisp and just enough salt, and certainly no oily residue. The guacamole was damn good -- thick and tasty, without a lot of mysterious ingredients. Straightforward and delish.  *Filet Mignon was my choice (could have also gone for Salmon or a chicken dish). Lovely 8 oz I think was the weight. Don't bother requesting a temp for your meat, because the kitchen really doesn't think know what's best. Happily, we were of the same mind in term of heat: Medium Rare and loving it. Wonderful flavors that I frankly can't recall (I mentioned the margaritas, right?). If you at all interested in steak, this is a worthy choice for your entree.  I must say the dessert was fine, but anticlimactic. Really not necessary. However, I did have a brownie sundae which definitely didn't hurt anything - except maybe my waistline.  Service was pleasant and attentive without being all over us. Water was refilled as necessary, which for me, is fairly often.   Overall, I was most surprised that the Yelp reviews seemed so unenthusiastic. I would absolutely recommend Canonita, and if you do sit 'outside' by the gondolas, you don't even notice them. Gracias! Muchas gracias!

gr6VwaAKlROLmOpyWpp1kw.text: The good is really good. Hubby and I staying at the Venetian resort. We had a show at 8pm so decided to eat in the hotel after. This place hit home. The guacamole was awesome. Chips were a but yo heavy for me but tasty.  Salsa was good. Chicken burrito was good with the cilantro rice I was happy with u choice. Hubby had some pork which he ate all of.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P2WEXaslvZPHtyVrhQfuIA.text: Pros: great views of canal & blackberry mojitos  Cons: terrible & poor quality food. We had the flight of tacos & instead of putting different toppings (e.g. Sliced cabbage, lettuce, etc), they got lazy & put diced onions across ALL of the tacos.  I've eaten here previously & loved the tacos. Now, I don't even want to return. The chopped salad was also not fresh & we were convinced the chicken was going to give us food poisoning. Meat just shouldn't smell or taste like it was made last week.  Lastly, the server put the wrong order of tacos on our table & had to swap it out while we were mid bite. Overall, just a horrible experience. We ended up going to Chipotle around the corner & happily munched on food that wasn't going to make us sick!  I did NOT come to Vegas to eat at Chipotle, but that just shows how bad this place was.

m5QyF0A-z5Cof7VLJRfQCQ.text: Very good. Great server! Very reasonable, we were on the patio and over saw the gondolas. The chips were the best I've had, hot and fresh and great salsa! The beef tacos were very good.

OzRRHrMgFowgI5poxJWLig.text: We had our wedding reception here and it was amazing. Our table was right on the canal and easily sat  15+ guest, the food was incredible, and the service was great. My wife took care of all of the planning and she had nothing but high remarks for coordinator handling our event. The food was incredible. When all was said and done guests are still talking about the guacamole and short rib. The next time I am in Vegas we will stop here to have dinner again. Vegas in my opinion is full of over rated fluff food but Canonita is a great place that won't break your budget and isn't stuffy.

Pidf83ur5cWkoE_EYDq08Q.text: This is the best place to go when you are in Vegas. Best margaritas I have ever had! We have been coming to Vegas for the past 4 years and service just gets better every year. Food is amazing and drinks are even better. Alex and Kelli at the bar are the best bartenders out there. Always friendly and professional. This is our home away from home and every time we are in town we just can't stay away from this place.

5ZqbexYevkKbhjxSVzXoRw.text: Alex was the best we've had in Vegas. Very personable and friendly! Scorpio! Go Colts!

nq83TMGu4soXoC_2_G48Lw.text: Great atmosphere, but terrible food.  Ordered the chopped salad and it was just a plate of lettuce basically. Had to request items to add some flavor (cheese, lime) because it was so flavorless. Another person at our table had the same thing and same feeling. Notified both the waiter and the manager and they offered a different food item, but by then we had eaten it anyhow (we were starving).  At that point, we wished we'd just gone to Chipotle because $13 for a bad salad is a bad bet. So many good places to eat in Vegas. I'd skip this one.

GtmlkWsmyP44CijO1S1XXQ.text: Went here with a group of girls on a business trip. Very good food!  I got the chicken enchiladas which were excellent. Great guac too :)). Our waiter was friendly and attentive too. The agave margarita was a bit sweet but other than that no complaints :))

awsZ7HKX2uBZVCEZJj8cCw.text: We went for breakfast and it was great!! can't beat the ambiance and the bottomless mimosas and bloody mary station were very cool. my husband had the breakfast burrito and I had the eggs Benedict special.  both were delicious!! would definitely go back!

t-cDCOtwI4mweBSPRSnnxw.text: We have a great time eating and drinking at the bar, the friendly bartender treat us like high roller, thanks to Armando for the great service. Fully recommend it. Don't forget to ask for Mole.

rMsQpLMZUoBjlO9du9okBw.text: Insanely good Flautas!!!!!!!!!!!! This place is in the Venetian and was incredible. It kind of just looks like a Mexican bar by the shops, but it is a fantastic restaurant.   Obviously I had the flautas and they were soooooo good!!! The sauce was like nothing I have ever tasted before and I hope I can find a place in Arizona that has something remotely close to it.   My wife had the tacos with chicken, rice and beans. Everything was delicious!!! I could not believe how much good food we got for the price and their drinks were just as good.   This was the number one surprise find for me after a week in Vegas. There is even seating alone the river area passing through the hotel giving you the sense that you are out side by the river in Italy.

pb4HGvIVewDNLHDdW0BWTQ.text: Good mexican food. Little noisy but thats expected that location. The service eas good and the entreys is recomended. If you want to eat at the strip go here.

1Bw4ldfTnHzL0PLqlvA1kg.text: This place was great. It is inside the Venetian. We sat at a table in the bar area, which over looked the gondolas going by.  The drinks were strong and tasty. The chips were yummy and the guacamole was some of the best I have ever had in my life!  Our server Danielle was fun and terrific and made the whole experience memorable. We will definitely be back.

l_XYM8PiS5zeBdPsKuf0cA.text: I'm bumping 3 star food up to 4 stars for a fun drink menu, liberal pours, and great location.  You're in the middle of the grand canal shops, many of the tables overlook the water filled canal with an italian restaurant across the way.  The host and waitress were friendly, and while service was not the most attentive, I was in no rush.  The guacamole was okay.  Not great... it was missing some lime and salt, but it was good.  I had the chile relleno, and was no too impressed.  The pepper and cheese filling were good, but the breading was way too thick and oily.  There was very little sauce, and it did nothing to curb the thick crisp breading on the chile, so it was kind of like biting into an airy cracker or cookie with every bite.  Taste was there, but just an odd experience.  The tres leches was pretty good too... but I remember trying it last time I was here two years ago and loving it.  I don't know if my tastes changed or the tres leches changed, but it was a bit disappointing having built it up in my mind only to be presented with an average dessert.  If you're dining in a Venetian/Palazzo canal shop restaurant, you shouldn't be concerned about the price, you know it's going to be expensive.  But I was fairly surprised the bill was so low for a couple drinks, guac, entree, and dessert.  As I started out the review by saying, you're getting pretty good food, decent prices, and it's a great setting to have a few drinks and sit back to people watch.

9ZMjZlbakyXZADn68FFwFQ.text: Very tasty food. I had chicken burrito and it came with rice and beans. The burrito was really tasty. I would come back here and get it again.  Also ordered taco sampler and I tried the beef taco and it was very tasty too. Good food! Not a bad price either considering the size of portions and the taste! Oh and the chips and salsa was great too! Ill be back!

a205sZ-uwdN0JjiNAn-T6Q.text: Excellent Mexican food! Ordered the chorizo gorditas (delicious! Didn't leave anything in the plate) tortilla soup was great! Don't order the green pozole, is bland nothing a can soup can't satisfy. The reason I didn't knocked them a star is because our waiter was kind enough to take back and bring me some beef flautas, they were the best I've had in the US. The great thing is that I never return food back because I hate the attitude they can give you, our server noticed I didn't eat it and offered himself to get me something else and came back to check on me. Overall great food and great service, I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flautas and chorizo gorditas

AvlLrivyHfa3Y4kb8e7Uvg.text: Second time I've had dinner at Canonita at the Venetian.  Great location right along the "canal" with the gondolas going by.  Excellent margaritas and awesome sangria.  Highly recommend ordering both and sharing.  Our table had an assortment of food and all was great.  Good spot for vegetarians and vegans as well.  Honestly can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Smart staff will gladly assist you if you have dietary restrictions or just need help picking something.

3lAXcMTTRWGfLd0d3P2S9g.text: Soooooo gooooooood. The mussel shrimp app w sausage on a hot cast iron skillet has almost a Spanish flare. Really tasty. The pork carnitas burrito is excellent. The ceviche tostadaaaaaaa. I could eat two of those and make it my dinner. Service is great.

9t0hmEctwSbVeEYthwjNSA.text: I worked with the staff to host a Birthday party for my wife.   The planning and delivery could not have been better.  We picked a selection of entrees for dinner.  Provided appetizers and the choice of drinks.   The restaurant even had cards printed up at each place setting so folks knew what was available.  (What a supAs soon as we were seated the waiters and waitresses began taking orders and bringing out the drinks.  Fabulous margaritas!    The evening manager made sure to come over and introduce himself.  Told me to let him know if we needed anything.  Before leaving, the waitress even climbed a chair to take the big group picture.  She looked at the results on the iphone and decided it wasnt good enough so she kept taking picture after picture until it was perfect.  Overall a fabulous time.  It has always been the "go to" restaurant for my wife and I on our Vegas trips and will remain so!

FcdfGnnxvV7vHtK8GBH86Q.text: This is a shout out to Roberto, who's an excellent server.  He made the dining experience a 5 star. The food is really good. It's not out of this world but it's perfect for what it is. The foods temperature and timeliness was right on. But Roberto was exveelent

sfThl1nvAHUhmmNcPsb_Ag.text: Love the drinks, especially the delicious Coco Pina and Mojioto flight . View of the canal and singing gondola guys is great. Hyder was our server twice (we visited here often during our weekend stay in Venetian). He was awesome and a True example of the classy and courteous people that work at the Venetian!

gj3hZNeEAX6Lg5Vo17P5kw.text: The manager reached out to me and remedied the situation from my previous review. Impressed with the customer service, updating to 5 stars :)

swgGEfKyV6EJfK7tMTDW4g.text: This place was super convenient to go to since I was staying at the Venetian, our waiter was timely and on point with the recommendations for drinks and food. I had whiskey and the pork chop which was exactly what I was in the mood for. We had seating along side the gondolas so it was a nice and relaxing evening. The setting was great and they served us in a timely manner. I will definitely be coming back here for drinks and to try something else on their menu because everything looked delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O70N_FSBVRUC_RChbwGbgg.text: We stopped here for dinner one night while visiting in Las Vegas. The restaurant is located by the gondola canal in the Venetian, so it was a nice view from our table. For drinks, I ordered the sangria de Rojo which is just sangria mixed with margarita. I could only stand to drink two sips because it was soooo tart. I usually love my drinks more on the tart side but this was just too much. My husband ordered the margarita flight and seemed to enjoy it. We ordered chips and salsa for an appetizer. The salsa was pretty good but the chips were way too salty. On the plus side, both of our entrees were great! I kept it simple by ordering chicken quesadillas and my husband had the mushroom enchiladas.  Overall, it was just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita flight. I would recommend just ordering the Pineapple infused one. Didn&#39;t like the regular margarita or jalapeño margarita.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria de Rojo .... wayyyy to tart
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadilla

DsmuS23fDIXy_sZDblQi1g.text: One of the most romantic places to dine on the canal in the Venetian shops while watching and listening to the gondola rides go by. Excellent Mexican food that will satisfy all types of pallets with a variety of traditional and unique flavorful dishes.  Highly recommend the Tuna Ceviche Tostado with cilantro topping for an appetizer. Its so fresh and spicy. Also a must get is the Santa Rosa Pork Barbacoa which just falls off your fork and melts in your mouth with barbecue sauce.  Another favorite was the wild mushroom enchilada. I also got the Coco Pina drink served in a cute coconut shell which was amazing too.  The service was excellent and the ambiance was great. Will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pescado Veracruz
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice place to watch the gondolas go by
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chiapaneco Salmon with plantains and Mexican corn

3aT8ugoOm7-mzmevpGxlrg.text: If you visit Vegas, you should definitely try this restaurant in Venetian Hotel. You get river side view with music in background. The ambience is nice and cosy. We tried the chips with guacamole & omelette with veggies with fresh juices in their breakfast menu. Everything was super nice and the service was great.

MOanpHaKay02QPvAq5kaoA.text: What kind of Mexican place doesn't have chips and queso? Now, don't get me wrong, I liked the queso thingy they had with flour tortillas fine.  But I wanted tortilla chips and queso.  I'm used to chips and salsa coming free in Mexican restaurants too - not here!   Fajitas were tasty and my friends tacos were good too.  I had some mild heat stuff going on so was practically main lining water and the dude kept up pretty well.  Food came out fairly quick and I loved the ambiance being sat at a table by the water.

qgAR1rwrjXBR0EEwFPtmeg.text: Tip: get a couple wedges of lime to squeeze over the pork barbacoa and cilantro rice. Makes it a flawless entree.  Seating was a bit weird as they had several open tables and instantly seated the person who walked up seconds before I did and was also solo, yet I was asked to wait for 30 minutes. Oh well. I walked around browsing shops and sampling gelato.  When I was seated service was pleasant and helpful. I seemed to have to waiters but the gentleman who helped me was very pleasant and suggested the pork barbacoa, even when he knew I was considering a more expensive dish. Plus one star for integrity!  I ordered chips and salsa. A very inexpensive appetizer and I devoured them with joy. Chips were ultra fresh and the salsa had a gentle spice and was tasty.  When the pork arrived it came with warm and supple corn tortilla, sides of rice and black beans. The rice had plenty of flavor but was a hair drier than I prefer. The beans were simple and perfectly cooked. I loathe an undercooked bean and black beans are almost always served that way so I was very pleased.  I urge anyone to ask for a couple lime wedges with this meal. The pork was amazingly falling apart tender and the chipotle BBQ was satisfyingly complex. The squeeze of lime over it offset the "dry" spice pallet of the BBQ sauce and made the pork flawless.   My only regret was my dinner was so delectable that I no longer have room for the gelato I was eyeing. Ah well. There's always tomorrow! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very tender pork barbacoa! Ask for lime wedges to perfect the flavor:)
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The inside of barbacoa. Falling apart tender! So delicious w/the chipotle BBQ sauce. Thanks to the waiter for steering me to this!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbacoa, very lovely chipotle BBQ sauce. Rice was okay, beans were simple but pleasant. Meat was delightfully tender.

YncRXJRIEKk22TPkzKIpQg.text: John our waiter was exceptional and super helpful in picking our dishes! The food was good and the ambience was great!

dYw59wsP_j_iYLB1lYpvMQ.text: Food was just not good I have never been to a "Mexican restaurant that serves white rice" but anyway I guess that's where this soulless restaurant comes in. I ordered the chicken mole and it was undercooked the only good thing about that dish sadly was the veggies. My waiter was very pleasant on a positive note chips and guac are good I also saw after eating my meal that the couple next to us had returned an appetizer for not being good. I will not return again neither would I recommend this place even if they're starving...

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken mole

y0tRAqqGU-FDRLNaIU3Q1Q.text: If you need a go-to place to be when you're staying at the Venetian and you enjoy Mexican cuisine (and drinks) the. You come right down here next to the canals.   Javier- the man of the hour. He did such an amazing job making us feel at home and being so hospitable. He is an honorable man.   The wife and I got the Mexican Chopped Salad for lunch and it was so fulfilling.   The chips and salsa - on point.

yaRaXTd8Cjjqx00ZQs1s6Q.text: Great food and service. Thank you Jonathan you were awesome. Enchiladas were flavorful and the queso fundido with chorizo was just right!

01lGzYtEs8SbyQKH39o3dQ.text: I have been coming to Canonita for over a decade. This is the first time where I could not walk in or reserve a table. On three separate nights we were unsuccessful. All this was due to private parties. The hostess just stared at us and shrugged her shoulders.

vmVecm2bX7TrM2HjdS3n5A.text: This is Vegas so maybe we should expect less.  Regardless it took forever to get our 3 taco plate and when the order came out it was wrong, that was a bummer.  The kitchen staff was quick to apologize but we just got put back in the order line and had to wait all over again.  The waitress apologized and the food eventually came out.  It was good but not great, even if had come out right he first time i probably wouldn't be back.

Me-_ceDQKrAJWVgx46FT1Q.text: We made reservations for a Friday night. Wasn't needed but we were able to sit by the canal. I am so glad I didn't read the reviews before. The entire experience was wonderful, from the margaritas to dinner to the desert. Service was nice. Maybe a little pricier than some places but considering the location it was expected. We would definitely come back next time in Las Vegas.

H6a0auSvXAboS3JyBaOVSg.text: The worst service I have ever seen.  The manager "******" does not give this place justice. This is a highly rated place but when it comes to understanding customer service she is the worst.  We had a group meal. We all ordered.  The waiter brought our the meal and we realized he made a mistake. They have to put the order in. We wait and wait and wait.  By the time the meal comes out everyone else has already completed eating.  We then tell the manager we do not want the meal.  She says okay but persist on charging us for the meal because we were in a group.    Manager. How do you charge someone for a meal they did not eat.

QJ23LY1umxNPGLFD0OynYg.text: This place is the best, the manager, the servers and of course the bartenders!!! Armando is one of the best bartenders I've ever know. He always has a smile in his face and his service is exceptional!!!! I really recommend this place for everyone!!!!!!!!

LmyVSrQmnsLFuF5HGks2QA.text: DO NOT COME HERE. Worst manager ever. Katherine should not be in the hospitality industry. Food came an hour later and cocktails came 25 minutes later and it was not even busy. She kept saying "we accommodated you" as if we are doing them a favor. It's hilarious. We have a $1,500 minimum and she did not even bother to let us know where we are at money wise when i already asked three times and when she's very much aware that we are there for the minimum as per contract. Bill ended up over 2k for such a lousy service and lousy manager. Such a turn off!!! Do not waste your time nor money. Worst decision in Vegas ever.

wpQMLGq7Zum-fiXOeFl4ig.text: Love love love their mole chicken enchiladas. They are not on the menu but I asked if they can make it with mole and they were so so good. Chips, salsa, guacamole were the bomb. They have a good happy hour. $4 beers and $5 fmixed drinks that had a good amount of alcohol. Very nice scenery on the patio.

g7FUN7LrQSsOamLNlrfkKQ.text: Very very disappointing experience. My cousin had been planning his proposal to his fiance for months. As locals, there are tons of cool places to plan such a special night. After weighing out his options he decided to pop the question on the gondolas in the Venetian and have all of our friends and family wear "will you marry me?" shirts on the patio of Canonita and to enjoy dinner there afterwards as part of the surprise. Due to it being such a large party (20 people) he made sure to make the reservation and explain the situation multiple days in advance. Upon our arrival, we executed the plan as explained over the phone, briefly took group photos and took our seats. As we went to sit down there was only seating prepared for 16 people, not 20 as expected and the seating for the 16 was all split up and not even together. The 4 of us who did not end up having seats (2 of the 4 being the newly engaged couple) looked around confused and due to their being plenty of open tables decided to just take a seat at the next closest vacant table to the rest of our party. Within a seconds a waiter walked over and slammed a "reserved" sign down on the table we were sitting at and rudely told us we needed to move. He did not offer an alternative table or any help and we were really caught off guard. Luckily another waitress came over and helped us to another table. Our waitress was good and attentive once we were finally settled in and our experience was starting to be ok. Just as we all got our food and began to eat, the manager, katherine keuling came over, interrupted our meal and informed us that they would be charging us an additional $15 per person due to our group photo taking too long before we sat down.....? We were taken by complete surprise and felt as if not only were we fast with the photos but were confused as to why she would wait until we all had began eating to come over and inform us of this. We were extremely offended for the second time during our visit on what should have been such a special night for our family. We ended up just getting up and leaving with most of our food and alcohol untouched. Our waitress missed out on a 20% tip on a $1,000 bill due to her rude colleague and careless manager. We will be sure to spread the word about our experience to our other friends and family that live here in town and enjoy dining out. Absolutely unacceptable.

lDFyxjuEy2Cgt5RCRP73Og.text: We came here for the 1st time. Every dish we ordered was fresh and delicious. Friendly staff excellent Mexican food and drinks.  They have GREAT margaritas! Love this place. Patty was our server and she was incredibly sweet, personable and knowledgeable.  This place is great! I will be back next time I'm in town!

fAeZaczeRePz-WYQZPCGfQ.text: Food: above average (pozole soup, pibil empanadas) Drink: n/a Serv: average speed Music: average (the gondoliers some times sing and this is right on the canal) Price: average Other: good location and not overly pricey

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JUjo4Vy0ppqHJXue7N957A.text: Don't be fooled by the great location! Poor customer service from the management. Totally forgot my buddies B-day and gave us wrong drinks. When I brought it the the manager's attention he tried to give us a discount and blame us for ordering the wrong drinks instead of just correcting the mistake his waiter made. Won't be back and they should learn to treat their customers better! To be honest the discussion with the manager screwed up our night.

2tcx0pVIRsDaW3dGmpxFKg.text: We ate here last Saturday night.  We were really disappointed in our meals.  The service wasn't great, either.   I think the location is what is keeping this place in business.

1toAiuDJjpDjohNmCP4gEQ.text: my friends and i stopped by after being recommended to go there and right away we realized the service was horrible. multiple tables were seated after us and they received not only their food but checks before us. in between our dishes the waitress took over 35 minutes and once we ordered came back to tell us 30 mins later that a certain dish was not available. i have 2 friends that are vegetarians and they were not allowed to swap out for other meals. the pepsi we ordered came out flat without carbonation. they also said that the dishes on their menu can change from time to time. I WOULD DEF. TELL YOU NOT TO GO, ESPECIALLY NOT WITH A GROUP. the full meal took close to 2 hrs and we were the first table seated when they opened. horrible!!!!!!!!

eGSb8EbsLPvcbqIhqpBP6A.text: For Vegas, this was a treat.  Once you get past the fact that you are sitting in a fake Venice, next to a fake canal, indoors, the setting is as charming as it gets.  We had a table on the patio overlooking the canal as the gondolas slid by, the gondoliers singing beautifully, their songs echoing off the sky painted on the ceiling.  Everything in Vegas is fake something else and this is one of the better cases.  Anyway, I love Mexican food and the food here was quite good.  I had the chicken fajitas and my friend had the chicken mole.  It wasn't the chocolately style of mole he likes but it was good all the same.  My fajitas were tasty and plentiful but nothing exceptional.  The margaritas were very good.  If you compare prices to other Mexican restaurants you know, this is pretty expensive.  (The charge for chips and salsa.). But if you compare the cost of a decent meal in a beautiful setting anywhere else in Vegas, it's a bargain.  Pros:  good food, good service, reasonable prices, wonderful setting  Cons: should have asked "salt/no salt" when we ordered margaritas and why did I have to ask for a glass with my beer?

P9z6QmaqO3SWcGciVWCovA.text: Whenever I go to Vegas, I always want to eat here.  Yes, yes, I know that Los Angeles should have better Mexican food than Vegas, and I have to say that most of the time, it does.  However, there is one particular dish here that I ALWAYS get, so although I may not be the best judge in determining if this restaurant is particularly good overall, at least I know one thing...their barbarcoa plate is DEEEEELICIOUS!  I mean, I have tried bites of other items on their menu from people that I'm eating with, and they all seem pretty decent, however none of them have compared to the barbarcoa.  It's so tender that no knife is needed; the meat just falls apart when poked gently with the fork.  It comes with cilantro rice, which is really good too, black beans, which I don't really eat cuz I'm simply not a fan of beans, and tortillas.  They also have strong, but tasty drinks here, and the servers have always been nice.  And, you can pretend you sitting outside a Venetian restaurant because its right by the gondola ride.  What more can you ask for?!?

pfD7P2heFEdjL9dwrc9mPw.text: We hosted 25 friends for my wife's birthday party at Canonita Taqueria over the Labor Day weekend.  Everyone from the busboys to the waiters to Michael, the manager did everything right and made it a memorable event.  The food was amazing and the margaritas were deceptively potent.  Everyone went away happy (and buzzed).  We couldn't have been more pleased.

h-gqPuSHBH7U1_l1M1C5aw.text: I always have a good time there.  This is the place you just walk into when you feel like it.  I never made a reservation with this place before, I just walk in when I feel like having some good Mexican food in a nice casual comfortable setting.  The food is good.  Their roast pork, beef ribs and some desserts, they are all delicous.

kFueCSGvpIqRfrP1z1jGLw.text: This was our first meal when we got to Vegas.  GREAT atmosphere, right by the canal.  Food was very very good - especially the crab cakes and the drinks!  Good service.  Loved the cilantro rice!

NbA12wjMBi388XyDNbltaw.text: The place is good to take family and friends who want something a little different in the Venetian. It's over-priced, but what place isn't at the Strip. The food is good, but it's nothing to rave about. I had a salad, which was excellent, but it wasn't unique or excellent.

1sP0E7wKZ6_uYF5Ci7_RqQ.text: Wow, I've eaten here in the past and liked it. Went back recently and I have to say we (table of 6) had the worst service I've ever had hands down. Everyone at the table was looking around to see if maybe we were on candid camera or something it was that bad.

CKhSwff5wL8VsmigBQ64UA.text: I love this restaurant/bar! It is inside the Venetian Hotel, above the gondola ride. The food is awesome, and so are the drinks. The Pineapple Infused Margarita is the best!

iNBtuVXxMONtFLKJIbqxww.text: This place is awesome for the taste and the deal! Free refills on the 12 oz soda on the today's special!!

Vs7oBufQ8bvm-2GxnqNy5w.text: Great mexican fare, absolutely tasty and well executed. Great for lunch, not sure I would have dinner there, in the Canal Shoppes mall, unless you really want to see and hear the gondoliers on and on. A bit pricey for classic mexican food, no matter how good, so rating is set  at 3.

0hVWraaUYw4AZF7-YaXubg.text: Ate a late dinner there and had excellent enchiladas!  The rice and beans were very good too!  I loved that they had a happy hour starting at 9 pm with  delicious $5 margaritas.  I will go back on my next visit to the Venetian.

CPMwytEaiiTfiqCSOlw-1w.text: Good food but stay away from the Steak Tampiquena tougher than a rubber tire - toughest meat ever !!! Awesome Barbacoa

xw_7IEpUn3ttY7g8K9MBuw.text: this place has a lot of potential for great food. flavor profiles are good but quality really suffers. We ordered flautas and received taquitos (the smallest flautas I've ever seen in my life!), we ordered tres tacos but the menu failed to mention these are actually street tacos (extremely small tres bite tacos) and they only came in one small corn tortilla each instead of 2. We were told the tres tacos were all white meat but it as mixed (no problem with but it would've been nice to know...the manager said it's supposed to be all white so I have no idea what happened there). We asked if we could special order some nachos and we were told the chef has "attempted many times to make nachos but keeps failing" - at first we didn't understand exactly what that meant, the manger later told me they don't have the proper cheese and they cheese they use doesn't melt well and the chef wouldn't send it out with her name on it and doesn't see it as presentable - but that's what we wanted melted cheese or not and frankly, the chef sent out our other food seemingly not caring if her name was on that and it wasn't that great. The refried beans with chroizo is defintely worth it. Overall it was a waste - $55 for okay service, one order of "street" tacos, 2 orders of "flautas" and the chips and salsa we had to pay for. When I addressed my concerns with the manager she didn't really seem to care and stood by the food (absolutely great and a quality I admire in a manager but I really feel she should've bent a little as we left feeling like she didn't care about our experience) we are locals and will never go back to this restaurant. Your money is much better spent in the Venetian food court.

nw4Z9cGnDrKsDkFZAdGeRw.text: I got the house margarita and it was fantastic! Nothing special about it, just plain good. The guacamole was great, but had one to many onions in it for my taste. Plates are huge, so I would suggest splitting. That is exactly what we did. Got the a la carte taco platter with 6 different tacos...mushroom and queso, fish with mango, chicken, beef, pork, and rajas with queso. Light, fresh, and good. Great midday snack before we headed back out onto the Vegas Strip. Love the iron gates, columns, and tiling...located right on the Venetian's canal.

S1MbNcjqlfSwsvHyeL7a3A.text: I was surprised at how much I loved it here!  It's such a cute atmosphere.  Just off the Venetian Hotel next to all the shops, you can feel like you're sitting outdoors at a Mexican cafe with the sunny blue skies (aka the ceiling) and gondolas drifting by.    I loved the guacamole here - so good!  And pretty spicy.  Loved it!  The bf got the seared tuna.  It was delicious!  I can't remember the name of what I got, but it was short ribs served over mashed potatoes - also delicious.  The meat was so tender and just fell off the bone.  MOUTH-WATERINGLY DELICIOUS!  :)  We were here for dinner to celebrate our friend's birthday...we told the hostess AND our waitress...and that doesn't get you anything.  I think that's really stupid!

hR3mkPKpC-aUlMJ3SjLstg.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant ever. I love the chile relleno and the aqua de sandia is THE best I have ever had in my life(including in Mexico).

c-OU0VLxYwnfbuSMgvnr9A.text: nice spot by the canal, decent food at a reasonable price and good margaritas.

zYbB7EhD64a66_WArFzl5Q.text: Good food, fine happy hour, shit service. Don't go if you're in a hurry

4mB_NfIRZoiUlidwFBiP3A.text: I had doubts about the authenticity of the food at first,  being that this is a Mexican place at the Venitian hotel. And though I cant say the dishes were 100% traditional, everything my party tried was delicious. Im not sure if the twist they put on their dishes is just to make them unique or if they are fused with a different culture, all I know is that the flavors blended well and left me wanting to go back! I ordered the Chiapaneco citrus glazed salmon, which was marinated in a delicious tamarind sauce, topped with mandarins and served with a sweet potato hash. Honestly,  I was very surprised at how much I enjoyed it! My boyfriend ordered the Mazatin seared ahi with quinoa salad and that was also really good. The ahi was seared with this really tasty chile sauce... best seared tuna ive ever had! He also ordered the shrimp calamari cocktail, which I expected to be a bland American version, but was actually very close to the authentic Mexican style... also very good. My sister and her girlfriend tried the chicken enchiladas and a Tarascan chicken soup, which I did not try but they loved. And last but not least, my absolute favorite thing was the sangria de rojo, which is a blend of sangria and margarita. Now I want to go back to try every other drink on the menu! **The service and the view were great too!**

rR_NLV0euEIseBzb2SUPEg.text: Great food right by the canal inside the Venetian Las Vegas.  Wonderful service and a fun experience.

jBo__IabF11lDTVNOA8DoA.text: I thought it was rather funny to have a traditional Mexican restaurant in the Venetian... and right on the canal too!  But it's Vegas so I rolled with it.  The food was surprisingly delicious, but the service was a little iffy....  just slow and it seemed like a long conversation just to put one order in.  Despite the speed, the food came out perfect.  And I scarfed down what I could of my beef enchiladas.  The entrees come with black beans and cilantro rice, which were awesome, but there was too much of it.  I always feel bad when I leave food on my plate.  We had just seen our boy, Pacquiao win his title event on the casino floor which was invigorating, but we were also starving too.    Since we were so hungry... I think that made it seem like the service was slower, but looking at our watches afterward... we did kill a whole bunch of time just sitting there and eating.  We also ordered chips and guacamole... which were nice and hot and good.    Overall it was a good meal and it was nice sitting next to the canal and hearing the gondoliers sing their songs to the couples riding in the boats.

cA5p9PAgu_nTEQY08dk5hA.text: So stopped in for a rest, appetizer and a beverage.   Sitting on the side watching the gondolas pass by.   Really special.    Service slow / poor but ok.   Chips and salsa were good.   Great location

HNGh5YkxhSzemQBG4P4tyg.text: Delicious, great atmosphere, friendly service, gourmet Mexican food!! We stayed at Treasure Island, but wanted to go to the Venetian because we heard they had great restaurants. We found Canonitas on Yelp and went with it!! Great choice.

Tz0lSB1yJNPU5BdJQXW_cw.text: This place is terrible. And overpriced. Nice spot by the canal, but food wasn't worth the price point.

I_IpFDMT9d6uIr9nxK7Q-g.text: Pork Barbacoa was excellent, lean pork with a great red mole which had a hint of spice to it served with 4" corn tortillas

zlBBTLEl1U0bf6NDA29chA.text: Fun location right on the canals to enjoy the gondolas singing by....  Excellent margaritas, chips and salsa and guacamole. Other dishes we tried were very good. Excellent service....one diner had trouble with spice, and they nicely had the dish redone cutting back on the heat.

pM79Fb6AOaapHalXp4niXg.text: I had the pleasure of dining here today (6/11/10) actually while exploring the Venetian for all its wonders. It happened to be happy hour when we were passing by.  The big happy hour menu is what caught our attention and from there we were drawn in like moths to a flame.   We were seated very quickly and the setting overlooked the Venetian's waterway. A nice romantic scene for you and your loved one. The waiter Alejandro who's name brought Lady GaGa's song to mind immediately. Alejandro, Alejandro, Ale, Ale, Ale, Ale, Alejandro... however many times she repeats it. He was awesome.  I was in a chicken taco kind of mood as usual, but I quickly changed my mind after I saw the chicken enchiladas. You had your choice of toppings but I can only remember the mole poblano for whatever reason. My wife opted for the chicken tacos surprisingly.   Of course I ordered a Modelo (it was fitting at the time) and my wife ordered the cape cod. We should have ordered chips and salsa because the drinks came right away which was cool, but since we haven't really eaten anything prior to, our buzz started to kick in after a few rounds. The cape cod was very strong as you can taste more vodka then cranberry juice, but we were in Vegas so who cared. The stronger the better.    When the food arrived we were slightly tipsy and before my wife got the opportunity top dig in I reached for my fork and blocked her from grabbing the chicken tacos. I wanted to take a few snaps of them as they were. It's what I do.   The chicken tacos according to my wife were very flavorful and juicy. My chicken enchiladas were excellent and I would highly recommend them topped with the mole poblano sauce as it adds a wonderful kick. The black beans and cilantro rice were the perfect sides.   If you get the opportunity give it a try and if possible see if you can get seated in Alejandro's section. He was very attentive. We had an awesome experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Enchiladas topped with molé poblano sauce served with black beans and cilantro rice
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Enchiladas topped with molé poblano sauce served with black beans and cilantro rice
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tacos

h_1i3330wFmqmdhknMG4yw.text: 4.4 stars.  Almost forgot to write a review about this place.  We were browsing the Strip and ended up in the Venetian during their Winter in Venice showcase.  We were hungry but didn't want to spoil our dinner that was in a few hours.  So we all ordered the Mexican Chopped Salad of grilled chicken, roasted veggies, smoked panela cheese in a beautiful Sherry-cumin vinaigrette (4.5 stars).  Along with margaritas (4.5) and great chips, salsa and guacamole (4.5), we were satisfied.  Service was prompt and pleasant (4 stars).  A rather interesting setting along the "Venetian canals" under a simulated wintry-blue sky.  Mexican food in "Venice".  There's a first for everything.  Tally: Mexican Chopped Salad:  4.5 stars Margaritas:  4.5 stars Chips/Salsa:  4.5 stars Service:  4 stars 4.5+4.5+4.5+4= 17.5/4= 4.4 stars.

bs-m7p7HzHnS4ldHP_xqDA.text: Chips and salsa were good but you had to pay for them including salsa picante which was perfectly spicy.  Food was tasty and margaritas were refreshing.  I had the tacos and were pretty good.

Aex0cc5NZF-4fJaRhYmFqA.text: Wonderful atmosphere--located inside the canal shops with seating right on the water. We got to watch and listen as the gondolas passed by. Amazing food--highly recommend the shredded beef quesadillas and Mexican enchiladas!

cKNWlDzo4ZTJSPzlqgCxww.text: Their specialty drinks like the jalapeno & raspberry margaritas were yummy!!  Food was good the rice & beans had no flavor Chicken dishes we above average. The best part was our lovely server who has to be one of the nicest servers we've come across in a while in Vegas!! She made the start to #vegasNYE evening all the more perfect! Ambiance is nice located on the canals of the Venetian. So in summery go for ambiance and quick bit to eat this place hits the spot...
