P-haVlKPiMHDBh3gTEHCuA.text: Food its ok i realy liked the spirit of the hosstes and the service it was just fine nothing to be inpresed

p4kp09ymP8a7vNRDDQ5nTA.text: I ate here twice this week!  The first time was a dry run to see if it was suitable for customers. The warm chips, salsa ,and guacamole were perfection as were the Barbacoa, cilantro rice, and any variation of the Tres tacos. The second time several of my customers at the table that had the Chili Relleno dish stated it was the best they  ever tasted- and that is a bold statement since all of us at the table are from the OC which offers many great choices for outstanding Mexican food! The Tres Leches was a great way to end a fantastic meal.

4ArG5b4iUwWKzwG7wirRKQ.text: We searched for this place. It turns out that we hit the jackpot! If you want to learn, as an adult, about various tequilas....this is the place. We did not have food but we did learn much, from Alex, how what tequila was and truly is. This place is classy and open to all with the restaurant attached. The menu looked great. We hope to return. They have been there 16 years.

5CRvkXajyZUpUfLelChWlw.text: I cannot go to Vegas without a trip (or two or three) to Canonita! I live in San Diego where we have awesome Mexican food, but this place is the whole package- great food, amazing drinks, awesome service and cool atmosphere. We usually just sit at the bar, and Alex (one of the bartenders) is so good at what he does! He's super friendly and even remembers us after months of not going. You must try the pineapple margarita, sangria and the chicken flautas. It's also cool that it's right by the canals, and great for people watching :) I can't wait to go back!

QjLjYHLoLZWjBIq21PUXGQ.text: After walking all over the strip we were all craving Mexican food. The closest was Canonita... Therefore we stopped by. Upon arriving we saw it crowded... The host told us it was a 30minute wait.. So we waited and finally 20min later we got seated. Rozalind, seated us. She went around our whole table giving us menus and she's very sweet, we ended up knowing we were from the same place in California which is awesome. Now the server was great also ! His name was pabo I think... He was very fast and remembered what each individually ordered. The place has Mexican music I believe, it seems like your in Italy having Mexican food(:  To end it the food was amazing !!! We had the Shrimp and Mussels , also rib eye ... Everything was great(:

1TRhK65jeYkhkgPaPOhuQw.text: Delicious food and friendly staff.   Sit "outside" overlooking the canal and listen to the gondola drivers serenading their passengers.  I ordered the torta carne. Super soft bread, tender steak topped with cheese, salsa and sweet caramelized onions. The sandwich seemed huge and was accompanied by a giant pile of fresh mixed greens with a light house vinaigrette. It was all I could do to NOT eat every bite of everything I was served. We ordered chips & salsa to eat while we waited for our meals. Nice crisp chips, not greasy at all, and salsa with just the slightest kick to it.  We had great service and great food. Affordable and tasty. Would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. torta carne

srIAs3-qV7nGAwPYM8LUCQ.text: Exceptional food with an amazing ambience !!! We ordered the chille relleno and the chicken quesadilla along with guacamole and chips and an omelet. Everything was finger licking good. The lattes were perfect and so was the mimosa. The soothing water by the side is a perfect place to have your brunch. All in all a fantastic experience. Will surely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the restaurant from the canal

aLM-oJMR74pvIjUHA6ekyw.text: Service was good but when you pay 20 something for shrimp tacos I expect more than shrimp and a tortilla with like 2 pieces of cilantro.

dr601M6C-D7qtRpD88fa5Q.text: Chips and salsa is a MUST here. Guac is decent. I lalaloooove the cilantro rice and black beans that come with most dishes. The tacos are fucking BOMB diggity...so are the margaritas; it all tastes very authentic. Nothing better than homemade EVERYTHING...and you can actually taste it!!  I seriously crave their margaritas after a while! So refreshing and tasty.   The service is always superb. I usually sit at the bar, just to kind of avoid that kitschy Venetian feel. All of the bartenders are attentive and friendly. The overall vibe of the place is welcoming and warm - disregarding the "mall atmosphere" happening around the place.   If you like the feel of the Venetian, this would be the place to relax and enjoy a very good meal - the Canal flows right past the restaurant as you hear the gondola singer's serenading echoes.   There's an open kitchen where you can see fresh tortillas being made and dishes being cooked to order. I absolutely love it. Excellent execution of service, very well organized, clean and customer oriented. I'm definitely a fan of this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah....couldn&#39;t wait to grub.

2npPz2nEQFcP8EALnla6OA.text: Wow!! Carne Asada was awesome!!!! Cooked perfectly, very flavorful and tender. Also the sweet tamales it came with were amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum! Carne Asada!

2yRVv42GFE0ZWu9k4xCXZQ.text: It has been 2 times where my meal was disappointing. Last time the chilaquiles were too soggy. A few days ago, the guacamole was sooo salty. What a waste of beautifully ripe avocado. The black beans were a little firm, not raw, but could've used another 20 minutes. Luckily the barbacoa was still good. One of the worst things in a restaurant is inconsistency. I always loved Canonita, but I am one bad meal away from not returning.

Go1x7RmP9t2oFrNOCgn8Vg.text: Awesome staff excellent food and drinks !!! Had the beef flautas and hubby had the chili relleno both were super good. We also shared chips and guacamole which was delicious!!! Best guacamole either one of us has ever had.  Can't wait to go back here. Our waitress Ashley was very good and attentive. We sat at the edge near the canal and watched many couples riding in the gondolas which was very nice. 10 out of 10!!

W0vhfhXGq1ced7KbR-ZoAA.text: Slow service. We sat at the table 15 minutes before we got noticed. They made up for it with free bloody Mary's. Food was pretty good, Huevas rancheros and Chilaquiles

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros. Red sauce was too sweet.

6cLaMVOsSo1GawU5CCsJDA.text: We were here for lunch. Great quality food with huge portion size. We ordered shrimp and calamari cocktail and pork barbacoa for two, and that was plenty. Shrimp and calamari cocktail came with tortilla chips, which were crispy, fresh, and still warm. The meat in our pork barbacoa was very tender. It came with fresh tortilla, one of which I ate by itself because it was so good. This place has great ambience and excellent customer service . We had view of gondolas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Santa rosa pork barbacoa. Huge portion size!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and calamari cocktail, comes with tortilla chips.

0fzpmysX_tWCsCxCJtAArQ.text: Ordered guac and chips which was delicious. Ordered queso fundido with mushrooms. It was bland and the cheese tasted like plastic (the texture reminded me of gondu in post office, this is hilarious if you get ).  It was my mistake to order this dish not knowing it is melted cheese.  My advice google the image of any dish you have not ordered before. That's my lesson for ordering this thinking it's another name for quesadilla.   Would not recommend this place for vegetarians. The drinks were good, it is right by the gondola ride inside the Venetitian. Still, all of this did not add up to the food options for vegetarian.

n-ytlkTzktJjKLuaGUtb3Q.text: Given the wrong food.  Never told that our Brunch order was put in AFTER Brunch ended. So the wait person just substituted other food for our order.  She never came out to explain and let us decide for ourselves what we wanted.     Poor service and the food we were served was bland.

6QOLPlzi6hUrbb1_esedJQ.text: The guacamole is so delicious! Portions seem smaller but are very filling with the chips.

_l6VEOF06Lgxip6OHPnJ4Q.text: I've eaten here a few times. The food is very good and the atmosphere is cool. You get to watch touristas go by in gondolas while you eat and drink.  The guac is delicious and I reccomend the carnitas and carne asada.  The pina colada served in a coconut is ok, too, its called coca pina and just seems to taste better in a coconut.  Unlike most Mexican places, they do charge for chips and salsa, But being Vegas, I was surprised they did not charge for the water!

ackXXBhPtMgmSTGeCcwFpw.text: This review is not actually about the food. We had an open table reservation for 10. At 9:50 I received a phone call stating that the kitchen had closed. We had just taken an expensive taxi from our hotel and were within the Venetian, just minutes away. The lady who called offered no excuse as to why I was able to make the reservation if they were closed. This mistake cost me round trip taxi fare and left me scrambling to find an open restaurant.

TVMJ38OvjjusDd9XQXOIog.text: Good place, nice food , but service is really slow , waiter keep forgetting things and never take the finished plate horrible

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fuj-p9AffoXxztgni6ERwg.text: Delicious. I came here for resaurant week and they had my favorite dish of theirs on the menu. For 30.00 you got the salmon with plantain hurracha and corn salsa with cotija a salad to start and banana brownie to finish. All really delicious. My boyfriend always orders the barbacoa and I believe that was a restaurant week option as well. I absolutely recommend them, located in the Venetian the only place we stay in Vegas.

irJHAdlPmZvhBM-p8nxImg.text: Canonita, what can I say. The ambiance basically speaks for itself. You can sit alongside the indoor canal and watch as tourists take their rides on gondolas as the gondoliers sing. It's a relaxing atmosphere, both for the young and old. Try to opt for this seating area instead of inside.   Their shrimp burrito is phenomenal - loaded with shrimp in every bite, no exaggeration. The cilantro rice was the perfect touch.  The chicken tacos (came with 3) were pretty standard- but they did have pickled onions which were a nice addition.   Each plate ranged from 16-20 dollars, so it's pretty reasonable for Vegas.  P.S. Sometimes it's too busy that they won't be able to seat you if you try to walk in- so your best bet is getting a reservation!

LrQeXwuqcT1B4FMWr3XGFw.text: Hate to ever leave such a low rating...but when you fall upon a Mexican restaurant that actually charges you for for chips and salsa as an appetizer we have a problem ...  Service is lacking at best, received much "stink eye" when I question the $6 charge for simple chips and salsa... I will not go into the $12 drinks... Food was equally bad, so soggy and lacking flavor , and even more adequate portions, I just gave up.   I get they have to cover the high over head of this location, but at least serve decent food and semi decent costs.   just saying.

Sj_XoOxMH9WaiTLlDpphbw.text: What a nightmare disaster.  I sat at the bar (not full) and was roundly ignored for 20 min.  I was literally invisible.  Then went to Sushi Samba.  Took 2 minutes at a full bar to be recognized and setup.    Avoid this place if you like being treated like dirt.

LvNBpoiVea1_IzHaNlzkLQ.text: Amazing Mexican food with a great view of gondolas and wonderful service. The guacamole was incredible, the margarita was delightful. Jairo was our server and was very friendly.  The manager Katherine made sure everything was executed without a hitch. We were a larger party of 12 and food came out very timely and perfect temperature. Would highly recommend!

CLzzQtLpzFqpUNqWHrxxDA.text: seating over looking the canal and gondolas was nice, the aqua fresca was good but otherwise,  very bland and low quality food.  lt reminded me of hospital food.

Wts9ax6tc7jHNdvBZ-Sazg.text: Review:  Margaritas, chips, guacamole  Since we were in The Venetian and had just finished seeing The Jersey Boys, we were wanting a little late night snack.  We timed it just right at this place - 9:00pm to closing is Happy Hour and Margaritas are just $5!  Fresh ones too!  No mix.  Fresh lime juice.  Very well made.  We snacked on spicy guacamole and chips, as we sat at the edge of the canal watching the last of the evening's gondola riders go by.  We even witnessed a proposal take place in one of the gondolas!  Good server, very nice ambiance, delicious margaritas!

eB-PnXpPa1EO8Tgy4RBW5w.text: We were staying at The Venetian and around 11 a.m. most restaurants were closed but Canonita was opening. What a pleasant surprise! The food was delicious for a casual restaurant and so were the margaritas. I had the enchiladas and a soup and went back the next day to get exactly the same because I couldn't have enough.We got a table close to the gondolas and we witnessed a wedding, it was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend it.

dpI43N4ITQIcLvU3Ecd3BA.text: Amazing Place!  Great food, Excellent location, Stellar Service!  Great for romance right on the canal, fun for parties and or happy hour! The guacamole is to DIE FOR!  Get a seat on the rail rignt next to the canal.  A must when visiting the Grand Canal Shoppes!

GSHwBEyCY_T5yQqWs8Edgg.text: The food is probably only 3 stars, but the view  bumps it up. This restaurant is located in the Venetian at the shops on the canal. You are right on the canal so you get to watch all the gondolas go by. Watching all the people with their frozen smiles as they gaze up at the singing gondoliers is good fun.   The guac and salsa is excellent. The enchiladas are pretty good - I prefer the red sauce over the green because even though the green is tasty, the red has a nice kick and something about the green sauce causes everything to go a little soggy. I don't like soggy food - ever. The sangria margarita is not good (Sangria is supposed to be sweet which is a nice counterbalance to your margarita. Their sangria is tart and the drink does not work). Their soups tend to be heavy, but otherwise very tasty. Their fajitas are pretty good too.   I'm sure I'll eat here again.

NrUnWIN6QHKmzCaKcnnS3Q.text: Atmosphere by the canal was nice.  The drinks were good and the food was well prepared.  The service is also good.  The only thing taking a star off this one is the price which is definitely high (even for quality Mexican).

yfZsgGKN4Uz_2uNT_necAg.text: This is an amazing restaurant inside the Grand Canal shoppes at The Venetian. The margarita's were great and the food was just amazing.  Sitting by the artificial canal, seeing the gondola's go by while dining gives you feeling of dining in Venice. Servers were very plesant and helpful in providing good feedback about the dishes and gave us good recommendations too. The Wild Mushroom Enchilada is the best so far!  Highly recommend this for some good Mexican food in Vegas.

cbP2I0v1OpZLQNYZjzvCZA.text: Great location, next to gondola ride. Food was excellent. Veg option was really nice.

jU0QPLeBZQ0s7ewQvsS5VQ.text: Just got back from another great trip to Vegas and I think we went to Taqueria at least twice while staying at Venetian. Bartenders are super cool friendly people, always helpful and attentive. Thoroughly enjoyed my Don Julio 1942 with their excellent chips and salsa. My girl is obsessed with their house made pineapple tequila infusion so much so that we attempted to make it our self at home. Great views too of canal and mall. We will always visit this place when in Vegas. Thanks for the great service Alex!

QY1D7rQPGRecaSGe8gSaKw.text: I came back today because a few nights ago I was here with my husband and the food was delicious. Unfortunately this time I came alone and received the worst service ever. I got a table for one and sat there waiting for 20 mins while no one helped. Finally I decided to get up and ask the if they could please take my order I'm ready. The server I got her name is Kim S finally took my order and when my food came out she didn't even give me silver wear. I had to literally get up and ask for some. So finally another waiter helps me, brings me silver wear, salt and pepper. The whole entire time I'm watching her help out her other tables but not me. Didn't help me not once I had to ask her for my bill. I'm disappointed because I'm a vip guest at the Venetian and this is a good restaurant they just need to hire the right people . Will it come back

hIj7TtIpDsLxiXDzAheCWg.text: Came back for apps and drinks for happy hour hopping....  the salsa trios still on the happy hour menu  :) love this item!!! we also tried the 1/2 Steak 1/2 Chicken Quesadilla (also HHr menu) the Beef Empanadas (apps on regular menu) sweet and smoky yumm  drinks were a blackberry margarita (beautiful and refreshing.. but very sweet) bf had a couple of this red hot mixed drink (not my thing but he had two.. ) we also had a few well drinks since couple bucks each.. our bartenders were awesome, didn't charge for the extra chip refills and made very strong drinks!    STILL haven't made it in for dinner!! but when i do it'll be the Santa Rosa barbacoa De puerco!!! guy down the bar from me had it and it looked unbelievable!!!!

jcEhRJOrsAzwlCq3N09Wbw.text: Came here for breakfast and had a very good meal. Food tasted great. Great location next to the canal. Would come again. Only criticism would be that the service was a bit slow towards the end of the meal, hence 4 stars and not 5.

WJThPvvsOuuIK_9ad2QRIg.text: We love this restaurant. The food is great and the service is fantastic. I had the Michoacan style pork, and  my husband had  the chile relleno. We split a delicious spinach and bacon salad and dessert was the only good churro I've ever had, crispy and filled with cajeta.

9ZCYvnaIBP5cm-qnnjVDuw.text: I don't love the location or the ambiance, but the food was actually pretty good. The guacamole was very good and I was surprised, but the posole was also very good. Overall, I didn't try anything I didn't like.

O4icrXuHayzKS4_RF3Qblg.text: Service was excellent! We ordered the flautas & the chicken enchiladas, they were delicious! We also ordered the shrimp burrito, it was loaded with shrimp! So good!! I was skeptical when I saw the green rice, but it just as good as everything else! We will definitely go back! Prices are great too!

aSoeMaWCLzaX4JlY5fo0kg.text: Excellent food and great service.  We started with the Queso Fundido.  My wife had the Shrimp & Mussels Moqueca, and I had the Toluca Portobello Mushrooms.  All were delicious.  For desert we tried the flan, which was unique and super tasty.  Highly recommended!

JEp3poszR8WujbvV0ZkG6Q.text: Had a great meal here, and managed to get a seat next to canal, which made it even better. Service was great, particularly with my wife's lactose allergy.

ibTkY3Xucucuc2F-Rc976w.text: With so many dining options in Las Vegas I am astounded this place is as busy as it is. Drinks were OK, nothing special. I ordered the ahi tuna and was extremely disappointed that it did not come as described on the menu. The menu stated it came with chipotle polenta but arrived with white rice. Server made no mention of the substitution and had I known, I would have ordered another dish. My boyfriend ordered the chicken fajitas and said they were terrible. Our other friends said their food was OK. Disappointed we wasted a meal here.

TOGF4dCZJrriNEtNpOCKRQ.text: Fish tacos are very good  Guacamole is fantastic although the tortilla chips seemed like something only slightly better than you'd buy at the supermarket, which really confused me as the tortillas for the tacos were obviously freshly made in house.  Prices at lunch were reasonable by Vegas standards, dinner seemed high for what is essentially good-very good Mexican.

xR4cW4DaQIUkRKtXSc6spg.text: I was close to giving 4 stars but just couldn't do it due to the food flavors. Atmosphere was great as it sits on the canal with great views. Service was good and friendly. The biggest draw back was the flavors. We got the 5 taco sampler and tried mushroom, chicken, pork and beef. Chicken and beef were both pretty good with fresh ingredients. The mushroom tasted like they were almost pickled and the pork had decent flavor but was so dry it was almost not edible. The chips are very thick and overwhelmed the salsa that had almost zero flavor. Overall good atmosphere, just lacked great food.

1g9u29leujn9ERTpqbjOAQ.text: The service is great, the food amazing, the place is really well located at the Venetian, this is the best place to eat Mexican food, the staff is the best, thanks for a great experience.

qA8zkwWShyGUIHlM7bw7_g.text: We booked a reservation here for after our friends wedding ceremony. Booked reservation based off previous good reviews and I must say WOW. Everything our table got was excellent! Definitely 5 Star. We were a little bummed the chips and salsa were $5 and cost 50 cents for a refill, the chips were absolutely delicious though so it made up for it.   We had a group of 15. Very efficient service. Food came out in a timely manner and very impressed the tortillas were made in house. Would definitely come back and eat here and recommend to friends. The dining experience overall was wonderful and the atmosphere was just the same.

JM0YrddllQiZtiKxt99Qlw.text: The worst enchiladas and quesadillas I ever had. No flavor whatsoever. Unfortunately that was one of my friends first time trying Mexican food and it was a disappointment for her too. Nice view I will give a thumbs up for that, but really the most flavorless mexican food I ever had.

OmhMArZtDBCB471SWeKC0g.text: Stopped in for tacos and a margarita.  Tacos were good, my preference was the taco de pescado which was a firm white fish that held up well to the plancha with cilantro on a corn tortilla.  The margarita menu was quite extensive ranging in cost from $15 to $37.  I opted for the $15 version which was with Patron silver.  The mix used was a bottled variety which I did not really enjoy.

kIjfc8kXanrkU2a48CtsZw.text: This was an outstanding experience with great service from Arianna Martinez.  The food was fabulous!  The concierge frThank you for a great dinner.

MV-9MpHHk0LhjIs6o5oFUQ.text: This was the only place still serving breakfast and it was sooo goood. The corn tortillas here so amazing and they are made on site.

LMcmwLRvmuol_u7_RLaLSg.text: Wonderful food! Ashley was a great server! Had smoked chicken quesadillas and Queso fundido which were both excellent. Chips and salsa were delicious! Brought my mom to Vegas for her birthday and they gave her the Tres Leche cake as a birthday treat which was also excellent. Definitely recommend if you want great Mexican in Vegas.

h2yOh7zbtfr_-fTAHQ96bw.text: Great place at the Venetian with the view of the gondola  rides. Great breakfast!                       (Breakfast served until 11am). Chilaquiles were great! And dessert is a must ! I had the tres leches cake it looked beautiful and tasted great ... juice seemed pricey for a small up ...

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gVAR0XTycsSgQ5KFi4llhw.text: We stopped in again to give them another chance on our last visit to Las Vegas. The food was much better than our last visit. My husband had the pork special and I had tres tacos. We also had guacamole and chips. I think we always have guacamole and chips. The meal was just right and we did enjoy ourselves.

Xz1VU6rk1Evm3InE2zJu8w.text: Excellent food! Excellent service with Jesus! Suggested an entree for my husband which was short ribs something different and he loved it! I had fish tacos one of the best! Highly recommend!!! Gracias Jesus for great service and the margaritas were perfect!

byjbrjWecKfP5cACRdQTXg.text: Stay away! Too high priced, too small portions. We ordered chips and salsa for $5 and were not offered refills. Usually for FREE you get refills, so disappointing it didn't happen when we paid.  Waiter kept forgetting straws, refills, etc.  Portions are small and prices are high. Mole chicken was dry and flavorless. Chose this over a chain restaurant, should of went to the chain. Should of went to Chilis for that matter...

VA5ucSo9n1yluiljAN5nbw.text: NOT AFRAID of FLAVOR.  So happy to find a restaurant that is not afraid of flavor.  Starting right off with the guacamole that was nicely spicy and super fresh.   Don't skip it!  We ordered family style for the table, and the overall favorites were the tuna, the beef tacos and the pork.  But, don't overlook the shrimp, and the steak.  Nothing on the table was a disappointment.     Marco was our waiter.  He did a good job wrangling a large group.  And, the margaritas were good, but truly the highlight was the food.  Highly recommend this casual eatery.

4A05XWH7_NaD385v6ds7vQ.text: This place was awesome! Everyone was so friendly and I had a warm welcome from the hostess, Katherine. I had Mole enchiladas, which was so delicious. Mole sauce was perfect...I was impressed as that's hard to find good Mole. Will definitely be coming back and I encourage everyone to check it out! :o)

VJYhMzs-7Gfc-ge1oVHD0w.text: So happy to have stumbled upon this place while shopping it's a definite comeback to restaurant for our future trips.  Service: 5 stars. We were seated quickly and the food was well paced. Our waiter was friendly yet not overbearing. Clearly knew the menu, offered great suggestions, and took note on our special requests.  Food: 5 stars! Thank god for advertising or else we would have by passed this place. On the board outside the restaurant each colored slide of their food looked amazing, orgasmic we kept moaning and commenting on every picture haha. When girls are hungry! Lol. And we can now add that the pictures live up to the hype!!!. Everything was fantastic here, wish we would have tried more. The queso fundito was amazing amazing, the highlight of the appetizers. Their tacos plates are awesome as well, I'd recommend the sampler plate but if I had to recommend one I'd say go with the carnitas. Even the little things were good, awesome rice and beans.  A tecate with lime juice and Ice brought the final scoring up to 5 stars! Can't wait to come back next vacation. So yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tecate w/ Lime Juice!
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres Tacos Carnitas (pork)
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso Fresco

kEy7IPLpxHUQn8YP165xRA.text: Cool Mexican restaurant right next to the canal in the Venetian! Amazing scenery.   We had a party of 10 plus a toddler. We ordered many many mags, all very tasty. The waitress did skip me for the drink orders though. She finally asked me if I wanted something as the food was coming out, but at that point I was over it.   If you do come here, please whatever you do, GET THE GUAC. I know, Mexican restaurant, the guac is just guac. NO. This place has theeee best guac, I've had in a long time. I filled up on guac before my main meal came. (No regrets.)  We ordered a variety of things. All yummy. I personally got the taco sampler. It came with pork, fish, chicken, mushroom, and steak tacos. All yummy, although the steak was prob the winner. The mushroom was something different though. Also a good option were the Ahi tuna tacos. They come with some king of polenta which is spicy.   The only thing we weren't too crazy about was the cilantro lime rice. For me, it was a little toooo much cilantro. And i even love it. Its bright green if you don't believe me.  The staff otherwise was super friendly and had great interaction with the toddler in our group.   Check it out!

QDbdBJaT3iKC0iTQOJFQTg.text: Food was good nothing special. Ordered the 5 taco sampler- chicken, beef and pork. The meats were flavorful but the tortilla wrap was mushy and disintegrated. Guacamole was fantastic. Service was great

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco sampler. I got chicken beef and pork @ canonitas

3STh14yF1ZiOp3dobsNttA.text: MEH  CHIPS AND SALSA SHOULD BE FREE  pricey meal so go during happy hour   They don't have Tajin (chile powder rim for drinks) that's a big no no for me especially at an "authentic Mexico City food restaurant"  The tuna ceviche looks more like cat food - it's a good amount but needed more lime  Pretty ok my favorite part was the view of the gondolas   I'd go for drinks and appetizers only during happy hour

whyXjOouel9p_9bTOrZfPg.text: Cute restaurant inside the Venetian.  It's right along the canal so you hear the gondoliers sing their heart out. The staff are friendly and attentive which I really like. The margaritas were a little strong but I didn't mind that. I didn't have their chips and salsa, but straight up ordered my entree which was a Moqueca with shrimps, mussels, calamari, peas, carrots, corn, white rice and coconut aji amarillo sauce. The sauce was not overpowering, you can taste all the ingredients.  It was an amazing meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Mussels Moqueca.

ICL2v3-PLSvxoTdZsZFyqQ.text: Was really disappointed after seeing it had good reviews, took them forever to bring out our drinks then they brought the appetizer out the same time as our food, not once asked about refills, ordered some shots as well and they brought them after they brought to food out.. 30mins from ordering them.

Jy3mObskEC6RWbczlR-Bhw.text: This place has a great view of the canal. It was the perfect place to grab lunch. I had a chicken enchilada and it was fabulous. It was the one time I wished I was more hungry so I could finish it. While I wasn't a fan of the cilantro rice because I don't like cilantro, my mom absolutely loved it. This place was also super accommodating to my allergies.   I knocked off one star because it took us 30+ minutes to get our food and the place wasn't very busy. In addition, they left the beans and tomato on my plate when I specifically said I didn't want any.  But they were quick to fix the mistake. The place was great, just be prepared to wait a little bit for your food.

ssem9Af3JX3GzAtOPfN8Mg.text: Amazing service, great food, and VERY friendly staff! Our waitress Ashely was so pleasant and helpful. She was extra careful with making sure there was no dairy in my food. Will definitely go back!

lYyjbEo3n_-3LN3O_OYFOQ.text: *This review is for breakfast only*  I feel like I discovered this joint deep in the Venetian/Palazzo labyrinth! You could pretty much walk by (or float by in one of the gondolas) and not notice it amongst all the colorful background action going on, but you'd be wise to track it down next time you're at the Venetian. Beautiful, open restaurant with a nice bar and lots of seating right along the canal.  WHEN YOU GO- I love eating breakfast right at the bar. Feels so decadent! Plus you always get great service because the bartenders are prepping for the day and not dealing with drunks. The Short Rib Chilaquillas are a must try. Cheesy, spicy with perfectly marinated chips, this dish is without a doubt my favorite. The omelets and breakfast burritos are very good as well. Fantastic, friendly service by all + very good house coffee makes this spot my go- to for breakfast when at the Venetian!

EUEneNvl0qxrV1w4JzQPeQ.text: We were in town for a bachelorette party and had 15 girls with us. We made reservations here before heading out for the night and we were seated right along the canal on the "patio". It was insanely beautiful and a fun space! We came on cinco de mayo, so they had a girl with a patron ice luge in the front for $5 a shot. It was fun, but sadly the tequila didn't actually go through the luge (just went through a tube) so it was super warm when you got it.  The food, drinks, and service were all great! We started off with the chips/salsa/guac and queso fundido. They were both on point! I split the mushroom enchiladas with one of the other girls and it was definitely the BEST dish at the table! The poblano sauce was so amazing and the dish as a whole was just perfect! The cinco de mayo menu had black bean empanadas on the specials menu, so we tried that, as well and it was great - definitely had a nice kick to it! We ordered pitchers of margs for the table and enjoyed them, as well- super strong.   The service was fast, attentive, and friendly. Definitely had a great experience here and would for sure come back another time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa and guac
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black bean empanadas (cinco de mayo special)

ZgzTWYwzzmaTk-aUPpbGsA.text: We were there as a large party. Food was good. But they charged us $400 extra for leaving 15 mins late. Which is even more ridiculous considering the restaurant was empty. When we argued with them, they called security on us! Wow. I think the attitude comes from the fact they have to repeat business.

iQ3YVvknC0fqgYXbtOZa8A.text: The wife and I found this place by chance as we were walking after a long day in Vegas and decided we wanted some place to sit down and have a drink.  This place looked really nice and had some open spots so we asked for a table by the faux river that had the guys singing to various guests as they paddled up and down the fake scenery.  We thought maybe it'd be nice to check out their food but we weren't hungry enough for a full meal so we just decided to get dessert.  I didn't want anything to heavy so the server recommended I try the Tres leches and my wife went with the warm banana brownie.  When mine arrived and I tasted it, it was incredible..like a sponge cake with fruit, very light and sweet but not overwhelming. My wife's warm banana brownie was also incredibly good, although a bit rich for me.  Very rich chocolate and the wife loved it.    Their desserts were both really fantastic and our server couldn't have been more helpful or nice to us.  She was spot on with the recommendation for me to get the Spicy Bloody Mary.  Yes it was quite spicy but hit the spot perfect.  What was going to be one drink quickly became two.  I'd highly recommend this place, they are total class and the food, from what we sampled, is top notch.  Note, not only was our server nice but everyone in here seemed to go out of their way to say hello or acknowledge us and seemed like they were really having a good time here, something that can't be said of a lot of restaurants.  Very welcoming!  When we come back to Vegas we plan to come back to Canonita and get a full meal next time.. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pink Cadillac and bloody mary
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-H_Jqnss-Z4_XzBkjw4dqQ.text: Love love love their ambience. Located on the canal in Venetian. Came here for breakfast. Ordered the veggie breakfast burrito. Enjoyed every bit with the perfect view. I would highly recommend this restaurant with a view

NZ0raJ_2hTCDPzyCQgJBnQ.text: I was in the mood for breakfast while in Vegas on Tuesday. I didn't want to to try the restaurant in my hotel because the reviews weren't that great. I walked over to the Venetian hoping I could be there before they stopped serving breakfast. Ended up getting completely lost but found it with 4 mins to spare. I was seated right away. I have a table right next to the indoor gondola so I could see the gondolas passing and the gondoliers singing. Absolutely wonderful view and very romantic.   I ordered the Mexican Pancakes, which came with bacon, and breakfast potatoes. I also ordered a mimosa. The portion size of the pancakes was large. The potatoes were great. The bacon was cooked perfectly. The pancakes were... meh. They did taste homemade and the flavor of them were good but they were extremely dry. I used 3 servings of syrup and they still needed more. The mimosa was strong but good.  I enjoyed the ambiance and the service at Canonita but the food was nothing special. Maybe the lunch and dinner options are better but breakfast is not a good indication.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GEenvebtyGyqgGXpEF0o4A.text: This place has decent food quality. My wife had seafood (don't recall the actual name) and it was excellent. I had beef enchiladas and because of the reviews of the 'red' sauce, I requested that my enchiladas be topped with mole and they were awesome! They also have a salsa verde sauce for enchiladas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef enchiladas topped with mole.
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_rEX0DWsRbSbAtPgMJ_Ruw.text: I grew up poor so as a policy I do not criticize food but I just cant help myself. They messed up badly the breakfast burrito. How can you do that? Why?

GEbNW7rQItLxMWf4RlBh0Q.text: This is a great restaurant option at the Venetian.  We came here twice for breakfast this last weekend as it's one of the few, surprisingly, good restaurants open for breakfast.  All the food was really good and they make all their own tortillas.  They've got a bottomless mimosa bar where you actually make the mimosas yourself.  None of this bottomless-but-we'll-start-putting-less-champagne-in-it-each-time mimosa business.  Reasonably priced and relatively private too to get away from the hustle and bustle.

a69T3B01xIX_wpljZmpmSw.text: We needed a late, light lunch and we were already in the Venetian. The only menu item that jumped out was the 5 taco plate. They feature 5 types of taco, shredded chicken, beef, pork, fish and vegetarian, on either wheat or corn tortillas. Fortunately, they are happy to make the plate with one of each type of taco. We ordered two of the variety plates to share, one on corn, the second on wheat...every combination. All of the tacos were delicious. I especially liked the vegetarian (lots of mushrooms) and the pork. I usually prefer corn tortillas for tacos, but here, I preferred the wheat. Where we come from, spending nearly five dollars on a single street taco would be crazy, but the Venetian (all of the Strip, actually) does that to you. Also, the margaritas are good.

6qUGi9pzzhzErfYVPVm5pA.text: The truck serves taco. Saddest taco ohave ever seen and they were like just mushrooms over taco.  NOT good.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kUR2pn3tJZmjAB3NcT3OKw.text: Definitely my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas ! All the food is delicious! Have tried the chicken flautas with rice and beans and it so bomb! A must try Is the Springfield sour so good !

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W9xI_et-EGYv9r6wWZcD-w.text: Came in for some drinks and appetizers at the bar while we waited for the rest of the party to finish up gambling.   I noticed that they had an agave margarita on the menu and was excited about that so ordered that to drink. I was very happy with my choice. Although the margarita is a little small for $15 I get why. It was delicious. I normally don't like my margaritas too sweet but yet not too strong either and I think they nailed it with this one.   I ordered the ahi tostada to start with and after tasting my first bite I was addicted. It doesn't look like it's too much but it ended up being a good amount once you start eating it. It had a little kick too it which I liked.   We then ordered some chips and guacamole to share. It comes with salsa too which is great, another great choice. The guacamole tasted so fresh and the chips we're a great consistency.   If the drinks and apps tasted this good I can't wait to come back to try the entrees!

U7SMcWG4xliild7wuWQlTA.text: One of the first customers at 8am for breakfast. The service was really slow for only have 2 parties to take care of. The levantate enchiladas were fresh, but didn't have amazing flavor. The location was great because it's right near the canal waterway.

-pgiecmdQbtrYa8fPqbH2Q.text: This place has been here for 19 years.  It's right by the Venetian lake where you can be serenaded by the gondoliers and tourists floating by you on gondolas.  The renovated decor here is quite nice, and colorful, as though it were a street corner in Mexico.  (A nice touch is the bright robin's egg blue Citroen truck parked on one side of the restaurant where tacos are sold--smart!)  The crab cakes ARE quite good (as others have said), but "muy picante" (very spicy).  It would have been nice for the server to let us know that.  Thankfully, I enjoy spicy, and it was delicious.  But my husband did not fare as well, and could only take a bite.  He also ordered a steak dish with beans that had really spicy onion and jalapenos on it that made his eyes immediately water and his hands reach out for water (which was almost gone).  Needless to say, he did not enjoy his meal.  And at $36, it was a waste.  Again, this is something the server should have given a heads-up about!  I took some of his onions/jalapenos and placed them in my pozole soup, and MAN ALIVE, it was HOT! I had to immediately take them out, but the contact with the soup, made it irredeemably spicy thereafter, even for me.  (Though I did nearly finish it, anyway).  I think the server should have given a heads up, as I said. I even ASKED about the spiciness level, and he said not to worry.  The menu should probably give a better heads-up, too.  Not everyone is a spicy food person; some of us are gringos, remember! This is a tourist place, after all.   And it took a long time to get re-fills on drinks, and our server kept forgetting our corn tortillas, etc.  I was trying to get him to get me the enchiladas to try, but he didn't catch on. Maybe he was given too many tables?  It's a busy location.   Aside from the crab cakes, the Queso fundido is a safe bet, too. (Cheesy, rich, and not spicy). The pork pozole had a nice, mild flavor.  I would avoid the chocolate dessert.  (Though I am a chocolate fanatic!)  It was way too dense.  But the tres leches cake was better.  Overall, the food was tasty (though I suspect loaded with salt and/or MSG, or artificial sugar or something--we were really quite bloated that night--first time in a long while, despite eating out a LOT), but the service was lacking.    Aside from not providing good information about the spice level of the food (despite asking), and not getting drinks filled, the server failed to give us the 10% discount that the manager suggested that we get for being locals.  Even though we asked, and he said he would, he didn't do it.  I didn't notice until I reviewed the bill walking away from the restaurant.  And we called about it, and were told that they would take it off the bill and get back to us...but no one got back to us.  Bummer.

3agGgJtyZzQxCfMIhABibw.text: Here on business with my team. A great atmosphere and great food. Nathan L. Was an excellent waiter. My glass never emptied. I got the Canonita burrito with chicken. It was very good. It had a little bit of a sweet tangy tone to it!

XblLyBPtr-9s3-03Xq9PEA.text: I'm here for a conference, and as a vegetarian it can be hard to find much to eat. I went to Canonita for breakfast and it was delicious! I had a breakfast burrito (minus the chorizo) with the green sauce. It was huge, filling, and very tasty! I also had fresh squeezed orange juice. I ordered the apple/guava empanadas, but had to take them to go to make it to my meeting in time. I just ate it cold for lunch, and boy was it good! I'm definitely going to have to go back for more tomorrow. The filling was perfect, a nice flakey crust, and crunchy sugar on top. Perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito (minus chorizo for vegetarian) and fresh OJ
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito (minus chorizo for vegetarian)

w4HiuOQrDOgCjqrmKeXnMw.text: Enjoyed lunch at Canonita located inside The Venetian right on the canal.  We ordered margaritas and chips and salsa while we decided what to order and OMG...YUMMY!  The chips were served warm with just the right amount of salt.  The margaritas were delicious as well!  I ordered the 3 chicken street tacos that came with rice and beans.  Since I ate so many of the yummy chips, I didn't eat the rice and beans, but the tacos were beyond yummy!  My husband ordered the 5 street tacos (combo of chicken and pork).  He asked for no onions, but they overcompensated with extra cilantro.  It was a little too much for his liking, but after taking some of it out, he loved his too.  The 5 tacos don't come with anything though.  The service at Canonita is great too.  Our server was friendly, and gave us advice on food and drinks since this was our first visit.  A little on the pricey side for lunch, but it's Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HADwA2MD-TmXwZuF55EL-g.text: Jesus was so fantastic!!! We are coming back just for him!!!  The guacamole was good and fun fact- the Caesar salad was invented in Tijuana, Mexico. Who knew?!

G5QVJqCuZlXXpKl7jr_law.text: Good and tasty mexican food, review from a mexican lol, great location right next to the canals

EWCC5OFHxpcxPiMztALx9A.text: Came to this place for New Year's day. There was not wait. Yay!   We ordered the guac, chips, and salsa to start and it seemed silly to pay for chips, but to their credit chips were warm and the guacamole was yummy. My husband ordered the Achiote Chicken and it was delicious.  I ordered the Carne Azada and it was ok.    I was very impressed by the Manager Martha Q. as she asked for our feedback and was generous towards us. I feel comfortable in recommending this place based on our experience.  Excellent staff and service.

cB9oHkMQqG-QODQZJD1Drg.text: The Queso fundido was very bland. But everything else we had was delicious. I had the chicken fajitas and they were spicy and tasty. The only reason this place didn't make 5 's was my drink was empty more than it was full and it was way too noisy to carry on a conversation with you fellow diners.  I would definitely return for dinner again and try some of the different menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken fajitas

2zUtDEsVOq1xx2bW-DwFaw.text: We came across this restaurant as we were walking by the river. It looks nice and has a great view. The service is good and our server Roberto was great. I order the fajita steak plate and I regret it. The beef had an old beef taste. When Roberto came over to ask how was everything, I shared I didn't like my plate because of the beef. He took my plate and took care of the issue. The queso fundido is amazing with chorizo.  Over all, I would visit again but try a different plate.

wFlcGBnhH-yqJFjuHi-Gtw.text: Eat here!!  You can't go wrong with what you order. Excellent service and ambiance.  Breakfast was AMAZING!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Short Rib Chilaquiles

34qV61_pAnGEC2TE7QfZWA.text: Exceptional ambience! Server was very accommodating and helpful  They have good vegan and vegetarian menu. If you celebrating something this is the perfect place.  Being a local we usually avoid strip but this our goto place!

S8vrkjOB-jEsIRQsKwsfyg.text: The server was not very nice until the very end and she kept disappearing for 10-15+ minutes at a time when we were trying to order. We stopped in for a snack and drinks mid-day. We had the happy hour margaritas for $5 each and they were OK, it was way too heavy on the sweet and sour mix but what do you expect for a $5 drink I suppose.   We also ordered the "quesadilla" off the appetizer menu to share and chips & salsa. The chips were kind of hard, but the salsa was good. The quesadilla was more of an empanada, but it was delicious.  Maybe we'd give it another try if we're back in the shops there.

_zE5cAAeADVjPBzDMzNDUw.text: While staying at Venetian hotel, this became our favorite everyday stop for lunch or breakfast. Very good food and service. The drinks were delicious and their happy hours made it a good deal. The view of the canal and gondolas going by made it perfect. We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The carnitas were good and looked better before I tore into them. Highly recommend the freshly made tortillas.

i8IKiQYRpxPYQg_Z2v9wrQ.text: I had an average experience at Canonita. The food did not surpass my expectations, unfortunately. My group ordered the queso, which was bland and so was the tortilla soup and tacos.   It was nothing impressive, but the pricing I thought was overpriced. The tacos were dry and the tortilla soup was average.  The decor is beautiful and the atmosphere is decent here. I really like the margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7kOMKAWwks-Jq2e5hA2pHw.text: I'm not sure how this place got this many stars more over a $$ rating. It's incredibly over priced for the quality and portion size they offer. The food was mediocre, had the $21 chicken fajita, and had about half a breast worth of meat. Rice and beans was extra! The $14 Agave Pulido" Margarita was too weak, small, and too sweet. The server was friendly, but a little overworked.   If your trapped in a mall and dying for Mexican, hope that it's not this mall your stuck in. Not terrible, but for the price and for the unsubstantiated reputation, for me it's a 2 star.

OO1-u44qSsJhp5FErlSB2A.text: Excellent view of the gondolas & singing gondolaer's.  Pablo was very nice & quick.  Ordered a Cucumber Watermelon Mint Martini strained.  It was ok pretty sweeter than I expected.  We didn't eat, but service was great.  I will be back especially for Happy Hour.

c8SVgNfMg73FxnMJiqkm1A.text: One of our meet up places for my family reunion, the food was pretty good and the service was amazing!  We arrived with a party of 12 and ordered a few appetizers; floutas, nachos and with Salsa.    I ordered the 3 taco meal that allows for a choice of beef, chicken, shrimp, or pork.  I just ordered all of mine with shrimp which also came with a side of rice and beans for $20.99.  My dish looked amazing but lacked flavor so I used the green and regular salsa on top.  Honesty, the 3 tacos filled me up and I barely touched the sides.    Our waiter was very attentive to our table and paid attention with refilling our glasses.  He also checked up on us often to ensure we were happy with our meals.  His service was great and deserves as 5 star rating.  As far as location, it's perfect; especially if you enter through the Venetian entrance near Madame Tussaud's.  It's right next to the Gondola rides inside the Mall area.  We enjoyed the singing and views!  Check out the place, the margaritas looked good!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view right behind me
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view of the bar
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool skull decoration

4DO3LVe-VHWgdttCP7-a-Q.text: The food was nothing special but the house margarita was one of the best I've ever had. I ordered an appetizer (Mexican street something) and the outer shell was so hard I had to pierce it with a knife to try to eat it. It was very hard to eat and not great tasting either. The waiter forgot to bring the chips and salsa we ordered (we're used to that being automatic and free) so he gave us a free dessert, tres leches cake. It was ok, but not anywhere near the best we've had. Maybe if we didn't have so much Mexican food at home in Houston, we would've been more impressed.

LRtXcN1DWWU0BD-J0XHkKw.text: Generally okay but for 40 a head would expect better. Tortilla soup was mediocre. Babrbacoa was excellent. Rice was all cilantro. Pork belly on mar y tierra was dry.

X88R236vaZsmBDQE3h-kSg.text: Rude and mean service! For a family of 6-7 families and approx 25 people, we arranged a Valentine's Day dinner here. We had a signed a contract for some dollar amount months in advance. Then just a week before they said they had to increase the minimum and they could afford to lose our business if we didn't increase it. Who changes the contract unilaterally after signing it? But that's not the worst. They gave us a check but somehow that credit card didn't go through. When we gave them another credit card, they charged us $300+ more because it was a few minutes (10 minutes) more than 2 hours! And they charged us gratuity on the late charges! The restaurant was empty. So rude and so mean! I have never had this bad a service in my entire life.

AwBdSyKwGqzn3gG-jeP6bg.text: Waited an hour for our food. The chips were stale. The food was flavorless. The waitstaff barely came around we had to flag them down every time. All the drinks are $$$ but i know I'm in Vegas what do i expect? I expect better service and better tasting food for that price. I would skip this place   So many other great options in Vegas.

0SJ00_E1nDZLtLHLVIzSJQ.text: Very enjoyable. Service was good. Typical Mexican place but with a more modern interior and feel. Margaritas were good but I didn't taste the grand mariner in mine. They have this little food truck outside that my brother loved. Would go back. Chips are awesome!

aZ4ZXxKxwwwDbTOdXoC5VQ.text: STAY AWAY:  We were a group of 24 people, we reserved for two hours. We took an extra ten minutes to leaveC and were charged $300 extra. Mediocre food, rude service.

-K6ct7LtyDWQVMab3FfH5g.text: Omg!!!! Great service, but the taste of the food is to die for!!!  Cazuela de mariscos and green pozole deli!! Try it!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fNPZB1wtV6FmUxFPbIcmRA.text: Literally giving five stars for the coffee (which isn't even in the menu) and the outstanding service from our server Rico.

JwbHlQCilAtXXfKxBB-t1g.text: The ladyfriend and I ate here one night while walking around the strip and had a great meal.  While Canonita is basically inside of a mall, it also sits on the canal that the gondolas of the Venetian turn around.  This can be romantic, comical and cheesy at the same time.  I mean the atmosphere is supposed to be of Venice, Italy but you are eating tacos with a Sketchers in the background lol.    We started off with the guac and chips.  They do not do the whole free chips and salsa thing.  The guacamole was fresh and had a little spicy kick to it.  I also decided to order a flight of margaritas. Did you read that?  A FLIGHT OF MARGARITAS!!!  It comes with 3 margaritas: a classic on the rocks, a pineapple and a jalapeno.  The jalapeno was very spicy and harder to get down than the other 2.  The classic was very heavy on lime.  For an entree I got the Pollo Mole Poblano.  I love chicken with mole sauce and get it anytime I see it.  This one had poblano peppers in the sauce so it tasted spicier than usual.  It came with a seasoned rice and mixed veggies.  Definitely a great meal.  If you are looking for Mexican while on the Vegas strip, this is worth a stop for sure.

W0GzztF0FadssplihFC4Jg.text: Brian r and Rayna were so amazing and helpful I wrote this! And the food was incredible. Drinks as well! Thanks so much!!! Definitely coming back!!

5DykK6oAzzOT7aziuJoa6g.text: Not that impressed. I would not recommend. Chips and salsa are great for the $3.00 charge. Service was slow. $35.00 for a pitcher of virgin Margaritas. Automatic 18 percent tip for a group of five. They are nice and polite. Will not go back.

HtNl04oypiRvuhQUpGlO4w.text: Would give zero stars if possible.  Waited 10 min to be greated once seated.  No water no nothing.  Waited came and we ordered chips and guacamole and 2 Margs.  Again a 10 min wait.  We ordered food and that took 25 minutes.  No visit from Waiter no courtesy checks, just simply Awful wait and awful service.  Sad part is... the food was great!  There were open tables so this wasn't due to a crowded house, this is due to poor mgmt and low expectations from those working.  Won't be back

jbJ2ty5JGfJkkrvOeUkCOg.text: I tried Canonita for breakfast. The atmosphere is outstanding! The restaurant sits in the "river" inside where the gondolas go up and down with people. The waitress was extremely attentive and friendly. I ordered the carnitas omelette. I wasn't sure if I was going to like it because I've never tried eggs with any "enchilada" sauce on them or eggs with any type of meat in them. It was really delicious! I wasn't a huge fan of the potatoes. I thought maybe they needed more seasonings. The restaurant is small but it feels like you are in a different part of the world. It also had a bar. I didn't order and alcoholic beverage but I noticed that they did have happy hour and they had a variety of different options for margaritas. I also did notice that the restaurant makes their own tortillas and you get to see the lady working hard to make them as you eat your food. The kitchen is out in the open which is always a nice thing to see. It means it's clean! Overall, I recommend this location to everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yi5nv-a_BgJ8fdFdvvMc1A.text: Breakfast during the 2nd day of the CES convention this week -arrived shortly after they opened around 8am without a reservation; no problem getting a table, and right on the canal.  My server was Udelle, service was prompt and excellent throughout my meal -had my coffee within 5min, ordered the Huevos BLT, arrived within 5min.  Didn't see the advertised chipotle crema on the BLT so asked for more on the side -got that within 3min.  The sandwich was good -a bit rich with that brioche bun.  Ranchero potatoes were over-spiced for my taste -heavily dusted with chili powder, cumin & salt.  Perhaps the asadero cheese potatoes offered with some of the other entrees are a better option.  My tab came to $19 incl tip -reasonable, considering I paid $13 the previous morning for Starbucks and a Subway breakfast sandwich to go!  Departed at 9am and tables were still available, so the hot tip for a sit down breakfast option during CES!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos BLT with Ranchero Potatoes

4Q1tgg5A7p4pcL2YLTbhTA.text: Came here for breakfast. We ordered Mexican pancakes and huevos rancheros. The service isn't very attentive and the food is just okay. One of our pancakes was under cooked in one spot and our two eggs on the huevos came out super overcooked even though we ordered over medium. I would recommend trying another spot for breakfast in the Venetian/palazzo or even walk over to the Wynn and go to the Terrace restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1v58rQXVwW5GD__vhkDS9Q.text: Delicious food in a pleasant atmosphere with excellent  service at a decent price.  What else can you all for?   Our waitress, Ariana, made the experience even better.  We'll be back. Thank you.

8bGCw9gQT95hMlWMbryqxA.text: This was our first visit to Canonitas in the Palazzo/Venetian Canal shops, and enjoyed the meal and service very much.  Open Table reservations worked great, and they accommodated the request for the desired table by the canal, and recognized our Anniversary celebration.  Front desk was very friendly and sat us promptly, followed quickly by our server greeting us.  There is a variety of choices for food, but don't expect the typically Mexican food, as there seems to be a originality to many of the dishes.  Started with Chips, Salsa, and Guacamole (this is menu item, not complimentary) with the Salsa having a slight smokiness which as very enjoyable.  Followed by a chicken tortillas soup, and entrees of Santa Rosa Barbacoa and Wilde Mushroom enchiladas.  Both entrees were delicious, and well seasoned.  Dessert followed with a traditional churros (Hot out of the fryer) and a non-traditional brownie and ice cream.  The churros dipping sauce was very tasty, not your typically chocolate sauce.  Overall, our server Juan and the management made our first visit memorable and very enjoyable, and we would plan to return again.  FYI - sitting on the patio next to the canal is very enjoyable, and maintains a good noise level that normal conversation can still be held.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant Week 2018 Lunch
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Santa Rosa Barbacoa
Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros with cinnammon cream dipping sauce, nice dessert. (Churros hot out of fryer, excellent!)

GiU2SNSYPvCq9TsKIDiqDA.text: Best margaritas on the Strip, pineapple infused plus great service - Thanks to Daniel Alba

fb492jTgohBKitS1UdYwUQ.text: Best margarita I've found on the strip so far. The only place I've tried that understands the correct mixing ratios, and as an expert margarita reviewer I'd say they are pretty dang good. Also the shop is in my favorite mall. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MYaVgHuXH5gvz9jTCj16AQ.text: Salsa & Guacamole - 4/5 - chipotle salsa, better than regular salsa with chunks of tomato and onion  Ahi tuna & polenta medallions - 2/5 - I don't know how to explain it but the tuna tasted like nothing and didn't seem fresh. Polenta medallions were mushed up into cake form and Pan fried so it had a crispy outside. It was tasty but texture wise I could only eat 1 of the 3 cause it was mushy  Vegetarian burrito - 3/3 - off the menu for my vegetarian cousin. Normal, nothing super exciting.  Liked the big chunks of veg. Huge burrito, should have just shared it and been fine. Comes with cilantro rice and black beans. I asked for a side of their poblano creamb sauce which was a good complement.   Service - 4/5 - nice waiter. Had to call him over a couple times so could have checked in on us a little more in a not super crowded restaurant.  But went out of his way to try to get pics of us with the gondola.  Hostess was very friendly as well.

b66KaTKKUcQkktpW-B9KiQ.text: This place is ridiculously slow. There's hardly anyone eating here and we've been here almost two hours, waiting on the check for at least 40 minutes...

Y22sFAbfURhXQL5HlDArrw.text: Had Ashley for our server during restaurant week.  Ashley was so great!  Great attention to details had great recommendations for places to go in Vegas, very personable and great to talk to.  We had a wonderful meal Food was amazing.  Have to try this in the Venetian.   Request Ashley when you get there.

b6-AdX5pOOhX8APCgxl9BA.text: A wonderful experience, as always!  The food is delicious, and the environment is fantastic. Fantastic view of the canal and we loved watching the boats go up and down the canal.   Special shoutout to Ashley, the best waitress ever!

u1AMeLwcShXU_HQ06tqfig.text: Very good food! Great chips, awesome guacamole and excellent service. All 6 of us loved what we ordered.

6JRqHozd7PIUL8AjB27I8A.text: This place is ALL about location. The place is gorgeous and you are right next to the gondolas. The food was good, enjoyable but for me not really *mexican* food. I think this place is more about the experience and yes the food is quality but just lacking in vibrant authentic flavor. The prices are high for what you are ultimately eating.   I wouldn't go back- but I had a nice experience and a fine dinner- I ate the mushroom enchiladas and ordered the salsa with guacamole. The service was nice and kind.   I would say my review is neutral and without negativity - perhaps I was just expecting more amazing flavor.

mXTjmAUgUybA9ol06i3Slg.text: I'm extremely picky about Mexican food, but when a work colleague was suggested to try this place we decided what the heck! I pursued the menu online and thought, queso fundido- oh yeah! I realized quickly the menu was from Mexico City, not "Americanized Mexican".   We made reservations for 4, the guacamole had a light kick, the queso fundido was awesome, I was happy to introduce it to my work friends who had never tried it before. We were seated on the patio next to the Gondola ride so it was a nice "people watching" place for sure.   I was torn between the chile relleno and the taco flight. I went with the chile relleno, it had a strong kick to it. I couldn't finish it. My friend had the taco flight and they looked AMAZING! Will have to try it next time I'm in town.   The michelada was not as expected but still tasted good.   And the coffee flan was a perfect ending to our night!

S6PpuiZ1ulM-vRjFKGncSg.text: This is my new favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. I got the huevos BLT and it was an awesome spicy spin on an old favorite. The blueberry iced tea was great too, not too sweet, could still taste the tea, which I love. A huge bonus was being able to sit right on the canal of The Venetian and watch the gondolas float by. A nice peaceful break from the chaos outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cLjP3P8Mxu4Bfbs5bhkM3Q.text: I am definitely giving 5 stars for the service! Nathan, our server was excellent, funny too! Very friendly hostess, manager even checked with our table and of course Nathan. Great food, the pork (Barbocoa) was the highlight.

ZsdMncHNUa5kviDURtiuxA.text: Pepsi!  Seems like the whole Venetian hotel is Pepsi :-(.  Breakfast here the yogurt was a no but the chilaquiles was awesome - kind of breakfast nachos with eggs and meat. Fattening but awesome and enough for two!  Claudia was a sweet and very helpful waitress.  Somehow this didn't post when I was there so here it is now.

vIPhJxpxsr5TJawJJFK6ew.text: This outfit to me is 5 stars, within their target market.  The food is fantastic, the portions are neither too small or too big, the service is impeccable, the view in Venetian is great on the faux canal, you can't go wrong.  If you wanna go wrong in Venetian go to the worse-location, ludicrously priced and portioned Aqua-Knox and land an arrogant waiter or slow cocktail waitress.    Canonita has delivered 5 stars repeatedly to me, co-workers and customers.

YTvx7ciSww3F4aQVgoj0Ww.text: The wild mushroom enchiladas are amazing. Chips, Salsa and Guac were great. The server was great. Only complaint, the girl that seated us was kind rude, I mean she seated us and all but acted as if she was doing us a favor ( you know 'feel privileged I'm letting you in' kinda way ). Also kinda expensive. But will go there again because of those enchiladas.

MaWv8Xbj2E7Yz8afCWH4-g.text: Very disappointed. ... We came here for there so called best micheladas. Omg by far the worse. It's nothing but lemon juice, Salt and beer. There's  no clamato or  Tabasco sauce or etc.there food had no flavor. But I do give them one star because it has an amazing view.

woRisnYfl97hq2peb2woQg.text: Very good. My husband ate the chicken burrito and I had fajitas.  The sides of rice and beans were excellent.  Ask for the jalapeno salsa.

L5I8xHdI3cvwAsz0p3Gv1Q.text: This place is situated along the Grand Canal Shoppes in the Venetian. My boyfriend's cousin recommended this place to us. Everything was pretty delicious.   We ordered the ceviche trio for $16. They were interesting ceviches to say the least. They were served with these airy tortilla triangles.   My boyfriend ordered the Mexico City beef enchiladas which came with black beans and cilantro rice. His plate was pretty tasty. But mine was definitely better. I ordered the wild mushroom enchiladas that came with beans and buttered rice. It was rich and decadent covered in this sinful green sauce. The mushrooms were soaked in this cream sauce that almost made me cry. I would come back here again for this dish alone.  Overall, it is overpriced Mexican food but then again everything you get from a Vegas casino is priced beyond its worth.

9qWMn7cSV-QnswQHHQTcog.text: I'm not one of those people who are too impressed by the fake sky and indoor canal in the venetian, so if that's interesting to you, you might enjoy this place more. I think the food here is good not great. We started with a queso appetizer and added jalapenos to it. It was just huge chunks of jalapeno and very little cheese and almost inedible.  For dinner I had the five tacos. The steak and pork were great, the fish was meh. $5 house margarita for happy hour was nice.   Good place to stop for a quick lunch but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

GyLxIQ-NjCglA2vX86iVpw.text: This restaurant was a great surprise to me. I was attracted by the menu posted outside for the Mexican ingredients in the dishes that are less common in the US. The dish I ordered (lobster tamales, ceviche, huitlacoche) was artfully presented and well-balanced, without being pretentious. A nice combo of savory, acid, sweet and spice.   Not only that, but I sat on the patio, along the canal, listening the gondola drivers with beautiful voices, enjoying an adult beverage. It encompassed all the culinary pleasures I was hoping for, as well as the Vegas kitsch that I expected.

eqR7MN2iBYd-kGGY0sPMFQ.text: This was my first time at this restaurant. My boss recommended it to me and was really excited to eat here with my friends and since its hard to find a good Mexican restaurant with Authentic Mexican food I was looking forward to it but we arrived like 5 minutes before closing and the blonde host was very rude and in a bad mood and didn't want to give us a table. She directed us to the bar when I specifically told her I wanted a table by the river. She insisted that they were about to close. The tall red head saw that she didn't want to seat us and she apologized and sat us at a table by the river. She was very nice and apologetic and explained the happy hour menu to us and gave us some drink recommendations. She gave us her name but I don't remember, Briana perhaps . But besides that  food was delicious and waitress was great.  Maybe next time I will make sure I am not there 5 minutes before close!

-gQts8R4HkDK1hGaCQ7B-g.text: Being in Nevada, I was looking fwd to down and dirty tacos and gauc.  The restaurant is a little fru fru probably catering to tourists who want more ambiance than qlty.  It's location is fabulous, right along the canals with the gondolas passing by.  Food was good, I had beef and chicken tacos, they were soft shell and didn't give an option for hard shell.  But it was ok...if you prefer more authentic, I think you need to go off the strip.

p_jJovzvgcoVP6E-AnFi3Q.text: For being located inside The Venetian, on the Canal, this place is pretty awesome.    $5 Happy Hour Margaritas.  $3 for Chips and Salsa and $8 for Chips, Salsa and Guac!  For this "neighborhood" that is a DEAL!  The food was all very fresh and tasted great.  The cilantro rice has a really great fresh taste to it.  My wife and I both had enchiladas ($18 I think).  They were really tasty and it was really nice to be able to have a meal for less than $50+.  I definitely recommend this place and will go there again next time I'm there.

wTtO-OxLcKTYgPxCBcmXeA.text: Enchiladas and fajitas were fresh and delicious. Service was great, even with a gluten allergy present. Fun ambiance at the midpoint of the gondola route in the Venetian shopping area.

WOT0R-gVwAbivPY8ICnErg.text: This place was pretty good! The salsa is different than your typical authentic Mexican restaurant and it wasn't spicy at all, but it had good flavor. Everything we ordered was good. My only complaint is that they charge for chips and salsa.

ftcXkNAF_tRxt6zo5sW7Gw.text: Amazing Mexican food. We had the chicken quesadilla and fish tacos. They were the best we've ever had. The chips and salsa to start were fresh and really good. Found a cilantro jalapeno margarita that my husband almost cried it was so good. Great place to go and prices were reasonable!

9yC57k8j-lJOz1DThdQy4A.text: We were staying at the Venetian and this restaurant had a coupon for 2 for 1 margaritas so we gave it a try. We started with the chips, salsa and guacamole which was very good. 2 of us shared the carne asada and eating too many chips and it was plenty. Our waiter was very good! We'll be back.

Cpy83Z8pL6PQ2pC25uw9QQ.text: Had the carne asada nortena plate and was impressed at how perfectly seasoned and made to order the steak was. I wasn't in love with the sides it came with though. The chips with salsa and guacamole is a must! I will definitely be back!  Great service and amazing ambience!

PMt8S3ZzkIh95yo5tt0elg.text: We enjoyed a delicous dinner at Taqueria Canonita. Our group had excellent service and everyone without exception raved about their dinners. My pescado veracruz  was outstanding. Guac and salsa several notches above what one normally gets.  The setting is in the Venetian canal area, We were there several hours,  the fake sky and lighting had me thinking it was 7-8 pm. I was a bit suprised to see it was 11 when we finished up our dinner.

Hsd6vUDfcXqgs7gRILUL_A.text: It was okay if you have no other choice for Mexican but I've had way better Mexican food! They're pricey and their big hit margaritas were good but nothing special. I had the enchiladas and the sauce that it had was different not your traditional enchiladas. The guacamole was alright just add a little extra lime juice, the place is really pretty by the canal that was the only nice part of it!

mJgMk1jc8k5pfUGH5GGJfA.text: We used open table to book a nice dinner for three, toward the end of a 12 day stay in Vegas.  My sisters and I really enjoy Mexican food, and the place was a lovely treat.  Although it's TOUGH to find it in the mix of all the other stores and restaraunts.  Overall a lovely meal, and 5$ cocktails were a nice surprise. :)

Wg76N-6Chv44bcoP4SjRfw.text: Good enough Mexican food at reasonable (for the Vegas Strip) prices. The location on the canal is very entertaining. I recommend the Watermelon margarita and recommend against the raspberry one.

_y06qwh1DQDW60DyE47ZIw.text: Came to Vegas for SHOT show and subsequently never left the Venetian.  Taqueria Canonita, you would  think being so close to the border and with so many people coming from LA to Vegas, they would have some great Mexican food.  I ordered the Santa Rosa Pork Barbacoa at the recommendation of the waiter.  As my stomach churned for that slow cooked, delicious pork, I was greeted with a fairly bland and very dry pork.  I would have been better off with Chipotle's barbacoa than what Canonita served up.  The empanadas that were ordered for the table were far from crispy and the guacamole that came with the tortilla chips were not fully mashed.  Far too many errors for a sit down restaurant to be any good.  On the plus side, the tequila helped me forget the awful food.

l_DDNtqIijW4t5pLyIrRrQ.text: OMG! We had breakfast on the canal, steak and eggs and bacon and eggs. You really can't mess up a classic breakfast of bacon and eggs. The Steak and eggs was good. Our waiter was attentive and asked throughout our meal if everything ok, without being annoying. The breakfast menu selection is very limited.   If you would like to enjoy the ambiance of the Venetian atmosphere then this is a great place. For a wider selection of breakfast dishes this is not the right restaurant.   Sometimes you just have to change it up and enjoy being in the moment.

Photo of Canonita - Las Vegas, NV, United States
